story:
The Music

Original music for the solo classical guitar inspired by Ralph Towner, Andrew York, Lenny Breau, Roland Dyens, Gene Bertoncini, and others. I honestly believe that these pieces can become embraced as new repertoire for guitarists everywhere.

For fellow guitar geeks: You'll appreciate the finely crafted tremolo pieces (including one in open C-minor tuning), the jazz-tinged pieces, and the 5-movement narrative suite that borrows it's harmonic language from modes rarely explored by classical guitar composers. 

 

The Monster Suite - with animated video

I'm especially proud of The Monster Suite. It's a 5-movement narrative suite about the plight of this monstrous creature. I've teamed up with SF-based artist Gabe Wexler (www.gabewexler.com) who will create an animated video that conveys the story. This video will be for sale, and I hope to be able to perform along with it in concerts. Excerpted from my program notes:

"In this suite I aim to convey a story of discrimination, of what it means to be different and have to fight for acceptance.

The brooding introductory movement sheds light on the birth of the monster. Young and dumb, our lead character finds his way into town, hoping to integrate into a society that is clearly not ready for him. The people of the town drive him away, afraid of this unsightly and seemingly threatening beast. The crestfallen creature retreats into hiding and plans an attack on the vile people. Upon his return to the city, the bumbling beast poorly attempts a half-hearted attack, realizing at that moment that he is truly incapable of living up to his reputation as a dangerous monster. The townspeople see that he is not dangerous at all but simply seeking acceptance and refuge. In his failure they see in him his distinctly human qualities, perhaps a reflection of their own shortcomings. The suite concludes with an uptempo dance in which the monster joins the townspeople in celebration of his acceptance into their society. My hope is that this will keep listeners on their toes and perhaps make them think of the monsters in their own lives who may just be harmless projections of their own fears and illusions."

If there are any other classical guitar composers in the world who are doing something like this, I'd like to meet them! I believe I'm providing contributors with an opportunity to participate in something truly unique. 

 

The Score

I will have a physical copy of the complete set of scores from this album available for purchase. 

 

Budget

I've always believed in the saying "Go big or go home". I plan to record the album at home or in a rented space, but the costs are still high for all of the other phases. For example, Gabe will have to labor for hours a day for over month to create the video. Costs of creating physical copies of CDs, DVDs, and books (score) are high as well. I don't want to divulge dollar amounts to respect the various artists involved, but here are some of the expenditures OTHER THAN recording and mixing, which I hope to do myself or with little help: 

Renting a space to record (possibly) 

Mastering 

Art Direction

CD Packaging/Duplication 

Score Duplication 

Animation and packaging/duplication for the DVD (not cheap, lots of work)

Fees (IndieGoGo, Paypal, etc)

If I'm able to go above my goal, I could: 

Hire a producer and/or engineer to ensure the highest soung quality

Hire a photography or invest more in art direction

Possibly add sketches from the Monster Suite video to the book of scores, and add a nicer cover 

 

Thank you for contributing to my project!

story:
Hi!  We're Breaking 27! 

We are a rock band from Southern California.  We're in the middle of our anti- bully school tour, and it couldn't be going any better!  We're visiting a different school every day, meeting tons of great kids and teachers and feel like we're really making a difference! 

The assembly we put together consists of a discussion about the bullying problem, along with suggestions on how to deal with it. The main point we drive home to the students is that if you see bullying happening to someone else, or if you're dealing with it yourself - you need to SAY SOMETHING.  Tell an adult, a teacher, a parent… someone who can help the situation.  If kids continue to just ignore the problem and keep it to themselves, it will never improve and could take a turn for the worst- as we learned from the movie "Bully".

Our school assembly then leads into a 3 song performance by our band Breaking 27.  We end our set with the song called "We Like To Watch" - that's our original song we created specifically about the bully problem. In some schools, we've been able to show the music video as well! Everyone really seems to respond to it!

Thanks to our many generous supporters out there, when our first tour is over, we will have visited 14 schools, delivering our anti-bully message to approximately 14,000 students!  From both students and teachers we've been getting an overwhelming response!  So much so, that we want to keep the momentum going and visit more schools!  We would like to double the number of schools we visit, bringing the total number of schools to 28, and  reaching approximately 28,000 kids!

 

Hey - that's a lot of money you're asking for... Where's it all going? 

Yes, it is a lot of money! But this is what we have been told a tour like this is going to need.  The money will go to things like:

  1. Tour Bus (depending on funding and location)
  2. Gas
  3. Food
  4. Insurance
  5. Equipment
  6. Educational Materials
  7. Hotels (depending on funding and location)
  8. Studio Teacher

Our band BREAKING 27 will make absolutely no profit on this tour.  All money collected will go to funding the tour. 

 
Who Are We?

We are BREAKING 27. We're a rock/pop band consisting of 5 kids aged 11-13 from Southern California.  We've been together for approximately 3 years and have played many gigs, including several famous clubs on the Sunset Strip in Hollywood. "We Like To Watch" is our 5th original song. We hope to eventually create enough songs to release our first CD, as well as champion other causes we feel strongly about.

 

Thank You!

It would be so cool if you could help us expand our reach.  It feels like this is the time to do whatever we can to eradicate this problem.  It seems like bullying has been happening forever, but now I think we're all realizing that it's wrong for kids to stand around and watch them hurt each other.  Help us take a stand and send a message that this behavior is just not ok in our society.

story:
The Palestine Youth Orchestra was established by the Edward Said National Conservatory of Music (ESNCM), with the vision of bringing together young Palestinian musicians from around the world, to form a quality ensemble on a par with similar groups internationally. To date, the PYO has performed in Italy, Jordan, Greece, Lebanon, Syria, Germany, Bahrain and Palestine. 

In July 2012, the PYO completed its most ambitious project to date. Following a week of intensive rehearsals at the Conservatorio Pagnini in Genoa, the PYO performed at five leading concert venues and music festivals, travelling from the North to the South of Italy. The orchestra performed at venues including the Teatro Carlo Felice, Genoa and the Conservatorio Nazionale di Santa Cecilia in Rome, as well as the festivals of Florenece, Levanto and Ravello. Alongside Beethoven’s Symphony no. 8 and Rimsky Korsakov’s Spanish Capriccio Espagnol, the PYO accompanied the young Palestinian soprano Dima Bawab in two beautiful orchestral songs by Delibes and Dvorak. In keeping with their promise to promote the best of new Arabic music, the programme also featured music from two emerging Syrian composers: Kinan Azmeh’s contemplative and inspiring November 22nd was excellently performed by the young Palestinian clarinetist Mohamed Najem, and the orchestra was delighted to welcome the brilliant violinist Maias Al Yamani, to perform as soloist in his own piece, Sea Waves, for Arabic violin and orchestra. In recognition of Palestine being it's most recent member, and in respect of Palestine's recent cultural landmark achievements, the PYO received patronage from the Italian National Commission of UNESCO in 2012 for it's tour of Italy. 

 
In 2013 the PYO is bringing it's talent home to Palestine, having successfully received funding from the European Union. The orchestra will perform in Palestinian towns and cities, before repeating the programme in Jordan,Abu Dhabi, Dubai and Busan (South Korea). 

MEMBERS OF THE PYO

Every year, approximately 75 young musicians take part in the PYO. Performers are between 13-26 years of age, with roughly equal numbers of female and male participants. Participants range from young music students studying at Palestinian music schools, advanced students studying outside Palestine, young people studying or working in other fields who have continued to play and study music as a hobby, and young professional musicians who have continued to benefit from participating in the PYO in the early years of their professional music careers. Students living inside Palestine, are joined by students from the Palestinian refugee diaspora, including those living inJordan, Lebanon, Syria, Algeria and Egypt, as well as further afield. The ESNCM often works with partner organisations in other countries, to organise exchange programmes for students who gain a unique insight into Palestinian culture, and get to know young musicians from Palestine, often forming lasting and valuable friendships. In 2012 exchanges were completed with the conservatoires of Rome and Genoa. 

EXPERT COACHING

Students in each section of the orchestra spend time away from full rehearsals, to be guided by expert coaches, including leading symphony orchestra musicians and soloists. In 2012, the PYO launched a new partnership with the Oslo Philharmonic Orchestra, who will sent three of their musicians to guide the young musicians towards their final performances. The Norwegian professionals were joined by professors from the conservatoires of Rome and Genoa, and were led by the English conductor Sian Edwards, a former music director of English National Opera, who has appeared with the orchestra in four separate years. 

UNIQUE PROGRAMMING

Still only in its first decade, the PYO has a reputation as a leading promoter of Palestinian and Arabic orchestral music. The orchestra has commissioned new music by leading Arab composers and regularly delivers acclaimed performances of music already familiar to Arabic audiences, widening the popularity of this music from their home region and out to the wider world. The PYO has recently worked with composers such as Marcel Khalife, Kinan Azmeh, Ahmad al-Khattib, Maias Al Yamani, Issa Boulos, Roger Johansson, Rima Tarazi and John Bisharat, and performed revivals of popular music by the Rahbani brothers, Samih Shkeir and others. Alongside Arabic music, the PYO has performed some of the most beautiful and advanced orchestral works in treh Western repertoire, having recently programmed music by Beethoven, Dvorak, Rimsky-Korsakov, Brahms, Tchaikovsky, Haydn, Shostakovich, Katchaturian and Gershwin.
 
http://occupiedpalestine.wordpress.com/2013/03/22/palestine-youth-orchestra-a-bridge-to-the-world-by-docjazzmusic/

story:
Hello friends, family, and strangers looking to support Olympic athletes. You've come to the right place. 

We are The Gold Medalists, Bay Area based indie-rock group. We’ve been playing and recording music for a few years now - DIY style. We play music because we love it. We don't make money off it, but we continue to do it because we live, breath, sleep, bleed music. We're looking for your help! 

We recorded our first LP in 2013 called Versus Tigers, funded by us. It’s on iTunes but if you contribute towards our new album, we'll give you Versus Tigers as part of the deal. 

Also, because you're so nice and visited our Indiegogo page, you can download our self-titled EP (2012) right now for free right here: http://goo.gl/MoiUY

SO WHAT’S THE DEAL? 

We have ten new songs that we really like. We think they rock….like sitting on a wild mechanic bull while being pelted with frozen mint-chocolate chip ice cream cones by a team of professional puppeteers drinking from a broken bottle of Black Label. We want to get back into the studio, record new music and unleash it into the world. The album is called, Versus the Sea. We have no cover art yet (wink wink artist friends). 

We're asking for $3,000 which doesn't even cover all our recording expenses (recording, mixing, mastering) but we're just looking for a bit of help. Also, our singer quit his 9-year job so he's a bum now and would totally appreciate any contributions. But even more importantly, we know our friends and family love us and have bought our previous albums because they want to support us. But rather than paying Apple or any other digital music services out there, which they take most of the money and we don't see a dime (or maybe we only see a dime), you can give the full amount of the album to us. Cut the middleman. Everyone wins! Praise the Internet! 

If we raise more than $3K, we'll look at spending it on: 

1. $3,000 = Funded! Helps us pay for most of the recording costs
2. $4,500 = Recording studio costs and mixing/mastering paid in full! 
3. $5,000 = We'll make CDs (does anyone still buy CDs?!!!); or maybe we'll make vinyl or mini-disks or cassette tapes or VHS tapes or hyper color band t -shirts
4. $10,000 = We'll hire Steve Albini to help record, if he's into it.... Or we'll spend the left-over money making a cool music video
6. $100,000 = We'll do everything above, spend more time in the studio to make a great record, and maybe buy some ice cream sandwiches. 

At this point, you're probably wondering what risks are involved in completing this project. 

Well, the songs are basically written. So unless one of us gets into a fist fight with a giraffe, we fall of the edge of this flat planet, or NASA warp drives us to Mega-Earth, we should be okay to record this album by year-end.

We'll keep you updated on our progress and how much time we spend playing music vs playing video games.

Thanks for reading and thanks for supporting us. 


THE GOLD MEDALISTS BIO

In 2008, The Gold Medalists was formed as an eclectic musical side project of Bay Area musician Peter Van Nguyen (Ee, Total Shutdown). The two-man group (with Stanley Lam of Scrabbel, Largesse) spent the following years adding new members and honing their craft, ultimately arriving at a sound that's as comfortable with round melodies as it is with angular guitar strokes. Settling into a line-up consisting of Nguyen on vocals and guitar, Alex Charlow on bass, Jason Cornwell on lead guitar, and Steve Hinan on drums, the indie-rock band headed into the studio in early 2013 to record their first full-length album, "Versus Tigers." 

The Gold Medalists rarely perform outside of San Francisco and have found a loyal Bay Area fan base consisting mostly of nerds, video game writers, marketers, and programmers, as well as friends, family, and occasionally a group of heckling drunks. 

The group believes in the DIY philosophy and have played and recorded music on their own dime to share what they love with the world. Keep it simple. Keep the music alive.  

In the fall of 2014, The Gold Medalists will head into the SF studio, Tiny Telephone, to record their second full-length album.

story:
Bonjour,

Voilà, c'est officiel, mon EP se transforme en ALBUM !!! Un premier extrait sortira ce printemps et l'album sera lancé cet automne. Un gros merci de prendre un moment pour m'aider et contribuer à votre façon, soit en profitant de la prévente, en partageant dans votre réseau ou en achetant une contrepartie. Tout est plus que bienvenu ! Je vous réserve du beau et des surprises en échange, ainsi que toute ma reconnaissance.  Maritza Xxx

* Comme ma campagne est déjà commencée, je ne peux pas modifier les contreparties. Quand il est mention de EP, cela fait référence à l'album, vous en aurez donc plus pour votre argent :))


PRÉSENTATION

Depuis toujours, la musique trouve un profond écho en moi. Puissant véhicule d'émotions, elle est devenue vitale à mon équilibre. C'est à travers elle que j'exprime ma sensibilité, mon rapport à moi-même et au monde. En 2012, avec l'aide de plusieurs collaborateurs, je me dévoilais comme auteure-compositrice-interprète avec un premier EP autoproduit. Depuis, j'ai eu la chance d'obtenir des bourses du Conseil des arts et lettres du Québec et du Conseil des arts au Canada pour me soutenir dans ma création. J'ai aussi été invitée à participer à plusieurs événements et vitrines (Francofolies, Coup de Coeur Francophone, Francouvertes, Festival Vue sur le Relève, Festival en chanson de Petite-Vallée), et à ma grande surprise, récolter quelques prix au passage.


ALBUM 2016
Après avoir plongé dans des univers folk et aériens avec un premier EP et, plus récemment, avec la formation Lisbonne Télégramme, je ressens le besoin d’explorer un espace différent, plus groovy, soul, donnant au corps le goût de s’exprimer, mais faisant aussi place à la voix et aux émotions. La sortie de l'album est prévue pour septembre 2016. À la fameuse question "C'est quel genre?", je pourrais répondre que ça ressemble à une rencontre entre Norah Jones, Massive Attack et DarkSide.
 
PRÉVENTE

En plus du soutien de Musicaction et de mon investissement personnel, je fais appel à vous afin de permettre au projet d'avoir le financement nécessaire  pour la production et la promotion ! Je vous invite donc à vous procurer mon album en pré-vente et ainsi m'aider à payer une partie des frais (réalisation, studio, prise de son, musiciens, mix, mastering, graphisme, impression et duplication des disques, pistage radio, relations de presse, photos, affiches, vidéoclip, lancement). 

PRODUCTION

Enregistrement au Studio The Treatment Room avec:

José Major - Réalisation et batterie  /  Philippe Brault - Basse

Benoît Morier - Guitares  /  François Richard - Claviers

Marise Demers - Tamboa, kalimba  / Amylie Boisclair - Coaching (écriture et voix)

Ghyslain-Luc Lavigne - Son et mix


PROMOTION

Relations de presse - Philippe Renault, Mauvaises Influences

Distribution - Believe  /  Vidéo - Jean-Vital Joliat 

Gérance - Luca Pharand, Productions la ligne jaune

MERCI !!! 

Pour toutes questions, n'hésitez pas: maritzamusique@hotmail.com
story_txt:
Bonjour,


Voilà, c'est officiel, mon EP se transforme en ALBUM !!! Un premier extrait sortira ce printemps et l'album sera lancé cet automne. Un gros merci de prendre un moment pour m'aider et contribuer à votre façon, soit en profitant de la prévente, en partageant dans votre réseau ou en achetant une contrepartie. Tout est plus que bienvenu ! Je vous réserve du beau et des surprises en échange, ainsi que toute ma reconnaissance.  Maritza Xxx
* Comme ma campagne est déjà commencée, je ne peux pas modifier les contreparties. Quand il est mention de EP, cela fait référence à l'album, vous en aurez donc plus pour votre argent :))

PRÉSENTATION

Depuis toujours, la musique trouve un profond écho en moi. Puissant véhicule d'émotions, elle est devenue vitale à mon équilibre. C'est à travers elle que j'exprime ma sensibilité, mon rapport à moi-même et au monde. En 2012, avec l'aide de plusieurs collaborateurs, je me dévoilais comme auteure-compositrice-interprète avec un premier EP autoproduit. Depuis, j'ai eu la chance d'obtenir des bourses du Conseil des arts et lettres du Québec et du Conseil des arts au Canada pour me soutenir dans ma création. J'ai aussi été invitée à participer à plusieurs événements et vitrines (Francofolies, Coup de Coeur Francophone, Francouvertes, Festival Vue sur le Relève, Festival en chanson de Petite-Vallée), et à ma grande surprise, récolter quelques prix au passage.



ALBUM 2016



Après avoir plongé dans des univers folk et aériens avec un premier EP et, plus récemment, avec la formation Lisbonne Télégramme, je ressens le besoin d’explorer un espace différent, plus groovy, soul, donnant au corps le goût de s’exprimer, mais faisant aussi place à la voix et aux émotions. La sortie de l'album est prévue pour septembre 2016. À la fameuse question "C'est quel genre?", je pourrais répondre que ça ressemble à une rencontre entre Norah Jones, Massive Attack et DarkSide.

 

PRÉVENTE



En plus du soutien de Musicaction et de mon investissement personnel, je fais appel à vous afin de permettre au projet d'avoir le financement nécessaire  pour la production et la promotion ! Je vous invite donc à vous procurer mon album en pré-vente et ainsi m'aider à payer une partie des frais (réalisation, studio, prise de son, musiciens, mix, mastering, graphisme, impression et duplication des disques, pistage radio, relations de presse, photos, affiches, vidéoclip, lancement). 



PRODUCTION

Enregistrement au Studio The Treatment Room avec:

José Major - Réalisation et batterie  /  Philippe Brault - Basse
Benoît Morier - Guitares  /  François Richard - Claviers
Marise Demers - Tamboa, kalimba  / Amylie Boisclair - Coaching (écriture et voix)
Ghyslain-Luc Lavigne - Son et mix

PROMOTION
Relations de presse - Philippe Renault, Mauvaises Influences
Distribution - Believe  /  Vidéo - Jean-Vital Joliat 
Gérance - Luca Pharand, Productions la ligne jaune

MERCI !!! 


Pour toutes questions, n'hésitez pas: maritzamusique@hotmail.com

story:
#Graduation Album Release Campaign

What We Need & What You Get

Here is an Idea of what I need and what you can get out of supporting!


1.Funding my album will include quite a few expenses.
I am able to record for free, but mixing and mastering of the actual songs still costs quite a bit of money. Also I won't just release this album as a track list I want to shoot music videos for most of the songs on the project.
These won't be high priced shoots but they do cost about 400$ each plus traveling, cast & location all these things take a huge Mike Tyson right hook to the bank statements.
Not to mention photo shoots, cover designs, printing of the actual albums and a whole lot more expenses, It will definitely be hard for me to fund this alone.
Therefore if  you are a supporter and in a good enough situation to donate even the minimum will mean a lot to me!


2.Here are things we will give back to the people who chose to donate!
A donation of:
10$ will give you a pre order of a digital copy of the album!
(meaning you will receive all the songs on the album and artwork in digital form directly to your email before anyone else hears it)

20$ will give you a pre order of a digital & a signed physical copy!
You will first receive the digital copy by email before the actual release. & when the physical copies are available (June 23rd) you will receive one signed and sent by mail!

50$ will give you a pre order of a digital and signed physical copy!
1 T-Shirt with the album cover & L.A.F logo & sponsor credits in the album booklet!

100$ will give you a pre order of a digital and signed physical copy!
1 T-Shirt with the album cover & L.A.F logo, sponsor credits in the album booklet & a personal message written by myself right under your name as a thank you! IF YOU'RE AN ARTIST AND YOU DONATE 100$ OR MORE YOU RECEIVE ALL OF THE ABOVE AND 1 FEATURE (Verse or Hook) AND WE CAN WORK ON IT AS SOON AS YOU DONATE!


3.If we don't reach our goal of 1500$ in 60 days the proceeds will all still be spent on production for the album!

The Impact

Why is this important to me? & what impact will it have on both me and my supporters?

  • This album will definitely the launch of my career in music.
    The final version of this album will be my best work to date and I believe along with many other people who believe as well that with the proper work ethic and reasonable budget this project can take me to the next level!
    & you would be a huge part SHARING AND LIKING MY MUSIC IS ENOUGH HELP FOR ME of my success if you did donate!
    EVEN IF YOU DO NOT DONATE JUST TO CONTINUE TO SUCCEED I LOVE YOU ALL SO MUCH!
  • I will have songs featuring the best artists from around the country and hopefully some artists with considerably bigger names you may have heard of!
  • For you to be sure that this money is going to where I say it is going!
    I will post frequent updates of purchases, video & photo shoots, and anything related to the album. This is not so I can have fun and have free money this is so I can build something amazing to give back to all of you who have been supporting! Thank you all once again!

Risks & Challenges

 It is hard to always have everything done the way you want.
We may experience challenges along the way that's true, but what is life without risks? if we didn't put our all into things we believed in we would stop believing!
So what if you fail 1000 times? you try your best to get back up again and go 1000 times harder cause you experienced it and you know why you failed.

  • I've seen too many of you supporting me and believing in me for me to not do something and take this even further! And if in the end we get this project seen or in the hands of the right people... Then we will know for sure that dreams do come true!
  • I will not stop until I make it to where I'm headed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Like , Share & Participate!
    Not everyone has money to give away. Pretty much the reason why I'm doing this!

And that's all there is to it.
I love you all and once again thank you so much for the continuous support!
Blessings!

story:
Hi ! We are Sunday Night Syndrome, an Electro-Pop trio from Lyon, France.

You can listen to our single in this video clip: 



WE NEED YOU !

We're currently working on our first EP that will be released next June! 
There will be 5 tracks on the record.
You can be a part of this project by pre-ordering it ! this way you'd be helping us with the costs relative to its production:

That is essentially mixing and mastering costs as well as the pressing of the CD, the rest being Indiegogo fee and other small fees.

       



                               


Every participation will be a huge help for us! 

If the campaign goes further than the chosen goal, we'll be making other videos, the more we obtain the better quality the videos will be, we're hoping to make a very big one for one of the track !

We hope to release a high quality record, we're doing everything we can to obtain a result we'll be forever pride of!

That being said, no matter what happens with this campaign we'll go to the very end of the production, so if you pre-order the EP (digital or physical), or merchandising, you're certain to receive it in June.

One more thing, if you like our music please share this project to your friends or wherever you can, we'd really appreciate that! It can be a game changer :)

Follow us to receive news about the band, teasers, behind the scenes photos and videos etc...
https://www.facebook.com/SNSfr
@SNSlyon
https://instagram.com/snslyon/


En Français

Nous sommes actuellement en train d'enregistrer notre premier EP, qui contiendra 5 titres et qui sera disponible courant Juin.

Pour aller au bout de ce projet nous avons besoin de vous !

En effet ceci est une autoproduction, c'est à dire que le groupe finance entièrement les divers frais liés à la réalisation de cet enregistrement.


Votre participation sera consacrée à régler le mixage et le mastering(représentant 70% de la somme espérée) et à payer le pressage du CD (20%), le reste étant la part que prend le site Indiegogo, et divers autres frais (déplacements, frais d'envoi etc).

Si le montant fixé est dépassé, le reste des fonds sera utilisé dans la réalisation d'autres clips vidéos, nous avons notamment l'espoir d'en produire une avec une équipe technique qualifiée.

Vous pouvez également prendre part à ce projet en faisant écouter notre musique et en partageant cette page à tous ceux qui l'apprécierait !

Ce point sera déterminant ! 


                    



Nous vous remercions d'avance pour votre implication, nous mettons tout en oeuvre pour vous délivrer un résultat de qualité ! 


Le trio -SNS-


Suivez nous sur les réseaux sociaux pour recevoir des news à propos de l'avancement de ce projet !

https://www.facebook.com/SNSfr

@SNSlyon

https://instagram.com/snslyon/

story:
I have been drumming, teaching and creating music for the past 20 years. 
In point form, here are some highlights.

-Traveled to Guinea West Africa to study djembe with Fatouabou Camara. (Canada Council for the Arts),

-Was invited to Beijing China to participate and perform at the International tourism  festival.

-For the past 11 years i have facilitated the WestFest Tam-Tam in Ottawa.

-Recorded, funded and released a CD as Dr Lee and The Sufi Girl.

-Organized my own djembe workshops.

-I have taught djembe in many schools and events in Ottawa/Gatineau.


What We Need & What You Get

For many years I have dreamed of a space and location where I can teach and create music freely without having to schedule, ask permission and simply keep the peace with neighbours and other tenants. That day has finally arrived.

Dr. Lee Percussion Centre: A  space for learning drumming, recording, producing and learning about electronic beats and samplers.

I have invested 4000$ of my own money into the school so far.

Funding will be used to finish the renovations, designs and marketing


    The Impact

    For the better part of my adult life I have wanted a space like this. 
    Because of that, I will do everything to make it grow and stay.



      Risks & Challenges


      As for the potential risks and challenges, I will deal with them step by step in a intelligent systematic manner if they arise. 
      One thing is for sure there will not be any noise complaints which has always been a issue in the past. (-;


        Other Ways You Can Help

        Spread the word please and you can also donate time by helping with painting and other various renovations. 

        Looking for visual artists including graffiti artist to do some murals by donation. 

        Thank you  Dr. Lee

story:
We Want to Play in Your TOWN!

We have connected with SOW many people online and through our concerts here in Texas and we have LOVED every second of it! However, we are now at a point where we just need a more efficient way of travel; WE NEED A VAN!

  • SOW we can play concerts in your town outside of Texas!
  • SOW we can continue to spread the message of positivity
  • SOW we can meet more awesome people like we have in the last year and encourage them to pursue their dreams!

The Van is Just the Beginning!

  • WE have made several unique little gimme's for you in return for your INCREDIBLY GENEROUS donations. From running with a gallon of milk in our bellies to giving you EXCLUSIVE NEW MUSIC that NO ONE else will get to hear
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will still use all the money donated to fund the van! That is the first and most important thing, because we really just want to get out there!
  • The VAN is just the beginning! We want to use this van to travel to see you, to hang out with you, to get to know YOU better! Telling you to follow your dream is awesome from Twitter, it's better if we can say it to your face!
  • The money goes to the van, the maintenance and insurance costs. 

The Impact

Helping us get a van isn't just a way to get us out to your town, but it's to help the next guy or girl that is struggling with the same thing that you are struggling with.

Wouldn't you want someone to donate to your cause if they could? 

Helping us get a van helps us get out to see more people and encourage them to pursue their dreams and realize just how beautiful and important they are; just as we have encouraged you. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not have money but THAT IS OKAY! We're not just asking for money, we're asking for your support!

Take a video selfie of yourself and put it on vine, on instagram, on youtube, get your friends to do it with you, make signs, and help us promote this campaign! If you need our help or if you want to suggest an idea to it, PLEASE PLEASE DO! 

If you can't donate money but you still want to help, please HELP US by DONATING YOUR TIME and YOUR WORDS! Those of us that know who we are, know what we're about. Tell your friends, get your friends to tell their friends! Want us to send you some stickers to aide in the effort?! NO PROBLEM! Just send us your address, we will send you stickers! 

We aren't just throwing up a video with incentives hoping someone will donate, we are willing to work hard for this too! Help us manage and promote this campaign and be a part of our team!

Thank you in advance, we have AMAZING supporters and we are INCREDIBLY GRATEFUL for everything you guys do on a daily basis!

story:
Background

Eight years ago, my young son and daughter were taking piano lessons.  Both were doing very well, but my daughter really displayed a talent for music, so I decided to buy a piano.  We generated a lot of good Father/Daughter memories shopping for a grand piano, and, it seemed like she played every brand on the planet, new and used.  After concluding we could only afford a used piano, it quickly became apparent that cracked and collapsed soundboards were common in used pianos. 

As an engineer, I set out to learn everything I could about piano brands, history, construction, and technology.  What I learned is that the piano has not significantly changed in 130 years.  Here is a picture of the first piano ever built.

Look familiar?!  The very first piano ever built looks almost exactly like so-called modern pianos.

Project Goals

This might sound mushy, but, 3 of 4 of the team members are 50+ years old, and we are looking for a way to use our talents to make an enduring and positive mark on the world.  If we can create a piano that is dramatically better than anything that exists today, we can project a tool for making beautiful music into the future.  This is our basic motivation for doing this project.

The goal of the Evolutionary Piano Project is to build the most technologically advanced custom grand piano in the world with an expanded compass, all the latest technologies, and most importantly, a ribless, carbon fiber soundboard, optimized with evolutionary computing techniques.  Why?

Unlike wood, carbon fiber is unaffected by moisture, so it will sound the same, stay in tune longer, and never collapse or crack. The superior properties of carbon fiber should make the best soundboard possible, and allow the reinforcing ribs on all wooden soundboards to be completely eliminated, vastly improving the treble. 

We are most excited about using evolutionary computing techniques to discover the optimum shape and material properties of a piano soundboard.  For manufacturing convenience, piano soundboards follow the shape of the case and the scale.  Why on earth did anybody think that shape would result in optimum acoustic performance?

Answer: they didn't think!  It was just easier to build that way.  Instead, imagine a soundboard evolving in a computer the way living organisms evolve in nature, perfectly adapting to its environment and performing its purpose.  When this project is finished, we will all finally get to see and hear what a perfect piano soundboard looks and sounds like!

Project Plan

I have used my mechanical engineering background to create a project plan that begins with a series of computer simulations that will deliver the optimum shape and material properties of a piano soundboard.  That data will be used to build up to 3 composite soundboards.  David Rubenstein, of Rubenstein Pianos, will build a custom 10 foot grand piano using this soundboard.  Delwin Fandrich, the legendary piano engineer will design the scale and guide the project to success with his decades of experience. 

In addition to the carbon fiber soundboard.....bridge agraffes, a welded-steel string plate, and a monolithic stack of laminated panels , all optimized for maximum stiffness and minimum weight, will replace the traditional cast iron plate and inner rim-and-strut construction. Wessel, Nickel and Gross actions with glass and carbon fiber reinforced parts will provide consistent, high performance.

Finally, an expanded compass beyond the normal 88 keys will push this piano to the current limits of modern design and materials, and issue a challenge to piano composer’s to write for it, and piano performers to play it.  If you are a jazz pianist, imagine improvising on a piano with 102 keys. All of these features will combine to yield quite possibly the most technologically advanced piano in the world, and a design process to adapt any piano to Evolutionary Piano carbon fiber composite soundboard technology.

The rewards are:

  1. Frequent project updates ($5, no limit)
  2. Audio files comparing the Evolutionary Piano with a Steinway Model D plus reward 1 ($25, no limit)
  3. An Evolutionary Piano Paracord Bracelet plus rewards 1-2 ($50, Limit: 1000)
  4. A DVD of a documentary by film maker Harry Bramley Davenport of the development of the Evolutionary Piano plus rewards 1-3 ($250, Limit: 1000)
  5. An invitation to one of several receptions around the country to hear and play the Evolutionary Piano plus rewards 1-4 ($1000, Limit: 500) 
  6. A 2-hour professional audio/video recording session conducted by Harry Bramley Davenport of you playing the Evolutionary Piano or David Rubenstein's 12 foot 2 inch R-371.  You will receive a professionally edited video you can use on your personal website to promote your music career.

The piano came into its own during a time of slow, expensive, build-it-and-break-it design cycles, way before computer optimization.  The consensus seems to be that the piano was perfected 130 years ago, and is as good as it can be.  We find that attitude to be close-minded and repulsive!  Nothing built with 130 year-old technology is as good as it can be!  Let's face it, piano manufacturers are never going to take any genuine risks to improve their product.  If piano enthusiasts like us don't fund this project, the world may never see and hear what modern materials and computer optimization can do for pianos.  Let's break this cycle together.  Please contribute to this project, and, LET THE EVOLUTION BEGIN!
story_txt:
BackgroundEight years ago, my young son and daughter were taking piano lessons.  Both were doing very well, but my daughter really displayed a talent for music, so I decided to buy a piano.  We generated a lot of good Father/Daughter memories shopping for a grand piano, and, it seemed like she played every brand on the planet, new and used.  After concluding we could only afford a used piano, it quickly became apparent that cracked and collapsed soundboards were common in used pianos.  As an engineer, I set out to learn everything I could about piano brands, history, construction, and technology.  What I learned is that the piano has not significantly changed in 130 years.  Here is a picture of the first piano ever built.Look familiar?!  The very first piano ever built looks almost exactly like so-called modern pianos.Project GoalsThis might sound mushy, but, 3 of 4 of the team members are 50+ years old, and we are looking for a way to use our talents to make an enduring 
and positive mark on the world.  If we can create a piano that is dramatically better than anything that exists today, we can project a tool 
for making beautiful music into the future.  This is our basic motivation for doing this project.The goal of the Evolutionary Piano Project is to build the most technologically advanced custom grand
 piano in the world with an expanded compass, all the latest technologies, and most importantly, a ribless, carbon fiber soundboard, optimized with
 evolutionary computing techniques.  Why? Unlike wood, carbon fiber is unaffected by moisture, 
so it will sound the same, stay in tune longer, and never collapse or crack. The 
superior properties of carbon fiber should make the best soundboard possible, and allow the 
reinforcing ribs on all wooden soundboards to be completely 
eliminated, vastly improving the treble. 
 We are most excited about using evolutionary computing techniques 
to discover the optimum shape and material properties of a piano 
soundboard.  For manufacturing convenience, piano soundboards follow the shape of the case and the scale.  Why on earth did anybody think 
that shape would result in optimum acoustic performance?Answer: they 
didn't think!  It was just easier to build that way.  
Instead, imagine a soundboard evolving in a computer the way living 
organisms evolve in nature, perfectly adapting to its environment and performing its purpose.  When this project is finished, we will all finally get to see and hear what a perfect piano
 soundboard looks and sounds like!Project PlanI have used my mechanical engineering 
background to create a project plan that begins with a series of 
computer simulations that will deliver the optimum shape and material 
properties of a piano soundboard.  That data will be used to build up to
 3 composite soundboards.  David Rubenstein, of Rubenstein Pianos, will 
build a custom 10 foot grand piano using this soundboard.  Delwin 
Fandrich, the legendary piano engineer will design the scale and guide the project to success
 with his decades of experience.  In addition to the carbon fiber soundboard.....bridge agraffes, a welded-steel string plate, and a monolithic stack of laminated panels , all optimized for maximum stiffness 
and minimum weight, will replace the traditional cast iron plate and  
inner rim-and-strut construction.  Wessel, Nickel and Gross actions with
 glass and carbon fiber reinforced parts will provide consistent, high 
performance. Finally, an expanded compass beyond the normal 88 keys
 will push this piano to the current limits of modern design and 
materials, and issue a challenge to piano composer’s to write for it, and piano performers to play it.  If you are a jazz pianist, imagine improvising on a piano with 102 keys.  
All of these features will combine to yield quite possibly the most 
technologically advanced piano in the world, and a design process to 
adapt any piano to Evolutionary Piano carbon fiber composite soundboard technology.The rewards are:
Frequent project updates ($5, no limit)
Audio files comparing the Evolutionary Piano with a Steinway Model D plus reward 1 ($25, no limit) 
An Evolutionary Piano Paracord Bracelet plus rewards 1-2 ($50, Limit: 1000)
A DVD of a documentary by film maker Harry Bramley Davenport of the development of the Evolutionary Piano plus rewards 1-3 ($250, Limit: 1000)
An invitation to one of several receptions around the country to hear and play the Evolutionary Piano plus rewards 1-4 ($1000, Limit: 500)  
A 2-hour professional audio/video recording session conducted by Harry Bramley Davenport of you playing the Evolutionary Piano or David Rubenstein's 12 foot 2 inch R-371.  You will receive a professionally edited video you can use on your personal website to promote your music career.
The
 piano came into its own during a time of slow, expensive, 
build-it-and-break-it design cycles, way before computer optimization.  The consensus seems to be that the piano was perfected 130 years ago, and 
is as good as it can be.  We find that attitude to be close-minded 
and repulsive!  Nothing built with 130 year-old technology is as good as it can 
be!  Let's face it, piano 
manufacturers are never going to take any genuine risks to improve their
 product.  If piano enthusiasts like us don't fund this project, the world may 
never see and hear what modern materials and computer optimization can do for pianos. 
 Let's break this cycle together.  Please contribute to this project, 
and, LET THE EVOLUTION BEGIN!

story:
Who We Are:

We are Midnight Raid, a bunch of like-minded musicians who have found each other and our groove in Oakland, CA!  We believe in two things: making good music and making a positive difference in our community.  Both of these take a huge amount of collaboration to accomplish.  We are hoping you’ll help us with our dual goal of raising enough funds to finish our debut studio album and donate $1000 (or more) to People’s Grocery, a non-profit organization fighting for food security in areas of Oakland lacking reasonable access to healthy food.

What We Need & What You Get:

Our goal: $5000

·  $4000 for mixing, mastering, artwork and CD production

·  $1000 donation to People’s Grocery

Our sweet perks:

  • We have awesome schwag from trucker hats and koozies to custom T-shirts!
  • You could also get a performance from the band, with a complimentary bottle of wine!
  • Since we’re also donating a portion of the funds to a great charity, you get peace of mind knowing you gave back!

The Impact

It’s important to us that our music makes an impact.  Our album is titled “Oakland Loves You” because we wanted to pay tribute to a city that, despite many challenges, strives for justice and equality. People’s Grocery in West Oakland is an organization that we felt also embodied this spirit, which is why we chose to raise at least $1000 for their community projects that aim to bring healthy food to those with little access to it. 

Please take a moment and check out their videos here to learn more about the organization: http://www.peoplesgrocery.org/videos

Other Ways You Can Help

We know money can be tight. If you’d still love to help us out, use the Indiegogo share tools and spread the word!  Also feel free to contact us or People’s Grocery directly about volunteer opportunities!

Thanks, Midnight Raid loves you!

story:
Short Summary

We are a folk/rock band out of Fredericton, NB. Two years ago I recorded a solo EP entitled "Josh Bravener" With that, I performed all around the Maritimes and into Ontario with my acoustic set. As time progressed, we moved into more of an electric upbeat sound. Now we are looking to record and press a full length album digitally and onto vinyl.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to reach $3,000 to get our Album recorded professionally and pressed to vinyl. Every record will come with a digital download. Every little contribution helps. 

With a $10.00 donation, you will get a digital download of the Album. For $20.00 You will get a copy of the album on vinyl. For $30.00 we will send you vinyl + record a personalized video thanking you and singing a cover of your choice. For $200 Josh, Nicci and Kelly will come and do a private acoustic house set + A free album for the host. For $500 the whole band will come to a private house show + a free album for the host.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have no money, NO WORRIES! Simply sharing our event to friends, family and even co-workers will be a huge help!

story:
love the fact that a song can lift you out of a dark emotional pit , or it can empathise with you whilst your there. But songs aren't cheap to record, not properly.

We'd love you to jump on board as we enter the studio to record a 3rd Studio EP and we're going to make it extra special and worthwhile for everyone who chooses to be part of the journey.

2014 has been a great year for airplay with my songs being picked up by over 50 radio stations, playlisted by some and made BBC Introducing Track of the Day a fee weeks back culminating by being included in Tom Robinsons- BBC6 's New Music mixtape I'm confident that we're going to head into 2015 making a bigger sounding more soulful and more honest record. Expect the usual warmth of the double bass and cello, this time married with the trumpet, tuba , violin and drums. 

The funds raised will pay for the studio time, production and mastering time and some of the musicians' costs. None of the money stays in my pocket, it simply helps me make another record.

story:
Help Black Water continue
to bring Portland underground shows and events!


What is Black Water?

For those of you who have never been, Black water is much more than a Portland based record label.  It’s also a long running store/venue, collection of artist/practice spaces, recording studio and community gathering space. It has hosted and been the focal point for events and projects such as book and record releases, art shows, record swaps, underground movie premieres and benefit events.


More importantly though, it doesn’t change the fact that we can no longer host bands at the Russell St. location. Over the years, Black Water has provided a staging point for dozens of bands and artists. Each of which has contributed to the continued strength and growth of the underground community. It’s one of the many reasons the city of Portland has such a renowned reputation for its underground music scene, and we are determined to make sure this essential kind of community resource continues well into the future.


Since 2008, Black Water has inhabited 2 different brick and mortar spaces – but not by choice. Each location, after a few years of dedication and hard work, solidified into a well establish and relied upon focal point in the underground community; and each space has, in turn, run headlong into forces that have halted their momentum.


The first space on SE Morrison, which also included a café and community garden, was bought out by condo developers. The second, and current space on NE Russell, has had to end its in-store venue because of the bureaucratic restrictions of the space itself. Basically, the city and fire marshal shut the shows down and may still shut the studios and record store down as well. Unable to see where we are coming from in our DIY anti-cooperate mentality toward music and community, they have gifted us with a small mountain of steep fines and a list of code requirements in order to keep the existing Russell St space going – even without shows.


The Mob played the last show we had at this space – back in May – and even though they were cool enough to pass around a donation jar at the end of the show, it truly didn’t come close to the amount of fines the city threw at us and the construction and building upgrades we are required to take on just to keep host of artist/practice spaces, recording studio and record store going.


Bands that have called Black Water home over the years (ie. Practice spaces)

Weregoat

White Wards (wa)

Wild Mohicans

WWK (ger)

Yadokai (ca)

Young Turks

...plus many, many more!



Goal: A venue for the underground community.

Starting over from scratch every few years, after putting so much time and dedication into a space, is a major pain in the ass and honestly pretty disheartening, exhausting and disappointing to all the folks who invest their time and energy into making Black Water what it is. We want a space for our community that will last. Our goal is to establish a permitted venue, restaurant, bar, and brewery.



Expanding Black Water –

A new location on NE 9th & Broadway

For years now, Black Water has provided an all-ages show space, hosting events for international touring and local bands, and contributing to the ongoing strength and growth of the wider underground community. The sole purpose of this space is to keep the diy scene, and its centering foundation of music, free and alive.


This new space will combine the recognizable aesthetics of Black Water with the necessity of establishing a permitted venue space. This is so that we can keep it open and existing for years to come. And just like when we set out to develop and build-out the first two locations, there’s a lot of construction that will need to happen. We plan to transform an old restaurant into the type of space we all look forward to being a part of.



The Benefits of the new space:

The goals of the space will be to provide new benefits that the Russell St space can no longer provide - beyond the most important fact… that we will be able to host bands and other events without hassle! We hope to provide a space to host all ages events on a regular basis. In addition, the restaurant portion will feature a full vegetarian menu. We will also attempt to provide paying jobs to some of the many people who have tirelessly volunteered to make Black Water happen over the years, and help give them an outlet to establish their own contributing endeavors.



What We Need:

Shameless promotion - $250
A  business license - $100
Permits to the man - $2500+
Building supplies (including a lot of black paint) - $10,000
Upgrade of sound gear! - $5,000
Fees and permits from the city and fire marshall- $6,000
Kitchen equipment - $3,000+
Brewery equipment upgrades - $2,000
etc...the list goes on and on


In Conclusion . . .

Please share this page and help us spread the word!  We have already started work on the new building and can't wait to share the new space with everyone! We really appreciate everything you can and already do to keep our scene alive in 2014...and beyond!!!

What We Need:Shameless promotion - $250A  business license - $100Permits to the man - $2500+Building supplies (including a lot of black paint) - $10,000Upgrade of sound gear! - $5,000Fees and permits from the city and fire marshall- $6,000Kitchen equipment - $3,000+Brewery equipment upgrades - $2,000etc...the list goes on and on


In Conclusion . . .Please share this page and help us spread the word!  We have already started work on the new building and can't wait to share the new space with everyone! We really appreciate everything you can and already do to keep our scene alive in 2014...and beyond!!!

story:
Short Summary

Hai, there, facebooks friends. 
This hopeful campaign is for my awesome brother.
He is a self-employed DJ whose equipment died at the same time his wife's car died. His wonderful wife, Krista, is going to school for IT and works in a juvenile rehabilitation center. 
During his efforts to rob Peter to pay Paul he was five days late on a bill, so his gas utilities got shut off, even though he has been paying his "budget billing" on time ever since. That means no heat and no hot water unless he can pay the ridiculous reconnection fees due to a five day lapse.
I am not one to ask for myself, but I am asking you to help my brother. I would just write him a check if I were able.
Some of you may know him as "Fergy", some of you may know him as "John", some of you may simply know him as "Marie's Little Brother".
I know him as one of the best and most hilarious and big-hearted people in the world.
He would cheerfully give the shirt off his back to someone who needed it.
He is forever an example to me of the kind if person I want to be.
I promise, he will pay forward all of the kindness you show to him.
Because that's who he is.

story:
I recently celebrated a birthday, Wednesday December 3rd, and I made a quarter century.

In reflection on my birthday I realized how hard I have worked over the years in the arts as an actress and musician. After performing on so many stages and taking classes in the arts, being an artist takes a lot of discipline and sacrafice of time and money all for the thing you love most: changing lives.

I have recently decided to put all of my energy and resources into my music and for the year 2015 I would like to release two music projects for people who want music that will heal and change lives.

My hope is to release an EP by MAY 2015 and a full length LP by October 2015.

This is where I need your help. I'm asking for a love donation to support the recording process of my new music. Any donations made will go toward funding the musicians, engineers and any writers involved. Not only our you funding my dream but you are also funding the dream of multiple artist where the creation of music and art is their livelihood.

Because I turned 25 the donation amount I am looking to raise is $2,500. If I exceed that I am grateful because I know you believe in making my dream come true.The estimated cost to record and release my new music is about $7500 to almost $10,000. Any donation made will be a blessing. Thank you in advance for helping me celebrate my birthday in a way that can also bless you. New music!

Let's build together!

peace, love & *STRAWBERRIES!*


-Sharmon!

story:
Dear Potential Investor,

despite being world famous folk-rock super stars, you might be surprised (probably not as surprised as us) to learn that The GIn Club don't necessarily have lots of money at our disposal. It's all tied up in bonds and pyramid schemes. In hindsight, starting a globe-spanning nine-piece folk-rock hypen-heavy musical collective wasn't the best decision from a financial point of view. But we keep doing it anyway, because we are all dear friends who genuinely enjoy each other's company. We also really love the music that we make together, as hopefully you do too. We count ourselves very lucky so if you ever hear us complaining you should stride up, assume a sort of bow legged pose like you've been riding a horse all day, and rub your eyes in an exaggerated fashion whilst pretending to cry.

That's our long suffering engineer, Murray Paas.

And now we have a brand new album, Southern Lights. It was recorded up at the farm near Rockhampton last year and it has just been mixed by our old mate Magoo. It features ten brand new Gin Club songs. It has two new songs by Brad Pickersgill. It has some pretty nice artwork by Marc Oswin. It has Kate Jacobson (Texas Tea) and some strings and pedal steel. We have one song finished - the epic "Dancing With The Ghost" by Adrian Stoyles. You should already have a copy but if you don't gohereand download it FOR FREE. 

That's our studio. 

 

We just need some money to finish mastering the other tracks, and manufacturing and promoting the completed album. And that's where you come in. We're hoping to raise $7000 which will go towards completing the mastering ($2000), manufacturing the album on CD and vinyl ($3000) and paying for artwork and promotional expenses)


(l-r) Adrian Stoyles .

We have a bunch of perks available, take a look and hopefully you'll find something you like. Essentially this is a pre-sale, as the name implies. Hopefully you're already a fan and you're willing to fork out before the fact to help us get this thing finished. If you've paid any attention at all to the news over the last ten years, you might have noticed that the music business doesn't really exist the way it used to ten or twenty years ago. So you're gonna see a lot more of these sorts of things happening. As Lou Reed once said, "It's the beginning of a New Age". Get on board. 

 nb:

 - All packages  come with a download of our third collection of out-takes, rarities and anomalies, Hissy Fit Volume 3.  (Some fans claim our Hissy Fits are better than our proper albums! Check out the last one here.)

- All vinyl purchases will include your name in the credits.

- If you order any package including the new album on vinyl, you might not get it till March next year. You can still redeem the other elements of the perk (set lists, double passes etc) before then. We will supply you with a download code for the album as soon as it is finished, but the actual physical record might not arrive till later. Hopefully it will be earlier than that but due to the worldwide demand for vinyl turnaround times are not what they used to be. 

- If you purchase a perk that includes a pass to one of our shows, you can redeem it on our upcoming 2014 tour. 

As you may have gathered it's difficult getting all of us in a photo together.

If you've read all this you're probably one of our fans already. And so we're preaching to the converted. So all we really should be saying is THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU.  And we hope you will keep enjoying our music half as much as we enjoy hanging out and making it for you. 

Shanti shanti shanti

XX

The Gin Club

story:
Ars Minerva - Ifigenia in Aulide.

 

Short Biography

Ars Minerva was founded in 2013 by Céline Ricci with a vision for a new performing arts organization that would recreate forgotten music and create multidisciplinary events around early music, while remaining locally rooted and outreach-oriented. 

Since its inception, Ars Minerva has presented the modern world premieres of three long-forgotten Venetian operas in San Francisco: La Cleopatra (1662), Le Amazzoni nelle Isole Fortunate (1676) and La Circe (1665).

Project

IFIGENIA IN AULIDE - an opera composed by Giovanni Porta in 1738 with a libretto by Apostolo Zeno.

Synopsis

The Greek army, ready to battle against Troy under the command of King Agamemnon, was detained by contrary winds for several months in the port of Aulis. Agamemnon appealed to the Oracle; and the soothsayer Calchas responded that it would not be possible to sail to Troy, without first placating the wrath of the Goddess Diana with a death, and with the sacrifice of Iphigenia, daughter of Agamemnon.

Dates and Venues

November 30th & December 1st at 7.30pm: Semi-Staged Performances.

At ODC THEATER, San Francisco.

​And a new venue for Ars Minerva!

November 9th at 8pm: Abridged Concert Version.

At RESONANCE CONCERT SERIES  - First Congregational Church, Berkeley.

Your Contribution

Thanks to your donations, we'll be able to recreate a long-lost baroque opera! 

Ticket sales cover only about 30% of our budget. In fact, 70% of our production budget comes from individual donations. Your support will help Ars MInerva to remunerate the performing artists, the researching artists and the creating artists. 

Bringing back forgotten music to life is an act of beauty and love and an amazing human adventure. Join the team! 

Thank you so much for your generosity and for spreading the word.

Goals

Cultural and historical preservation

By recreating Ifigenia in Aulide in 2018, Ars Minerva will promote cultural heritage and historical preservation. Nowadays, most major opera houses, ensembles and orchestras tend to play a 19th-century-dominated standard repertoire. As a consequence, the audience’s experience of classical music can be repetitive and beautiful music from our past remains un-played and unheard. An important part of our operatic heritage remains hidden from audiences and artists.

Hire Bay Area artists & young artists

For Ifigenia in Aulide we will mainly hire local artists, among which will be some current and former students of the San Francisco Conservatory of Music.

Ars Minerva is proud to primarily collaborate with so many talented artists in the SF Bay Area who fully embrace the process of musical re-creation.

Bring new and younger audiences to the opera

We aim to engage new audiences for classical music through innovative productions. Our staged productions are modern—we place our re-creations of original Baroque scores in a context that makes them relevant to today’s world. Our audience is growing and we have noticed that young people and students are enthusiastically engaged with our performances.

Impact

Audiences

Our audiences will experience innovative new music reborn from the past, unexpected contrasts with past mindsets, and an incredible energetic and dramatic performance by a vibrant new troupe. It is important for lesser-known operas to be revived. Many are forgotten gems in their own right, and they also provide context for the greatest composers and the eras in which they worked. For instance, we cannot fully understand 17th-century Venetian opera if the only composer we know is Claudio Monteverdi.

Participants

Our participants will engage in a unique music re-creation process, an intense and high quality work that will demand lots of creativity, being part of an energetic team proud to bring Ifigenia in Aulide back to life. When singers and instrumentalists experience an opera re-creation, they have no references to refer to, no previous performances, no CD to listen to or DVD to watch. They will have to rely on their deep learning about music and their stylistic knowledge of that period of time, and be very creative and flexible during rehearsals.

Risks & Challenges

As a young organization, our big challenges are raising funds and selling tickets, but as in the previous years, we'll do our best to make it. 

                        

Reviews

"Céline Ricci and her Ars Minerva company are a cultural treasure, and we are lucky indeed to have them here in the Bay Area." THE BERKELEY DAILY PLANET, 2018.

"Outstanding and delightful... a useful reminder of the operatic riches that remain yet uncovered." THE REVERBERATE HILLS, 2017.

“The Amazons Enchant San Francisco" OPERA TODAY, 2016.

"The staging and fine singing made for a vibrantly entertaining performance." SAN FRANCISCO CLASSICAL VOICE, 2016.

"This revival of Castrovillari’s La Cleopatra was a rare treat for San Francisco audiences." THE BERKELEY DAILY PLANET, 2015.

 

Thank you very much for your support,

Ars Minerva team.

Ars Minerva is a 501(c)3 performing arts non-profit organization based in San Francisco. All contributions to Ars Minerva are fully tax-deductible to the extent allowed by the law. 

www.arsminerva.org

story:
About me & "The Way I Say Your Name"

Many of you who know me, know that music is and always has been incredibly important, and there is nothing I love more than to play music with other people. Over the past few years, I have focused on my songwriting, honing in on lyrics that speak honestly and directly from my heart. 

The songs on this album honor and tribute the women that I look up to in my life, including my Mother, Amy, and my Grandmother's Audrey & Carolyn. I miss both Audrey & Carolyn every day, but this project is teaching me even more about the values of persistence, strength, and love, that they passed on to me. 

What I Still Need & How You Can Help

The good news is that this album is already in the works. I have the guitar & vocals tracked for all eight songs, but this is just the tip of the iceberg, and there is much more to be done! Here's the breakdown:

  • Community: I am lucky to be surrounded by so many incredible musicians, artists, photographers, engineers, and collaborators that will be recording & making art for this project, and I am committed to paying these artists for the time and energy that they put into this project. 
  • Post-production: I am working with two INCREDIBLE musicians and producer-minds, Scott Ferreter & David Lipps, and with the support of this campaign, we can get those sounds just the way you'll want to hear them. 
  • The real-live-thing: although we are living in a digital age, there is still something special and exciting about holding a CD in your hand, liner notes and all! If I meet my goal, not only will I be able to finish the tracks, but you can even get a copy of the CD delivered straight to your doorstep. 

I am aiming to raise $4,500 to cover the expenses that I am unable to pay out of pocket. Every cent raised will be put straight back into this project, first supporting the musicians and artists that are making it happen, and any leftover from that will go into CD production.

I am fully committed to this album, and your support means more than I could ever express in words.

If the time is not right for you to contribute financially, you can still support the campaign by sharing it on social media and with friends and family. 

Thank you for believing in me, believing in this project, and for being a part of it. 

With love, gratitude, and giddyness,

Maya

story:
Triangle Blues - Road to Memphis

Each year the Triangle Blues Society holds the Triangle Blues Challenge to discover the best Blues Musicians in the Triangle (North Carolina) for that year. 

This year the winners are:

  • Band - Red Dirt Revelators
  • Solo/Duo - Rick Tobey

The winners qualify to enter the largest blues gathering in the world, held each year in Memphis TN, the International Blues Challenge (IBC). The IBC is nearly a week long event and the musicians need to travel with their instruments, stay in a decent hotel and eat.  It is not terribly expensive, but it is not cheap either. 

As Blues Lovers please help these great musicians on their Road to Memphis!

Straight Talk

Let me break it down for you. This year, there are five (5) musicians travelling to Memphis.  With the cost of gas these days, some will decide to fly, and some might drive if they cannot figure out a way to carry their instruments on the plane. 

The musicians will be in Memphis for six days - so they need food and lodging for about a week. 

Here is what we are looking at to help cover the musicians - $4,000

  • Travel...... about $1,500
  • Lodging.... about $1,000
  • Food........ about $1,500

Keep the Music Alive at the Grassroots

Blues music is part of almost every genre of music today.  You hear blues on TV, in movies, and in advertising.  It is background music, influencing music, and we always have the blues festivals, concerts and local venues with great blues music!

  • The musicians who win the Triangle Blues Challange are among the best of the best blues musicians from the Triangle each year 
  • The winning acts are selected by a panel of expert, independent judges, so you know the musicians have to know their stuff
  • Blues music is part of our daily lives - let's keep it alive

Musicians work hard to perfect their skills and hone their talents.  The Triangle Blues Society tries to remove the financial burdens during the competition so the musicians can focus on what they do best - PLAY the BLUES!

Through your generous contributions, you can help these wonderful musicians on their ROAD to MEMPHIS.

Thanks You,

Jimmy Haggard

President, Triangle Blues Society

Jimmy Haggard
President, Triangle Blues Society

story:
Update


Hi guys. A little update from down under! 

At this very moment, our trip can be described with three simple words: 

"Surreal, Beautiful and Perfect."

Until now, we've been acting tourists in Sydney, been to a 2 days long trip with some great Aussies to Wollongong and Blue Mountains, and finally we have meet Patrik - a swedish guy, who'll join our project for now to help us with the documentary - as a videographer. 

The first stories are already in the making, photographs has been taking and video has been filmed for the documentary! The first part of the documentary will be up in two weeks +/-. I've already made some of my absolutely favorite photos - so I'm more than happy. 

A special thank you for the ones of you who've preordered our book "Enter The World" and thereby supported our project through Indiegogo! We're deeply thankful!



If any of you haven't preordered the book yet, and still wants to - you can sent us a mail to entertheworldofficial@gmail.com with your contacts informations and donate through paypal account: entertheworldofficial@gmail.com

Hi there

This is a video of two young boys who are to visit Australia for a year with the plan of making a photo-book on the road. the mix of these two characters will give you a philosophical and spiritual conceptual-art book which will educate you and maybe inspire you to do the same. - Even though the book is expressed in Australia, the universality of the story is not only doable down under, but a way of traveling and seeing the world in every corner and inch of this planet.

The different stories and niches in the book will be very special and unique, so you will get the feeling of actually being there with us. 

Our focus is to catch stories in the moment of existence and not by paying for an "experience" (Which you typically will se in other tourist and/or guidebooks).

Every little contribution means the world to us. Every cent counts as footsteps. We are born and raised in a country where cold days and dark nights are the depressing forecast every single day, among people filled with despondent thoughts we want to see something different then just the landscapes and dead eyes roaming around. We need money to remedies so we can explore as much as possible. We need money for food and shelter. We need help from friends and families but we also need YOUR help. This will end up in an extraordinary photo-book, which at the moment is beyond our imagination. Achieving greater understanding of life. A whole new world will occur, both for us but also for the ones who want to see a foreign country in it’s seams. We want to ENTER THE WORLD. And we need your help, join the Lone Wolf Club today and become more than an explorer.


Thank you for your patience.

Most of this information is to be found in the video, hope you enjoy it. 

 

Cheers - Marcus Moeller Bitsch and Rasmus Dichmann Bang.

For contact or special contributions:

entertheworldofficial@gmail.com

 

 

Marcus Møller Bitsch is a 20 year old photographer who was born in 1992 in Aarhus – Denmark. He has recently graduated from Egaa Gymanisium in Aarhus this year. Marcus specializes in fine art and fashion photography. You can describe his photography in many words — dreamy, surreal, imaginative, creative, and story telling.

Marcus has been recognized for his work by many. He has been featured in countless magazines, blogs, and websites such as Photoblog.hk, Photojojo.com, Vogue.it, Dark Beauty Magazine, Photography Week Magazine, Blur Magazine, Fstoppers.com and many more.

Marcus was also recently named one of the top 10 young and talented photographers by acclaimed website My Modern Metropolis in January of 2013, and he was also named one of the top 5 Young and Talented Photographers by Untied Colors of Benetton in February of 2013.


- For more photos visit www.marcusmb.com / www.facebook.com/MarcusMbPhotography 

... But if you have any sort of questions or find the video non-forefilling, please feel free to contact us at entertheworldofficial@gmail.com 

Credits - Music: Lost In Despair from Denmark, Fredericia.


UPDATE: 
The $100 contribution will now also include a 30x30 medium edition fineart print, of any picture you would like from the book.

story:
What's Going on?

We are Association Bongo and in conjunction with Round Flat records and a small but elite group of disparate musicians, we're running the second full "humanitarium" workshop.  

The first one happened in September 2013, 7 musicians came, met each other, wrote songs together, lived, ate, drank and played together for 7 days, recoded an album together and left.  That album is now available through Round Flat Records.

A Humanitarium, in theory, would be a bit like a planetarium, for observing fish, or an aquarium for observing planets... no... wait... 

Musicians are humans, not robots, and when they make music, their human-ness can and should shine through.  The Humanitarium is a project that brings together musicians from different cultural backgrounds, with different musical approaches to collaborate in one intense week of creativity, surrounded by nature, nourished by home grown home made organic food, creatively inspired by their first ever meeting and a one off, unique blend of music that can encompass rhythms, styles and ethnic roots from just about anywhere.

Van Morrisons "Astral Weeks" was reputedly recorded in 3 days, and is consistently voted amongst the best albums ever made.  We can't guarantee that kind of success, but it did inspire us to know that great, passionate, exciting, original music can be made and recorded without studio trickery, or months of pre and post production, overdubbing and multiple takes.

In addition to having this incredible musical opportunity, we plan to make a documentary film for screenings in the area, at cine-forums and film festivals as well as of course online distribution.  The participants will play a final concert of their new music and their own music, we will be inviting some experienced long term music executives to give talks on aspects of the music industry, we have arranged radio interviews and sessions at 2 regional stations, and a series of Newspaper articles, as well as many other ideas to generate interest in the album and film

What We Need & What You Get

  • We're looking for 5000 euros. It may sound unusual, but we run more for the music than for the money.  However, to bring musicians from all around the world to a small hilltop village in rural France involves a fair amount of air fares, we need to feed them, lodge them and cover the costs of a small but excellent staff to cook, as well as a whole weeks studio time.  
  • In return for your funding donations you will of course receive copies of the albums, as is normal with any musical crowd funding campaign, however, it doesn't stop there!  we're also offering a whole host of other exciting weird, wonderful and unique incentives to get you to think about getting involved on a larger scale!
  • In the (unlikely???) event that this project falls short of the target, the funds donated still go towards the workshop, but it will mean that the participants have to be partially self funding.  This isn't the end of the world of course and the previous Humanitarium was entirely funded by the participants, However, it will mean the world is full of less goodwill than we hoped, and more penniless musicians, it will discourage us and it will generally put a dampener on things

The Impact

However, if we DO raise all the funds, they not only enable a fantastic, unique multi-cultural project to take place, but they will also be part of a film, broadcast on the radio, featured in local and regional press, have the chance to mix

  • The music made will be entirely unique, a blend of music from 7 different countries, mixing traditional, folk roots and world music, through songwriting collaborations in a truly inspirational setting
  • The last Humanitarium project created overseas links and a network of musicians with a shared experience, shared material, and a geographic cover for an independent work of art that would be very difficult to create otherwise
  • This is a project to create REAL music from the interaction of people together.  Our aim is to create something where the humanity of those involved translates onto the recordings, in contrast to the huge swathes of overproduced and soul-less music that can be heard everywhere.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Share this campaign to anyone you think may be interested, get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
  • use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.
