story:
My goal for the year of 2015 is to travel full-time and see as much of the United States as I can.

I intend to start off the winter months at the beginning of the year in Florida visiting and working on some organic farms.

After that my journey is unscheduled. I intend to employ a method I like to call 'drifting' where I just let life and the world around me decide where I go and how long I stay.

Along the way I would like to visit the oceans on both coasts, East and West, the Midwest,  the Northeast, and for some reason I have this extreme urge to go to Portland, Oregon.

All along the way I will be making videos to upload to my Youtube channel, blogging about my adventures, and photographing all the interesting sights I see.

My main goals of my journey are to meet new people, have new experiences, see more of America, learn more about myself, and perhaps inspire others to let go of some of the excess baggage they have in their lives and chase their dreams.

The reason I created this campaign was to give anyone who wanted to, the opportunity to help me out on my journey.

All the funds I raise will be put to good use towards:
  • Transportation (Bus tickets, gas money, etc)
  • Accommodations (Hostels, the very rare hotel stay, etc)
  • Food 
  • Items that help me document my journey (Batteries, expenses for blog, replacement camera equipment if accidents occur, etc)
  • Other unexpected expenses that arise
You have my word that any funds contributed will not be squandered!

I greatly appreciate anyone who has taken the time to check out this campaign, and you have my unending gratitude if you decide to contribute.

Thanks again,
Tim Ward

story:
Tuff Cuff Records, and The Moonah Arts Collective combine to present Polarize, recorded, and filmed by experienced audio, and video professionals of The Moonah Arts Collective and JK Productions.

Tuff Cuff Records is a Record Label and Record Club created by Record Collectors for Record Collectors. Focussing on Limited Edition runs of Australian Musicians.

Moonah Arts Collective is a community based Arts Organisation dedicated to progressing, promoting, and empowering music, and other arts on the Southern Mornington Peninsula. By supplying Rehearsal and Recording studios, and developing local content.

Polarize are an indie rock/heady pop band from Melbourne. 

Polarize's debut single ‘Do What You Want’, released in July 2018, received praise from Richard Kingsmill at triple j and extensive community airplay across the country. Since then the band has released a handful of singles, including December release 'Meet Me In The Middle', and have built up a hefty live following. Playing extensively throughout Melbourne’s live music scene, with shows at The Tote, The Grace, The Espy, Workers Club and Yah Yahs, before embarking on a club tour through Japan, which took them to Kobe, Osaka, Kyoto and finally three sweaty shows in Tokyo.

Following Japan, Polarize returned with a new offering titled ‘Friends Again’. Independently released, and written, and recorded, in Melbourne's north, the single strikes a balance between indie rock and new wave heady-pop, as it narrates the honest and familiar tale of a friendship that deteriorates over time.

Reviews for Friends Again, by Polarize

Slinky, synthy, laconic good times - Zan Rowe - JJJ

Moonah Arts Collectives mission is to document, and champion Victorias music scene, by capturing local musicians with high quality vision, and sound, and sharing it globally through The Moonah Arts Collective Youtube Channel https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCrJGtAQxzhxJbM..., and other avenues.

We hope by making, and releasing these videos to the world, that we can help find, and build markets for local acts, Our goal is to make our Youtube channel the go-to online destination to rummage through modern Victorian music.

Our first series of videos from Rye locals Stiff Richards was gobbled up by fans on release, with over 60% of views occurring outside Australia

Check out our video of Stiff Richards live: https://youtu.be/cE4xGsq8diU

Our second series of videos to be released will be of Victorian Rock Legends “Warped”, recorded Live at our studio at The Moonah Arts Collective back in early June.

Check out our video of Warped live: https://youtu.be/lCpukr9dx4Q

To continue our mission of producing these videos we need to cover our costs, and reward the musical acts. So we are launching our first Indiegogo campaign to help us raise the money to produce these video performances. We hope you can help us out by participating.

Our production costs for this videos is $600AUD. $200 goes to Venue and Audio, $400 goes to video production. We would also like to pay the band $200 for their efforts also. 

So we need a grand total of $800 to perform and produce this video.

We are looking for contributors to help us in our mission to document our local music culture.

Contributors will have their name in the credits for our live music video. They will be supporting local music, and will help us in creating a document of our music scene in the present moment that will last as long as the internet, accessible to a global audience, and you can share it with your friends.

With our larger “Sponsorship” level offer we offer a full screen super displaying your name, or your companies name, and logo.

Here are our perks:

 

$20: Credit & Tuff Cuff Records Gift Pack (smaller)

We will include your name in the credits for our live music video.

You will also receive a Tuff Cuff Records Pack including a Badge, and a sticker

$40: Credit & Tuff Cuff Records Gift Pack (sml)

We will include your name in the credits for our live music video.

You will also receive a Tuff Cuff Records Pack including a Badge, Sticker and Guitar Pick.

 

$100: Credit & Tuff Cuff Records Gift Pack (mid) & Ticket

We will include your name at the top of the credits for our live music video.

And you will Receive a Medium Tuff Cuff Records Pack including a 7” Record from their archives, Badge, Sticker and Guitar Pick. 

You are also invited to attend the recording of the performance (covid restrictions allowing).

 

$200: Sponsorship & Tuff Cuff Records Gift Pack (deluxe) & Ticket

We will give you your own full Screen super at the beginning or end of the music video.

And you will Receive a Tuff Cuff Records Pack including a Limited Edition Album featuring live recordings from the artists of the Port Phillip Bay Music project, Badge, Sticker and Guitar Pick. 

You are also invited to attend the recording of the performance (covid restrictions allowing).

 

In the unfortunate event that we fail to meet our minimum, we offer full refunds.

story:
Short Summary

You've seen us, heard us, and danced with us. The Sustainable Music Project is comprised of talent that has toured the world with some of the world's most popular performers. We have brought together musicians from a variety of genres to create a full length studio album with a New Orleans spin - and we do it to support our own community. Your contributions will help provide stability and higher quality of life for musicians in the New Orleans area. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to complete this album. Your contribution will provide financial support while we finish creating, recording, mastering, and completing this incredible album. Check out our video for song teasers and a little peek behind the scenes! 

You'll get updates along the way, and we have some amazing perks for this campaign - everything from a stake in the album to t-shirts and other limited edition merchandise. Your unique perks will be honored no matter how much we raise and we can't wait to take you along on this journey!

The Impact

Through this Sustainable Music Project, you'll make a direct impact on the lives of working musicians in the New Orleans area. As a cultural hub and rapidly growing city, it's becoming less affordable to live in New Orleans every day. Musicians often live on limited incomes, with few of the benefits afforded to more traditional employees, and navigating rising rents can become a burden. But we do we do what we do out of a passion for our craft and a love of entertaining. By supporting this album, you'll help New Orleans musicians continue to create and perform in a sustainable way.

Risks & Challenges

We believe in this album and the impact it can have on our community. The musicians on this album have long and successful careers in the music industry, touring, recording and performing with acts across the globe. Though there are always risks, we know what it takes to create, market and sell an album. We are committed to creating beautiful, fun, inspired music that touches a wide audience.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you love what we are doing but aren't able to contribute financially, we would love it if you could help us spread the word. Share our campaign on social media, email it to a friend, print out the link and send it to your buddies by passenger pigeon - we appreciate any and all support!

Through this Sustainable Music Project, you'll make a direct impact on the lives of working musicians in the New Orleans area. As a cultural hub and rapidly growing city, it's becoming less affordable to live in New Orleans every day. Musicians often live on limited incomes, with few of the benefits afforded to more traditional employees, and navigating rising rents can become a burden. But we do we do what we do out of a passion for our craft and a love of entertaining. By supporting this album, you'll help New Orleans musicians continue to create and perform in a sustainable way.

Risks & Challenges
We believe in this album and the impact it can have on our community. The musicians on this album have long and successful careers in the music industry, touring, recording and performing with acts across the globe. Though there are always risks, we know what it takes to create, market and sell an album. We are committed to creating beautiful, fun, inspired music that touches a wide audience.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you love what we are doing but aren't able to contribute financially, we would love it if you could help us spread the word. Share our campaign on social media, email it to a friend, print out the link and send it to your buddies by passenger pigeon - we appreciate any and all support!

story:
To tell you a little about myself, my name is Gabby Smith (Gabrielle Grace-Anne Smith) and I’m a singer song-writer from a small town in Texas but I currently live in Nashville, Tennessee! I go to school at Trevecca Nazarene University studying worship arts with a philosophy minor. I love making coffee and having deep conversations. I am now moving into my senior year with plans that are bigger than me and I will need your help!

 

I am currently working on fundraising an album and a project that is called, "This Beautiful Life.” Each song on the album is in chronological order of when I wrote them pertaining to my life! As you listen to the album, my hope is that you journey with me as I go through each season and chapter of life. There are two parts to why its called this “This Beautiful Life”. The first part is to show the theme that your’e allowed to feel how you feel through life and expressing your joys and sorrows are important. Your story is important and throughout all, life is beautiful.  

The second part of “This Beautiful Life” is a project that came to me at 12 in the morning. I’ve always have had a vision of putting out the songs that really are the vulnerable side of me, but also I've realized how important it is to be vulnerable and intentional with people. As life is beautiful in the mess and the in the good, you need people around you. Life is better with the community around you and with this project, I plan on showing off the people that have been in my life.

This looks like showing their gifts as I display mine working together to show that we cannot do life alone. Each person on this project will be displaying their gifts like blogging, podcasts, painting, music, and so on. I will be needing to fund $5000 dollars total for the album and the project. This money will funding the recording, merchandise, and giving back to other people who have helped make this project happen. I'm also hoping to fund other organizations and charities that make this place better. I’m excited to team up with all of my friends who are making vision, come true! Thank you for listening and I am excited to journey with y'all through this!

 

Love,  Gabs

story:
Summary

Chamber Music Campania is a cross-disciplinary summer music festival that brings unfamiliar music to intimate spaces, encouraging audience interaction, meaningful listening, and community building. Nontraditional performance venues help us to imagine the relationship between listeners and performers as a close dialogue – a conversation without the barrier of a stage, proscenium, or curtain.

This coming summer Chamber Music Campania celebrates its first American residency in Sarasota, Florida. This residency creates unique opportunities for emerging musicians, young composers, and audiences in the Sarasota area. Our events calendar includes: a series of enrichment workshops with Sarasota county high school students; an integrative concert experience at the Community Resource Network of Florida, an organization dedicated to the physical and emotional health of people with developmental disabilities; and roundtable discussions with recent alumni of New College and composer Stephen Miles.

The broad aim of this residency is to breathe new life into old concert traditions by translating our Italian experiences into meaningful musical activities for stateside listeners and learners.

What We Need

The total budget for the Sarasota residency is $13,000, which includes the cost of housing, food, transportation, publicity, and event production. Chamber Music Campania has already raised twenty percent of our seasonal revenue. Your monetary contribution, large or small, brings us even closer to our goal. Chamber Music Campania also accepts in-kind donations, such as food, housing, tech support, and graphic design.

Please contact Regina Compton to make an in-kind donation or to see a complete break-down of our summer budget: regina@chambermusiccampania.org

The Impact

Chamber Music Campania offers distinctive concert experiences, which are accessible but also challenging and thought provoking. This residency will serve a diverse group of people and contribute to the cultural health of American concert life. We plan to return to America in odd-numbered years (2015, 2017, 2019, etc.) and cultivate a long-term relationship with US residents, businesses, and cultural organizations.

Join us, as we rethink habits of consumption, celebrate cross-culturalism, and enjoy life with all our senses.

story:
I'm thrilled with my new album, The Live Experience, and want to make sure it gets heard. I've learned the hard way that if you don't promote an album well, very few people even learn that it is available. But promotion takes money. It costs thousands of dollars to do publicity or send songs to just one radio format, for instance. There's a great team excited about helping me make sure this album gets noticed but I've had to turn many of them down because I can't afford them. 

That's where you come in. When you join this campaign you're not just buying music. You're investing in the impact that you believe we can have together and in the lasting value of the songs that will come from our musical journey together. Sharing goals and experiences like this means you're not just a "fan" of my music. You're a Sweet Friend Of Mine.

You can also get my Conversations album, and even some my older album downloads here. You'll often receive extra songs (see the list below), bonus features and better quality audio compared to getting it anywhere else. If you use PayPal, you can have a download or CD very quickly. 

I’ve got lots of rewards-- something for everyone. I've even got a perk you design called "Tell Me What You Want." Contact Christopher Redner if you have an idea for a custom reward. Check them out over there. -->

Click a "Claim This Perk" button to see more information about ordering it, delivery dates, etc. If you pay by credit card, Indiegogo doesn't complete the transaction until several days after the campaign ends, so your delivery date is after that. If you use PayPal, the delivery date will be earlier than the one posted. 

Thanks again for your interest in my music.  Please share this page with your friends... choose the cool stuff you want. Christopher Redner created a Facebook group, which you can join, to help you learn how to increase your social media impact. He'll be sharing examples of how to be more effective on my social media campaign.

I look forward to connecting with you and learning what you think about these songs on social media like Indiegogo, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube and Vimeo.

FAQ


What is included on The Live Experience album?

Sweet Friend Of Mine

You Make Me Love You
I See You
I Can’t Imagine
Butterfly Kisses (Bob Carlisle)
We All Need (featuring Yvette Williams)
He's Able (Yvette Williams)
I Know How I'm Gonna Be (Spoken)
Got Ya Where You Want Me
Little Bit At A Time
Drift Away
Ain't No Sunshine
I Can't Stand The Rain (featuring Brianne Mathews)
Hold On, I'm Coming
Your Love, My Saving Grace (featuring Tony Hooper)
Salvation Has Come Today (Tony Hooper) 
Album Graphics

Bonus Audio (download only)

Here's a  video from The Live Experience.

Discover why songs like Ain't No Sunshine, Drift Away, I Can't Stand The Rain and Hold On, I'm Coming on The Live Experience.


Learn more about the So Good For The Soul concert series and how it could come to your area.

Why have you set your goal so low?

Indiegogo charges higher fees if I don't reach my goal. So, I set a low goal in hopes of exceeding it and paying lower fees.

Can I participate even if I don't live in the United States?

Absolutely! I’ve had such great experiences with my international audience and I want you involved. Plus, the guy who helped me put this campaign together is a Canadian and he’s helped me figure out how to make it easier for you be a part.

You can choose any of the perks that are delivered by e-mail (Reports From The Soul Furnace, Digital Album Download, Let's Talk, etc.) without any extra cost. 

There are some extra shipping costs, compared to mailing the same items to an address in the United States, if you choose a perk that is rewarded by mailing you something. However, if you get multiple CDs together you'll save on the CDs and the shipping.

Can I give the album or other perks to my friends?

You betcha! Indiegogo allows you specify who you want the perk sent to and indicate that it is a gift. You can even include a note for the recipient of your gift.

Can you tell me more about the estimated delivery dates?

Indiegogo holds funds until 15 days after the campaign closes, so I'll begin fulfilling orders after that date. Some perks, especially those that involve travel, will require a bit more time to schedule but we’ll work that out together.

What happens if you don't reach your goal?

You'll still get whatever perk you've selected. I'll have to pay higher fees to Indiegogo if I don't reach the goal but you'll still get everything.

How can I help with this campaign?

There's lots you can do in addition to backing this campaign and sharing this page. Any comments you post help raise the profile of this page. Christopher Redner created a Facebook group, which you can join, to help you learn how to increase your social media impact. He'll be sharing examples of how to be more effective on the social media campaign for Conversations. You can also send Christopher a message here if you'd like to be added to my Indiegogo campaign team (see the group below).

What if I have a question that isn't answered here or want a perk that isn't offered?

Send me a message using the contact link or send a message to Christopher Redner.

What is included on the Conversations album?

Sweet Friend Of Mine
You Make Me Love You
Know It
I Can’t Imagine
One Missing Piece
Got Ya Where You Want Me
Little Bit At A Time
Lovin’ You
I See You
No Words
Nothing To Prove
Every Father Is A Son
Say What You Mean
God Wins
I Can't Imagine (Radio Version)
I See You (Radio Version) 

Bonus Audio (download only)
Ringtones
Album Graphics & Poster

What is included on The Ultimate Collection album?

  • Love Takes Time
  • Step By Step
  • Blue Skies
  • Into My Heart
  • Stand In My Place
  • Don't Look Away
  • I'll Not Forget You
  • A Heart Like Mine
  • We All Need
  • After This Day Is Gone
  • Things Are Gonna Change
  • Traces Of Heaven
  • Love You With My Life
  • You Don't Leave Me Lonely
  • Bryan's Hymn

story:
The Break Down

Sun-Dried Vibes is a reggae/rock trio from Rock Hill, SC that has been passionate about playing positive and conscious music while establishing a family of East Coast reggae/rock bands with similar goals since they formed 3 years ago. After releasing their debut album, "Give Thanks" in 2011, the group has been touring heavily across the East Coast, averaging 300 shows a year. The group has recently released their sophomore album, "Back2Square1," and are now in need of your help to continue on their journey!!


SDV experienced such a wave of amazing reception from fans that we wanted to give you THE BEST ALBUM that we could physically make. The only problem is, it's a little expensive.... We have never slowed our touring or had any other job aside from playing music as a group in several years. We expanded our budget to great lengths on this up-coming album, and even with fundraising campaigns, we still spent thousands of dollars of our own personal money. We have driven our touring van to almost 300,000 miles in our time as a band. Our equipment has been brutally used and is in need of much love and repair!! 

So we are humbly asking for your help in getting were we need to be, back on the road traveling to get back to all the towns & cities where we are loved, wanted and needed with functioning equipment and tour van! Any help is much appreciated whatever the amount. So thanks for helping out SDV and hope to see you soon in city near your promoting our new album "Back2Square1."
.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are asking for $3,000 - to get a new (to us) van!!!
  • Check out the list of perks! We are giving away everything that is SUN-DRIED!!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially, TRUST US... We know what it's like to be broke!! Here's a few other thoughts on how you can help us continue spreading the positive vibe:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!!! Use the Indiegogo Share Tools to share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter and more!!
  • Spread the word about our music! Our new album "Back2Square1" is out, we just rocked Cali Roots Carolina Sessions and we plan to head nationwide in 2015!!!

story:
Yo, I'm Ish!

Ish raps, writes, and makes things. Born and raised in BedStuy, Brooklyn, he began making waves as a teenager in the youth poetry and spoken word scene. He also started making music at the same time in a duo called HumUni (hyoom-you-nigh). The 2012 New York City Youth Poet Laureate, and semi-finalist of The Source Magazine’s 2014 Unsigned Hype competition, Ish’s love for the word and music is rooted in his love for hip hop. In January, he released On the Way to the Store, an EP that preludes his upcoming full-length album, Store Run, set to release in June 2015.


Let’s Make a Store Run

A homie once told me, “The corner store is a cornerstone of the neighborhood.” Your local bodega, convenience deli, grocery store, they’re all important to communities they serve. In New York City, we’re lucky to have such businesses open and available literally 24 hours, seven days a week. Simple luxury for New Yorkers.

Appreciation of simple luxuries is the message I’m presenting within the music of this upcoming project, Store Run. The term “simple luxuries” can parallel to one of the constant objectives of an artist: however realistic or imaginative, make life’s details vivid, and have us slow down to view and reflect on them.

Keeping this in mind with the practice of my craft, I understand more and more the importance of an artist’s involvement with the communities they come from and inhabit. As a hip hop artist, I know well that the culture and all its elements began with the community. There’s power in the openness and transparency of allowing people to participate in the creative process. Which is why I need your help in making this album the best it can be. Can you roll with me to the store?


What We’re Getting at the Store

Contributions to the goal of $10,000 or more allow me to cover the following:

The Store Run Album

·  Proper mixing and mastering of music

·  Compensation for producers and collaborators

·  Photography for official album artwork and branding

·  Production and shipping costs of merchandise (see perks)

·  Processing costs of promotional materials (stickers, buttons, print, etc.)

·  Cinematography and video production to create music videos for the album

·  Funds to produce a benefit show for NYC’s homeless in the summer

Artist Development

·  Registration for artist copyrights and brand trademarks

·  Fees for audio/video production and creative writing and musicianship courses

· Scouting for entertainment lawyer, booking agent, other legal personnel

·  Beginning funds for touring and festival registration

·  Equipment upgrades (e.g. microphone, data storage, camera equipment)


Why We’re Going to the Store

This is my first full album. It’s the official entry point of what I’ve been building since my early teens. My current position as an independent artist means no label backing, no corporate machine pulling strings, no middle men. What I do have is the raw potential of direct communication between myself and you, the supporters! That platform is pretty powerful and true to the essence of hip hop. So Let’s take it back to the park, or actually before that, the store.


How to Pitch in for the Store Run

1. Check out my music and website


This playlist is a time capsule that spans music from my beginning years as a teenager to where I am now. You can journey through each track and listen for the growth in my abilities.

2. Contribute + Choose a Perk

Any amount you contribute helps! Of course, choosing a perk donation sweetens the exchange. We all get something from this store run. Completion of the goal and stretch donations beyond it will quicken delivery of perks.

3. Share! We can all go to the store.

A corner store doesn't run without the people on the block. A grocery store is of no use without the neighborhood. The success of this campaign needs your word of mouth! There's several ways you can spread the love. Liking this campaign, sharing on various social media, a text, an email. Let everyone know we're about to make a store run! Use the hashtag #storerun in your posts.

As the campaign progresses, be sure to check this page and its related links every few days for updates and new content (songs, videos, photos, and more). Thank you kindly in advance for your love, support, and for rollin’ with me to the store!

- Ish

Beginning funds for touring and festival
registration
· 
Equipment upgrades (e.g. microphone, data storage, camera equipment)

Why We’re Going to the Store

This is my first full album. It’s the official entry point of what I’ve been building since my early teens. My current position as an independent artist means no label backing, no corporate machine pulling strings, no middle men. What I do have is the raw potential of direct communication between myself and you, the supporters! That platform is pretty powerful and true to the essence of hip hop. So Let’s take it back to the park, or actually before that, the store.How to Pitch in for the Store Run
1. Check out my music and website


This playlist is a time capsule that spans music from my beginning years as a teenager to where I am now. You can journey through each track and listen for the growth in my abilities.

2. Contribute + Choose a PerkAny amount you contribute helps! Of course, choosing a perk donation sweetens the exchange. We all get something from this store run. Completion of the goal and stretch donations beyond it will quicken delivery of perks.
3. Share! We can all go to the store.
A corner store doesn't run without the people on the block. A grocery store is of no use without the neighborhood. The success of this campaign needs your word of mouth! There's several ways you can spread the love. Liking this campaign, sharing on various social media, a text, an email. Let everyone know we're about to make a store run! Use the hashtag #storerun in your posts.

As the campaign progresses, be sure to check this
page and its related links every few days for updates and new content (songs,
videos, photos, and more). Thank you kindly in advance for your love, support, and
for rollin’ with me to the store!

- Ish

story:
The Thirteen is a professional chamber choir comprised of a diverse and talented group of artists. While we specialize in music of the Renaissance and Baroque, we strive for excellence throughout all genres of choral music, and through touring and studio recording, we seek to bring our offering of music to all corners of the United States and beyond. 

It is for this very reason that we have taken on the project of an English language CD for the Christmas season. This is where we need your support! Like many arts organizations in the US, The Thirteen has a very limited operating budget, which for us goes primarily to fulfilling our financial responsibilities to our peerless artists. Only with your help will we be able to release this new album of stunning Christmas music, which will be titled Snow on Snow.

The Thirteen put itself on the map with the 2014 release, Radiant Dark, which broke the top 30 on the iTunes classical charts the week it was released and caught the public's attention with its high levels of musicianship and sound quality. With the Christmas season approaching, we are hoping to surpass the success of the acclaimed Radiant Dark with the release of Snow on Snow.

Please help us to achieve this goal! Every little bit helps. We have lots of great free stuff for you if you donate enough, so check out our different perks levels!

The Thirteen is a 501(c)3 tax-exempt organization, and all donations are tax deductible to the extent permissible by law.

story:
CALIFLORIDA!!!

It's been 5 years since Downtown Brown recorded our last album. The time has come for ALBUM NUMBER 7!!!

The goal and how you can help us...

We wanna put together a career-defining set of songs with the help of some of the best musicians in the country. It's probably gonna cost more than $8,000 to do so ...but it's a good place to start.

YOU CAN HELP US MAKE THIS ALBUM by purchasing the album ahead of time and grabbing some of these perks!  

  • Every pre-order, tee shirt, and perk you purchase will help us offset the studio costs to professionally record these new songs
  • We're offering up some one-of-a-kind items as well ...like lyric cartoons, and even the guitar I used to record 'Grabbleton's Beach' and 'Masterz of the Universe'!!  

  • This is a project we are doing 100% on our own with no outside funding which is why we need your help to make this dream a reality. WE CAN'T DO THIS WITHOUT YOU!!!

THANK YOU!!

THANK YOU for all the love over the years. We've been so lucky to have the support of people who enjoy our music and believe in this band.

Downtown Brown is a project that I continue to do because it's been my main form of artistic expression for going on 20 years. I am proud as hell of what my friends and I have accomplished in that time. 

I'm super excited to share these songs with you. This is gonna be something special.  

I love you all.

-Neebo 

'CaliFlorida' Album Art by: Thom Mckay Price

'CaliFlorida' T-Shirt design by: Jake Kelly

 

One of a Kind Lyric Cartoon by Neebo

story:
Short Summary

Once upon a time, there was a teenage singer/songwriter who was poised to become "the ethnically ambiguous" Britney Spears. Over the course of 2 years she wrote over 100 songs, put herself through rigorous dance and performance training and eventually got the attention of a couple of record execs of a major pop label. After creating a demo in LA and working with some very talented musicians she was on her way to super mega pop stardom... or not. The endeavor didn't pan out and the young would-be pop tart faded into over a decade of back-up singing for other people's projects. She was fortunate enough to work with some incredibly talented artists (some of whom are friends) and while it was not the most artistically fulfilling it was a wonderful learning experience and provided a well-spring of inspiration. She never stopped writing songs and still held onto the dream of one day releasing her own music without the confines of a label dictating every aspect of her image, sound, vibe, etc. 

Fast forward to today and you are all caught up on the very-drawn out process of how I finally ended up laying down my own voice in my own songs. I am so grateful to be working with the insanely talented producer, LYNX and I am truly excited for the world to hear what we are creating.

What I Need & What You Get

The reality of producing this EP

  • In total this project will cost 7,000-7,600 with time in the studio, musicians rates who play on the tracks and being variables that can fluctuate. At this point I have invested 1000$ of my own funds into this project and this is where all of you fine folk come in!
  • The perks of this fundraiser are mostly centered around the EP itself but I also am working with some super amazing local artists to create artwork and imagery that supports the vision of the music. I hope you enjoy these as much as I have enjoyed creating them!
  • Should this fundraiser not meet the goal the funds will go to producing, recording, mastering and finishing the song that is closest to being finished. All of the funds will still go to the EP, not meeting the goal will just delay the process of completing it. 

The Impact

This project is important to me because it has been a dream of mine for a long time but also because it is part of a much larger vision. All of the songs on this EP (and the next 2 EPs I have in development) are telling a story that revolve around a character very near and dear to my heart, Avalon. Avalon is an alter-ego, so to speak, that represents the under-represented everywhere. She specifically is a multi-ethnic mother trying to do great things in the world with many odds stacked against and I feel her story is not just her own but the story of many women (or anyone, really) trying to balance what is expected of them and what they feel deeply called to do. She's also a super hero because I can't help myself. :) Currently there is a short film and a comic book in the works to tell her story more in depth and those are set for release later in 2019. Exciting times!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN! Even if you can't contribute, just sharing this and the message of what this campaign is about is a huge help and I appreciate it!

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this far. You rock! I hope you support and enjoy the arts forever.

story:
This campaign was launched when God came to Saavy and told her that she has to launch a crowdfund for $4500 for the 3 albums that will be released.

I cannot do it without your help. Your donation is greatly needed to get these funds to complete these 3 projects. A typical professional CD Quality album ranges anywhere from $5000 to $10,000 alone for an up and coming artist. With that being said, this is an act of faith to invite the listener along with her on the journey out of homosexuality while enjoying heartfelt music that is no longer experienced today. Millions of lives will be saved.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The funds will be evenly dispersed between the 3 projects, so $1500 will go towards each album as the foundation costs. It takes $50 per hour to record a song. Each album will have about 12 tracks and it takes about 2 hours to complete the recording of a song. Estimating that one album takes 24 hours to record, that is $1200 already spent on recording one project. This does not even include the photo shoot, mixing and mastering, beats, distribution and so forth. This is what makes this crowd funding an act of faith.

The perks are laid out on the right side of the campaign home screen. I am excited about each perk because you will be able to get a thank you card personally signed by your girl Saavy, an opportunity to have your name in the acknowledgement section of the cd booklet, or a For the People original t-shirt that will be offered for a limited time. All of these perks may seem ordinary but with an opportunity to assist in the rising of an artist and her company with proof of doing such through these perks, you will be among the first wave of individuals to assist Saavy in the journey of being before millions.

 

If funds are not reached, people will still receive their perks and the money collected will go into each project accordingly. For example, if $1500 is raised, it will go into the first album. If $2000 is raised, $1500 will go into the first album and the remaining $500 will go into the second project.

 

The Impact

To be transparent, this campaign means a lot to me because it signifies me doing something bigger than myself on a global scale. God is rising up a people and sending them out to the world to spread His message like never before, and I am most grateful to be apart of what He is doing. Yes, I walked in to this campaign with fear of the unknown because of the risks associated with asking for such a low number for so many projects. Yes, this campaign may sound crazy to most. Yet, at the end of the day, it is the obedience and stretching of the faith that keeps me in perfect peace. The world needs people to lead by example so I shall allow God to use me.  It is not easy but it can be done.

No matter what happens, the world will hear this music that is inside of me. I have been holding on too long and it is time to get out there.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Now that you know my story behind this campaign, I invite you to join me along on this journey by clicking the donate button. Even if you are able to only spare a dollar, I guarantee that your money will not go to waste.

 

If you cannot afford to donate, be sure to share this campaign with any of your friends, family and foes worldwide whether via email, word of mouth, text, Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter. Any form of sharing is welcomed. Who knows? You may know somebody who knows somebody who could be THAT somebody.  Lol. Ok, I will stop being silly! J Love you much and from the bottom of my heart, thank you for your support.

story:
LOYA's Single & Music Video Campaign

LOYA is a one-man-band. No financial backers. No record label. No shows. When LOYA first started, it was just me playing guitar, singing, and slapping synths together. Thanks to all of you, YOU have gotten me into publications like Alternative Addiction, and helped me get licensing agreements with MTV and Discovery. The coolest part for me isn't that though, it's the fact that you guys tell me about what my music means to you, and how it helps you, and how much you love it. That's what makes my heart scream more than anything and want to keep going everyday.

This is why I want to make the best LOYA music video ever, and TOGETHER we're going to raise the $3,000 to make it happen!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's a breakdown of all the funds we need to raise and what they're going to get used for:

  • $300 - TrueVision Studios, recording, editing, mixing mastering of the single.
  • $2000-$2500 - The director, videographers, editors, props, production etc.
  • $200-$700 - Photography and PR to help the music video circulate upon release

Here's some of the things YOU guys are going to get for contributing:

  • Free digital download of the single when it is released
  • Unreleased LOYA song that will not be made public beyond this campaign
  • Autographed LOYA Merchandise
  • One-Of-A-Kind LOYA Memorabilia 
  • Cover Songs of Your Choosing

The Impact

LOYA is my life and my dream and even though I'm the only one who makes the music, I'm DEFINITELY not alone in doing this: all of you who have ever bought a CD from me, bought a T Shirt, DM'd me to tell me about your LOYA experiences, sent me pictures posing with your CD, you are a second family. You guys are all on my team and each one of you mean so much to me. Thanks to all the wonderful support you guys have given me so far, you get me closer and closer along this path. This song and this video are the next step and I can't wait to make it happen with all of you on board.

Honestly, when I started toying with the idea of doing this campaign I was worried I wouldn't raise I dime. But every time I have doubts about my art, you guys continue to show me just how much you care. Thank you for believing in me

Other Ways You Can Help

Even those of you who can't make financial contributions, I understand. You can help out in other ways! Share this link to your Facebook page and tell people why it's important to contribute. Tag your friends! Whatever you can do helps :)

story:
D'ici une semaine, nous devons avoir assemblée la somme de 5700$ ou la banque reprend le chalet de location!! Tout ça pour seulement 3 mois de retard dans les paiements d’hypothèque, suite à une petite série de malchances..! Elles, les banques, qui font des milliards de profits, viendraient enlever le projet d’une vie, le projet d’une communauté..!!

Benoit Lasalle, le propriétaire l'a construit lui-même: c'est le projet d’une vie, où est née la plus grande de ses filles. Maintenant qu'il a construit sa maison de hobbit, plus haut sur la montagne, cette oeuvre grandiose sert maintenant de chalet de location, dont une partie des revenus sert à la construction d'une petite éco-communauté sur cette même montagne, avec la hobbit. Si nous pouvons sauver le chalet, très bientôt toutes sortes de projets naîtront et des formations y seront données et tous pourront amener leur créativité et ensembles co-créer ce monde bien meilleur dont nous rêvons tous!

UN POUR TOUS, ET TOUS POUR L’INUKSUK!!! ~

Le site du chalet de location: http://mamaisondeboisrond.com/

Information sur le projet de communauté: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/eco-village-...

story:
SUMMARY

My name is Ganey Arsement, and I am a songwriter/performer. For twenty years, I have played Cajun music around the globe with some of the greatest bands and artists in the genre.

In 2013, I released my first solo recording of original Cajun, Zydeco, Country and Folk music. With roughly half of the songs in English, it was my first time to explore outside the realm of Cajun music. The recording, Le Forgeron, was well received. It was played by over 150 radio stations worldwide and garnered chart positions as high as #9 on the Freeform American Roots chart and #13 on the Alternate Roots 66 chart.

Le Forgeron was partly funded by a grant from the Louisiana Division of the Arts, and it was completed with a successful crowd-funding campaign. Through the whole process, I learned a lot. I met many, many people, and not only did I gain new fans, but I also made new friends. 

I am ready to record and release a new solo Folk Roots album, and this is where I need your help. 

HOW YOU CAN HELP AND WHAT YOU WILL GET?

I am seeking to raise funds so that I can not only record and release a new album, but also promote it. Ultimately, the success of any recording project is determined by its reach. Publicity, airplay and promotion all play valuable roles in the success of an album.  I am prepared to offer some interesting and unique perks including, but not limited to, a warm fuzzy feeling, a private house concert for you and twenty guests or a song written specifically for you.

WHAT IS IT?

This album will contain 10-12 songs in the Folk, Country and Cajun genres with very minimal instrumentation. Most likely, two of the songs will be covers of previously recorded songs, but all of the remaining songs were written by me.

The lyrics draw from my life experiences while growing up in southwest Louisiana including people I have known, life changing events and a life long love/hate relationship with trains.

Some of the influences that you will hear are Leadbelly, Bob Wills, Buddy Miller, George Jones and Hank Williams.

WHAT ELSE CAN YOU DO?

In a perfect world, everyone who sees this campaign will contribute, but I understand that it doesn't happen that way. Some folks will gladly contribute, some will want to but can't and others will just move on. It's all good. I understand that. All I ask is that you share this link with your friends on FaceBook, Twitter, Instagram, or whatever means that you have. There may be someone out there who can help. Every share counts.

Thanks!

Ganey Arsement

I am ready to record and release a new solo Folk Roots album, and this is where I need your help.    HOW YOU CAN HELP AND WHAT YOU WILL GET? I am seeking to raise funds so that I can not only record and release a new album, but also promote it. Ultimately, the success of any recording project is determined by its reach. Publicity, airplay and promotion all play valuable roles in the success of an album.  I am prepared to offer some interesting and unique perks including, but not limited to, a warm fuzzy feeling, a private house concert for you and twenty guests or a song written specifically for you.
    WHAT IS IT? This album will contain 10-12 songs in the Folk, Country and Cajun genres with very minimal instrumentation. Most likely, two of the songs will be covers of previously recorded songs, but all of the remaining songs were written by me.
The lyrics draw from my life experiences while growing up in southwest Louisiana including people I have known, life changing events and a life long love/hate relationship with trains.
Some of the influences that you will hear are Leadbelly, Bob Wills, Buddy Miller, George Jones and Hank Williams.

    WHAT ELSE CAN YOU DO? In a perfect world, everyone who sees this campaign will contribute, but I understand that it doesn't happen that way. Some folks will gladly contribute, some will want to but can't and others will just move on. It's all good. I understand that. All I ask is that you share this link with your friends on FaceBook, Twitter, Instagram, or whatever means that you have. There may be someone out there who can help. Every share counts.
Thanks!
Ganey Arsement

story:
Short Summary

We are BC13 or better known as BrokenCYDE, we have appeared on TV, Radio and anywhere else people would have us! We have had songs on the Billboard Top 200 chart and music video's go viral with views in the millions. We have been around the world headlining shows signing autographs, doing shots, parting in your towns and we never want it to stop! None of this would have ever happened without the continued support of YOU our fans. So we ask you to team up with us again to make music happen! It's not been an easy path making music, but it's our love of creating music that keeps us pushing through. This is a new start for us, our next move is to TAKE IT ALL BACK! Its time we do what we want, when we want and how we want to do it! Our goal is to become independent of the label by raising money to fund our music! With your help, we can raise enough money to finish and release our next album! The money we raise will cover recording, marketing and maybe some touring expenses. With your help we can make this dream come true! This is the first step in gaining our independence from having to rely on the financial support of a label to release our music. We are determined to change this cycle, so here we go!



 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise 30,000 dollars. This funding would be what we need to finish our album and properly advertise it on the market so we can be heard. The recording and marketing process is expensive from start to finish.  We have put everything into writing this album, now we need to finish it and get it out to you! 

Recording Costs:

Studio Rental

Engineer Pay

Producer Pay

Mixing Engineer

Mastering House

Misc. Equipment Rental

Marketing Costs:

Album Artwork Creation

Album Manufacturing

Music Video 

Music Video Marketing

Radio Marketing

Publicist

Online Marketing 

If we exceed our funding goal, that money would go towards our touring expenses, gas, food (Taco Bell), transportation, lodging, etc. You know how much we love coming to your town and putting on a show! So with your help, we can make all this happen!

Of course there are awesome perks for your financial support! You can check them all out on the right side of this page! 

We have created some exclusive merchandise that is only available here on Indiegogo!  Hoodies, T-shirts, Posters, etc. we will never be printing these items again! 



We also came up with some really cool perks for you! Customized signed guitars, framed hand written lyrics, record with us on one of our songs, or how about we come to your pad and dj your party of a lifetime or a backstage pass good for life!  

The Impact

The impact this campaign will have on our music career is priceless. This is going to change the future of how we do music, this is going to give us, the artists, the ability to make decisions for ourselves. We won't have to do what the guy in the suit says, we can give YOU our fans what YOU want! This is our future, we NEED your help claiming it!

Risks & Challenges

We have seen our share of challenges in the past and I'm sure we will have plenty more. We have taken some hard hits, been up against plenty obstacles but we ALWAYS come out on top because this is what we live for. Our history proves we won't fail we fight through it because BC 13 will never die!! We take risks like this because in the end we know it will pay off!  

Other Ways You Can Help

You say there is no way you can afford to contribute financially but you want to help! YOU CAN! Share, Share, Share! Tell all your friends about this campaign on Facebook, shout out on twitter, make a video about it and we will put it on our social media, lets make some noise! All these things help us get the exposure we need to accomplish our goals! You have no idea how much that means to us! Check out the Indiegogo share tools available for other sharing options>

story:
Pre-order KyAzMa's The Magician's Mirror

KyAzMa (www.kyazma.ca) is raising money to launch their debut album "The Magician's Mirror". You can pre-order a copy through this indiegogo campaign, along with t-shirts, and limited edition 45 rpm vinyl. The TIME IS NOW to jump on board with KyAzMa. As a thank-you, early campaign contributors will have first access to The Magician's Mirror, as well as the opportunity to grab exclusive and limited edition perks. 


About Ky∆zMa

KyAzMa is a crossing: it is an electronic-folk band based in Montreal that merges acoustic instrumentation (piano and guitar) with bass-heavy down-tempo beats. For the past 2 years the band has been in the studio recording their debut album The Magician's Mirror, as well as preforming their music across Canada and the United States.

Ky∆zMa's "Eve" Video



Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/kyazma

For booking: info@kyazma.ca


Join Ky∆zMa's email list for new tour dates and band news:  JOIN MAILING LIST!

story:
So this is the story, honey
I do stuff I shouldn't do...

I made this tune.

NOW it needs a video to get properly promoted!!!

So this is (obviously, what else could it be?) a thing about true love.

The truest love you can figure, as a matter of fact. That implies...
I wrote this thing some 12 years back, when I was broke and thought music could be a way of making up some quick cash, but I really needed some inspiration. My life was faaaaar too dull and peacefull for any real storymaking...

So to be able to write this tune, I fell desperately in love, (the right thing to do, no? Nothing sells like a true-love love story!)
And as we all know: It is allways a good way to solve economical and practical problems to fall head over heels in love... with someone you shouldn't, who is with some other chap and who wouldn't really, while one is trying to fix whatever love- and lifemess one's already in.

Now...
That kinda worked out... For a while.
True love was formally established and confirmed.
Thus: No more need for messy tunes. And love trumps everything, so gone was my economical needs as well. Oh Bliss!

And then life moved on, and as I fell in love with one (true love, of course) and she with another (even truer love than all the mentioned loves, I'd say) and we with eachother again and...
Well you get the idea. Tons of materials for silly soapoperas and larger than life epics, for sure! I had finally aquired an interesting life!
But now I had no time for making songs and videos about it.

Fortunately, I had that issue fixed.


Now... If any - or all - of the above had been true, (the love, the story-about-the-story, or anything even vaguelly resembling either) life would've been a real and true and pretty mess, I guess. WIth a bit of stress.
But fortunately, that's not how it all panned out, I wouldn't have known how to handle all that drama.


This is still a fun string of thoughts to play if I may, I'd say, so just for the heck of it... I do I do I do.
Even in all its distant abstractions and unrealistic perspectives.

But the tune itself is very real and has kinda stuck as the years have passed, and I moved from making music to quickfix whatever economical needs I might have had, to imagery. Trying to solve pretty much the same mess, if it ever was present. Or not when it wasn't

And finally, I had gone full circle, with a bit of time on my hand and this old tune, which I really think could make it, if I only had a video to promote it. Check it out on youtube (the link is on the top here), or make a donation and download the mp3...


So... because all of this didn't really happen, I was about to cancel the campaign, but as I was sitting here dreaming away and writing all this, real-life was probing me with a stick! I was given a parkingticket - out of the blue, and my world allmost fell apart.

NOW it's personal. I (as I see it) got a ticket for starting this campaign, and as a matter of fact, I have a few others to pay, when I think of it, so I guess I'll just have to go on with this. Nothing else would make any sense at all, at this time and place.

(yup, I'll upload an image as a proof...)

And as a result of what could have happened if any or all or allmost nothing of the above was true, I need to clean up my act and pay, and what would be a better way to do that, than to launch a gogo campaign to spread the beautiful message of simple and pure and eternal and uncomplicated love to the world?
And fund a proper musicvideo for the tune.

This campaign suddenly gained a larger than life purpose, that is:
Rise the money needed for paying the ticket (which kinda involves paying off some older stiff that I have aquired in the pursue of true and unfaltering love). So I started a bit of budgeting.
What has this song cost me?
And what do I need to get even and make that video and pay that ticket?

And (as a by-the-by), I wouldn't mind falling in love again - so I should factor that in, too - when doing my calculus, but who would ever fall in love with a person with an unpaid parkingticket?

This calls for action!


Next up, was deciding what my goals are...
A bit of budgeting.

Well... I have some friends and a camera (...and a parking ticket), but still kit and studio and people tend to have some cost....

Parking tickets so far: 
300$

Parking tickets for the rest of the project:

300$
(I'll really try hard not to get one each day!)

The "falling in love" part needed to write this tune and make the video, has been rather expensive. Around 250k$ a pop, and still counting. And I have to factor in falling in love once more to make the campaign a success. So I guess with a bit of luck and adjusting for inflation, that'll come in at 900k$ all in all:

So far:
900.600$

Whew, this is quite a challenge allready...
But let's not forget that bigger wonders have happened in the music industry!
Keep the faith. I have one shot at this!
(If not, I'll have to find another, right?)

So, that's tickets and love. Basics... But still no video.
Now... I spent a couple of months doing this tune and got a lot of my musician friends to give me freebs playing, so I guess that is done for allready, but I should should factor in 20% to the musicians, or I guess tthe friendships might end in the expense account - given the tremendous success I foresee for this tune, if I manage to make the video, and we don't want that do we?

Now... Producing this video...

It will move on slowly. And possibly in several iterations, depending on the funding of-course.
I need some in-loveable girls (don't we all, if it isn't men we're looking for) a bit of lights, and something to eat.

I guess I'll be shooting for 3 days with a friendly budget of 1500 $ each.
That'll do for the catering, and a few fees to people attending.

I plan to use a car for 3 days doing timelapses of driving.
That's gonna be 350$ for petrol, food and sleeping each day.

1050$

AND
I'll need to edit and work this thing out in post.
That's about a week more work. Let's put those days down at 500$ a shot, so I can eat, get a parking ticket, have a smoke & paying the studio rent.

3500$

 

So that gives us this budget:

Lovestories + anticipated future loveproblems: 900.000,- $

Parking tickets:                                              600,- $

Shooting people:                                          4.500,- $

Shooting roads:                                            1.050,- $

Post                                                            3.500,- $

And I'd like to grab a beer and some
smokes tonight and live in Norway                    250,- $

Musicians (20% of the above)                     181.980,- $        

 

I have some other stuff I could put in here, but I guess this will have to do.
That's a grand total of:                            1.091.880,- $

That's a bit of cash... 
But I guess that's what I'll need to cover my expenses.

NOW
Gogo has this policy of witholding a percentage of the funds if you don't reach your goal. That'd be 9%, but if you reach it, they only take 4%, so I guess I'll set the goal at 500$, and just hope to be slightly overfunded.

Then paypal takes another 4'ish%, so I have to factor that in too, if I wanna pay my tickets.

All in all we're lookin at another 10% on top of the above, and there's allways other unexpected expenses (another 10%)...

Total campaign goal looks thus to be:
1.310.256,- USD


But WAIT!!!
Let's recap!
I need:
906.400,- in hard liquid cash to pay my 150$ parking ticket, pay for past and incomming affairs AND reach world domination, right?

And then there is:
20% for musicians
10% for campaign fees
10% for unexpected expenses

But I still allmost forgot - that'd be disastrous!:
28% for government tax
20% for company overhead.

That means that my available cut to pay parking tickets, videoproduction and past and future affairs only represents 12% of the money needed to pay the 150$ fine aquired.

The actual gross ambition for this campaign is thus

7.553.333,85 $

Oh... Geee...

Glad someone taught me budgeting!
The last little thing to factor in is the production of and maintainment of this campaign... 
Well... Let's not get greedy here, shall we? I'll throw that in as another freeb!

I am sooo glad this is not a true storry, because if it was, it appears like I would be rather heavily messed up! 

So... I have a number...
That's kinda 125.888,90 $ a day for the campaign period...
Now... That's gonna be challenging...
This thingy better go viral!

So this is how that works:
If you like the campaign/music/video or just think that this is kinda fun'ish, you spread this youtube video, llink to the campaign and buy as much or as little as you can/want/need/desire of the perks.

Send it out to friends and relatives, because - realistically - I myself don't have 7,5 mill friends to ask for a buck each, and that's what I'd have needed, if there was an easy way to fund all this... :)

Fianlly...

I have a few issues as to perks and how to make them atractive, but I am open for suggestions...
Obviously, with a start-off deficit of this magnitude, it will be hard to offer stuff that costs money, and time is hard too, as I have to finnish the movie, and work on my obnoxious pop-star-to-be chops. And I cannot dance, like the Gangnam dude (I could try, though...)

So I'll start with a few perks and add as I get suggestions as to what people would like from this.

One of my issues here is that a lot of what I do is public anyway, and I am really not into starting off on a secretive lifestyle just now...

And really final words...
There are some suggestions from gogo as to keeping things realistic, and I really try to do that, but there are conflicting realities involved...

On one hand, there is the reality of what is needed to make this video and pay the parking-ticket. That is conservatively in the 7.5 mill$ region.

On the other hand, there is the realistic goal of a campaign like this and keeping the gogo fees down...

So I have chosen to let both these realities reflect in the text, the video and the campaign...

Presumably I can rise the goal as funding evolves.

A few more final words:
I need to get this thing into mainstream media as well, to reach these goals, so please bomb your local newspapers, ask for the tune on radiostations and request the video for MTV and other music shows.

I'll even show up for an interview, if requested.

As I haven't practised my singing chops for the last 10 years, I don't think the live/accoustic thingy is a good plan, but if paid sufficiently, I'll even show up for that!

I'll make that a perk...


OK... Now I'm done... ! (Really promise)
So what do I do if I get overfunded (that is beyond the 7.5 mill$ mark, just to be clear...)

I guess I'll rent some grip... Like rails or maybe a moviebird to get some cool shots in there...  I might also buy a house and a car, if the overfunding is sufficient, and practice my obnoxious popstar chops. But I really hadn't plan to do all that before the tune itself (and the video I wanna make) is a huge hit...

I guess I could try to divide my eternal and unfaltering love on a couple of more individuals, and I might grab an extra beer.

Dunno really, haven't thought that far.
But I'll keep you posted!

 

So...

Now it's fully up to you!
Make my dream come true!

Cheers!

Gunleik

I'll throw that in as another freeb!I am sooo glad this is not a true storry, because if it was, it appears like I would be rather heavily messed up! So... I have a number...That's kinda 125.888,90 $ a day for the campaign period...Now... That's gonna be challenging...This thingy better go viral!So this is how that works:If you like the campaign/music/video or just think that this is kinda fun'ish, you spread this youtube video, llink to the campaign and buy as much or as little as you can/want/need/desire of the perks.Send it out to friends and relatives, because - realistically - I myself don't have 7,5 mill friends to ask for a buck each, and that's what I'd have needed, if there was an easy way to fund all this... :)Fianlly...
I have a few issues as to perks and how to make them atractive, but I am open for suggestions... Obviously, with a start-off deficit of this magnitude, it will be hard to offer stuff that costs money, and time is hard too, as I have to finnish the movie, and work on my obnoxious pop-star-to-be chops. And I cannot dance, like the Gangnam dude (I could try, though...)So I'll start with a few perks and add as I get suggestions as to what people would like from this.One of my issues here is that a lot of what I do is public anyway, and I am really not into starting off on a secretive lifestyle just now...And really final words...There are some suggestions from gogo as to keeping things realistic, and I really try to do that, but there are conflicting realities involved...On one hand, there is the reality of what is needed to make this video and pay the parking-ticket. That is conservatively in the 7.5 mill$ region.On the other hand, there is the realistic goal of a campaign like this and keeping the gogo fees down...So I have chosen to let both these realities reflect in the text, the video and the campaign...Presumably I can rise the goal as funding evolves.A few more final words:I need to get this thing into mainstream media as well, to reach these goals, so please bomb your local newspapers, ask for the tune on radiostations and request the video for MTV and other music shows.I'll even show up for an interview, if requested.As I haven't practised my singing chops for the last 10 years, I don't think the live/accoustic thingy is a good plan, but if paid sufficiently, I'll even show up for that!I'll make that a perk...OK... Now I'm done... ! (Really promise)So what do I do if I get overfunded (that is beyond the 7.5 mill$ mark, just to be clear...)I guess I'll rent some grip... Like rails or maybe a moviebird to get some cool shots in there...  I might also buy a house and a car, if the overfunding is sufficient, and practice my obnoxious popstar chops. But I really hadn't plan to do all that before the tune itself (and the video I wanna make) is a huge hit...I guess I could try to divide my eternal and unfaltering love on a couple of more individuals, and I might grab an extra beer.Dunno really, haven't thought that far.But I'll keep you posted!
 
So...
Now it's fully up to you!Make my dream come true!Cheers!Gunleik

story:
Become a backer of the hottest new music on the Planet Earth.

Why we need money:

1. music project. Music CD and extra music and content.

My name is Angie, from Angie and the Cool Network. I write songs and I sing. I spent over 2 years putting the songs together for this project and it's time to finish it and get it out to the world. I want to complete a music project featuring my voice and my music, a jazz set and  a soul/R&B set. The project will contain mostly original music and covertunes.  

It will contain Live music performances by my band,  Angie and the Cool Network, recorded by live recording specialist, Dave Tilley. Dave Tilley uses a rare and precious technique for capturing live music.   Also included in the project are:  recordings with mixer/engineer/producer, Brian Cid whose credits include Snoop Dogg, Lady Gaga, Beyonce, Talib Kweli, Rihanna, and now me. The project will include  Upright bassist, Craig Akin, also keyboardist/programmer/producers Robert and Willard Meeks whose credits include Whitney Houston, Elton John, Donnie Mcclurklin, Kanye West. 

The compact disc will be in a beautiful hard bound case and include a CD insert booklet with tons of photography, artwork, lyrics, and design. It will also contain a "thanks for being a VIP backer section."

The VINYL will be a collectors item available EXCLUSIVELY TO BACKERS ONLY! It will come in a gorgeous package. It will include all the audio from the CD plus all the artwork, photography, design, and lyrics SUPER SIZED. This will be an over the top treasure. It will also include the "thanks for being a backer section". It will be a limited edition item. It will also contain a dedicated page for EXECUTIVE VIP.

2. Tour Support and promotion

We will need money to support and promote our live shows and performances with my band. 

Why we need the money:

We will pay the indie go go fee. We will also use the money for finishing touches and recording, mixing, mastering, packaging, licensing, travel expenses, and tour promotion. We'll need a team of professionals as well as fans to spread the word. We'll need initial promotion and publicity money to  promote our tour dates, advertise and market on social media like facebook, twitter, blogs, radio, and new website.

story:
Hi! I'm the WILLIAMSBOY!

I'm a singer/songwriter. My buddies and I need your help. I am asking people like you to help me in raising money to record an album. With this album I'm going to involve YOU- the DONORS. It will be because of YOU that this album comes to life. In giving this album life you will be able to help in NAMING it. PICKING THE SONGS, & DESIGNINg it. songs can be picked from my soundcloud page which you can find by going to soundcloud.com/matthew-billy-williams the songs with the most PLAYS will appear on the album 

WHAT YOU GET FOR DONATING:

           for donating you will get REWARDS! of which are listed to the right. 

SUBMITTING  ALBUM NAME/DESIGN/LAYOUT

email me your ideas!: williamsboy@me.com

 

Enter YOUR SONG SELECTION will be calculated by how many (plays) songs on my Soundcloud Page received by October funding deadline.

E-mail me YOUR CHOICE for the album Name

E-mail me YOUR CHOICE for the album Design

SELECTION PROCESS:

 Once the October funding deadline is reached, I will post a list of YOUR CHOICES to be voted on by YOU. Donors will be notified via updates here on indiegog.com or if you have signed my mailing list at http://www.williamsboy.com by email. Be respectful and tasteful when it comes to naming the album and desiging the album. I will not select any inappropriate material

 ***IMPORTANT:*** You Must be a DONOR for name,design.

 

Thank you for taking your time to be here. With your help this album will become possible and you will be a part of a great record, & be contributing to a legacy.

story:
UPDATE:  As of 1/12/16, you did it!  Thanks to your generosity, we made our $6000 goal. But don't forget that this amount only covers our recording engineer. Any additional donations above our goal amount will also go towards the CD project costs, including space rental, music copying, design, etc. Thank you! 


Project Summary

Jouyssance Early Music Ensemble, supported by The Foundation of the Neo-Renaissance, is currently the city's only year-round ensemble specializing in Medieval and Renaissance music.   We are absolutely thrilled to be in the planning stages for our 3rd CD recording project, and here is your chance to participate! 

Jouyssance has explored the music of the Iberian peninsula in concert many times over the years, including last year's popular holiday extravaganza, An Iberian Twelfth Night.   In response to numerous requests for a new CD from friends and audience members, we will be recording classic and rare choral repertoire from Spanish, Portuguese, and New World composers entitled Cantiga: An Early Music Journey Through Iberia. The album will present a collection of astonishingly beautiful music including favorites by Guerrero, Morales, and Victoria, as well as lesser-known works by Portuguese composers Cristo, Fernandes, Fonseca and Cardoso.  Few recordings of these masterworks are currently available, and Jouyssance is proud to devote an album to this sumptuous repertoire. 

What We Need, Our Plans and Process, and What You Get

We have a simple goal for this crowdfunding campaign:  $6000 to pay for the recording engineer and the mastering and editing process for the album.   We are currently planning on recording in the early summer of 2016, with our "advance CD" perks delivered prior to an official CD launch at the start of our 2016-17 season in October.   

Jouyssance has successfully produced two CDs to date.  We have selected an experienced and dedicated recording engineer to manage the process, and our Artistic Director Nicole Baker will select and rehearse the repertoire with great care and deliberation.  

In contributing to our crowdfunding goal, you will receive in return our eternal gratitude, the satisfaction of having personally furthered Jouyssance's mission of making the priceless cultural heritage of early choral music available and relevant to contemporary audiences, and, if you like, one of our fun (and valuable!) perks.

And don't forget that Jouyssance (under the umbrella of the Foundation of the Neo-Renaissance) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit and all contributions are tax deductible!

What happens if we do not meet our goal?  The funds received will remain dedicated to the recording project, and we will reevaluate our timeline to seek additional funding sources.  We are dedicated to this project and we will see it through, keeping our donors informed of any updates to plans and schedules.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have funds to contribute to this project right now, but you still care about Jouyssance and early choral music in the Los Angeles region, there are other ways that you can help!   Please feel free to share our campaign with your friends and family online and in person.   We are also happy to discuss other contributions of time and advice with our audience and friends - please contact us at info@jouyssance.org or 213-533-9922.  


More on Jouyssance Early Music Ensemble

Jouyssance Early Music Ensemble is a Los Angeles-based choral group dedicated to revitalizing music of the Medieval, Renaissance and early Baroque periods. Under the artistic direction of Dr. Nicole Baker, Jouyssance presents innovative public performances demonstrating artistic excellence and informed by deep musicological scholarship to make this extraordinary and often-neglected repertoire available and accessible to contemporary audiences. Jouyssance is the principal program of the Foundation of the Neo-Renaissance, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization founded in 1967.

Jouyssance performs an annual series of three concert programs in the greater Los Angeles area. The group honors the tradition of historically informed performance practice, seeking to re-create the music as it might have sounded at the time it was written. Performances frequently include accompaniment on period instruments.

The repertoire includes music from the 9th through the early 17th centuries, often featuring such major figures as Machaut, Dufay, Josquin, Palestrina, Lassus, and Monteverdi. The group explores complex works rarely attempted by similar groups, such as Brumel’s 12-part Missa Et Ecce Terrae Motus and Carver’s Mass for six voices.  Concerts showcase music not only from every corner of Europe, but also from non-Western traditions from around the globe, such as Canadian First Nations, Mexico and Guatemala, Bolivia and Peru, the Ukraine, Ethiopia, Byzantium, India, China, and the Philippines.

Jouyssance aims to educate audiences in ways that engage and inspire. During concerts, Dr. Baker shares her insights into the repertoire with the audience, frequently peppering her comments with humorous, informative anecdotes that help bring the music and its composers to life.  Program notes for each concert include texts and translations that supplement the discussion with scholarly rigor. 

Jouyssance is recognized as one of the premiere vocal ensembles in Southern California, and is the only regularly performing vocal group in Los Angeles dedicated to exploring music before 1650. Jouyssance has released two CDs, Jouyssance Early Music Ensemble and A Tour of Christmases Past. Both are available for purchase on iTunes and Amazon.com.
