story:
Music Maker for mobile devices

               A.K.A.

A studio in your hands...

Democratising Music Production

Children, teens, and young adults in the poorest areas who cannot afford the laptop, software, library of sounds, amplifier, or high end smart phones etc mostly seem to have some of the latest cheaper smart phones.

The aim is to provide anyone with even the most basic/small smart phone, with the ability to produce their own music, backing, mixes. 

These smart phone users will have access to a low cost "Studio in your hands!" (Basic version will be free).

4M - My Mobile Music Maker will enable users to be engaged creators, not just consumers of other peoples' content. 

Sound packs will be created in an ever broadening catalogue, and through collaborations with artists throughout Africa, the Middle East, Europe, and beyond, will extend across many genres, instruments and sounds.

One important aim is to make it, and keep it, simple to use.

Prototype has been tested successfully on Android, Windows 7, 8, 10, for PC, and Windows 8 for Tablet.

So, what is My Mobile Music Maker?

An on screen music maker for mobile users, complete with a selection of sounds, enabling the user to play around with drum rhythms, bass-lines, chords, melodies, and sound effects, 
Create a variety of pieces of music in a range of genres and styles including: Techno, Soundtrack, Hip Hop, Dubstep, Chill, House, Pop Rock, Traditional, ...and many more

Backer Rewards:

All backers will receive a personal email thanking them for support, in addition to access to the prototypes, voting input and items as per perk listing.


Unique for backers – pre-release versions will have a unique graphic set proudly displaying status as a backer, and will come with extra sound packs.

Registered users will have input on future development priorities – if the majority wants EDM, Reggae, or classic 60's rock, we’ll start there!

Prototypes are available now for Micro and Mini, though final release will change, and backers will have free access to the new releases. 

Backing this project:

The aim is to raise funds to cover costs for developing the prototype further, to the production version. The road-map offers a staggered release schedule, micro, then standard then silver and gold versions.

If successful in raising a higher amount, extended goals would include

  • faster production of a substantial range of additional sound packs, 
  • employment of additional team members 
  • development of a full time studio to provide training opportunities etc.

If we fail the schedule will be slowed but never stopped...

Examples on Soundcloud:

There are a couple of basic example mashups on soundcloud to demonstrate what will be possible with the music-maker..

https://soundcloud.com/4m-music-com

Background – the why?

I was looking for a music application for the smart phone – as even the fairly entry level smart phone is a very capable device these days.

All that I found were pretty limited ‘drum box/beat maker’ type applications, mostly limited to a basic set of functions, and typically a very basic set of sounds. 

Even some of the more complete apps seem complex to use and quite confining, for example allowing you to opt between only limited numbers of bass-lines, drum patterns etc. so that all mixes pretty much end up sounding the same.

Background – the answer:

Drawing upon a library of tools and sounds, I have created the foundation for a more capable, substantial, and flexible application designed to enable mobile users to make their own music, even on the smallest of touch screens.

While continuing to develop and enhance the application, a lot of effort will also go into the production of a wide range of supporting sound banks, to unleash the creativity in everyone from school kids having a break from homework,  to adults waiting for a bus!

Future Features:

Subject to device, OS, and platform capabilities,

  • Sync on/off by beat, by bar etc., 
  • Tempo adjust
  • Bank mix and match – sound audition/selection – ‘custom layout’
  • Import sounds – add-on packs, and/or use your own, use as beat-maker to create a beat, bass-line etc, and then use that to build a full mix...
  • Record/playback, Sequencer
  • Volume mixer (per sound), Sound Effects – e.g.: stutter, pan...
  • Sound names on pads 
  • ...and other features including user requests...

Future Products:

  • Production of various dedicated editions with default sounds, as well as add-on packs targeting a specific genre...for example: Back to basics – enabling production of chord sequences, bass-lines, drum beats
  • Beats & Bass-lines, Techno, Soundtrack, Rock, Country, World Music, etc...
  • Windows Edition - for (touch) notebooks, Windows Phone Edition and others...

story:
Texto en español

(English text below)

El Proyecto

Uno de los mejores intérpretes de la guitarra clásica en el mundo. Uno de los ensembles iberoamericanos más distinguidos. ¿Qué más se necesita para grabar el mejor álbum discográfico para guitarra y orquesta con música iberoamericana? Quizá un estudio de primera clase y un destacado ingeniero de sonido. Y es por eso que nosotros, Asociación Música Iberoamericana (las personas detrás de este proyecto), solicitamos tu apoyo. 

Después de años de planificación y programación, finalmente hemos logrado reunir a todos los artistas. Sin embargo, esta única e inusual oportunidad es costosa. 

Antes de iniciar nuestra campaña de crowdfunding nos queremos asegurar de que este album sea tan importante para ti como lo es para nosotros. De la misma manera que comprarás este cd después de su lanzamiento, lo puedes hacer antes y así nosotros usaríamos los fondos para remunerar a todas las personas que hacen posible este proyecto. 

La Música

Aquí está el listado de los temas, tres de los conciertos más destacados para guitarra y orquesta de la música latinoamericana del siglo XX:

Manuel María Ponce, “El concierto del sur” (México, 1941)

Leo Brouwer, “Concierto elegíaco” (Cuba, 1986)

Heitor Villa-lobos, “Concierto para guitarra y orquesta” (Brazil, 1951)

¡Y un tema extra sorpresa!

El Costo

Y aquí está el desglose de nuestros gastos:

Master CD: 5300 €

Renta del material (partituras)+ GEMA (derechos de autor): 3500 €

Honorarios de los músicos (viaje, hospedaje, comidas para 28 integrantes): 2700 €

Otros (costos de administración, renta de estudio de grabación): 1400 €

Total: 12900 €


Ricardo Gallén y el Ensemble Iberoamericano nunca han estado más emocionados con una oportunidad tan valiosa como esta. ¡Únete a nuestro equipo y exprésate contribuyendo en este proyecto! 

¡Ayúdanos a promocionar la maravillosa cultura iberoamericana!

Elige y adquiere uno (o ¿dos?) de los premios que se encuentran a la derecha de esta página y ¡difunde el mensaje! Nuestra más profunda gratitud por todo tu apoyo. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

English text

The Project

One of the greatest classical guitar artists. One of the most notable Ibero-American ensembles. What else could you possibly need to record the most extraordinary CD of Ibero-American music? Perhaps, a world-class studio and an outstanding audio engineer, and that is why we, Música Iberoamericana e.V. (the people behind this project), are asking for your support.

After years of planning and scheduling, we’ve been finally able to bring all the artists together. Yet, of course, this rarest and most unique opportunity is costly.

By launching this crowdfunding campaign we want to make sure, that this record is as important to you, as it is to us. The very same way you would buy the cd after its completion, you would buy it before. And we would use these funds to pay the people who make this project happen. 

The Music

Here is the track list, three of the most remarkable concerts for guitar and orchestra of the Latin American 20th century music:

Manuel María Ponce, “El Concierto del Sur” (Mexico, 1941)

Leo Brouwer, “Concierto Elegíaco” (Cuba, 1986)

Heitor Villa-Lobos, “Concierto para Guitarra y Orquesta” (Brazil, 1951)

And a surprise bonus track!

The Costs

Here is the general breakdown of our costs:

Master CD: 5300 €

Rental of materials + GEMA (recording rights): 3500 €

Costs for the 28 musicians (travelling, accommodations, meals): 2700 €

Others (administration costs, rental of recording studio): 1400 €

Total: 12900 €


Ricardo and the ensemble have never been more excited. An opportunity like this is invaluable. Join our team and express yourself by contributing to this project!

Help us promote genuine Ibero-American culture!

Choose and acquire one (or two?) of the awards on the right side of this webpage and spread the word! Endless gratitude for you support!

story:
Who we are and what we do (español abajo)

We are a nonprofit community group called "Agrupación Educacional waldorf pichilemu" which has been in activity since 2012.

We are located in Pichilemu, a small city in the sixth region of Chile. Pichilemu is magical village that mixes the countryside and the sea, is rich in its traditions, ancient trades, fishing, farming and arts.

 Our mission is to give children and young people of the community, the opportunity to discover and develop their different abilities and skills, to know and learn different trades, and to strengthen their talents that will be useful to them during their life.

Our initiative aims to deliver all the other enriching learning, such as arts, sports and crafts at the appropriate pace that does not alter the child's rhythm and balanced development.

In our space children work the ground, carpentry, ceramics, plastic arts, textiles, pastry and cooking, surfing and swimming, opening much of this classes, with no costs, to the whole community of the town.

The Impact

Chile is going through a difficult time with education. Conventional schools stresses children with only intellectual knowledge, memory learning, and is every year giving less importance to the learning of art, music and sports. More often we can see stressed children, unhappy, depressed, with lack of creativity, full of homework's and no time to practice whatever hobbie they like to do. 

The practices that are offering the majority of conventional schools does not correspond with a quality education that respects the infancy of the children, and that focuses the learning from the freedom of choice, the existential learning, the respect, the love for the nature and the work of the emotions and of the affective links.

These is why a group of parents and teachers got together 4 years ago and form these non profit community organization, to offer children from all pichilemu, the possibility of learning and practicing all what conventional education is no longer interested in teaching children. Arts and handwork traditional to these town (clay work, woodwork, wool weaving work), sports. Because of its high costs, we have not been able to teach our children musical instruments, they only practice the flute. We see in them the interest and need of knowing other instruments, to have more time of music classes and enrich themselves with its magic.

What We Want To Do

Since a year ago, our dream has been to build a music room, so that the children can learn different types of instruments such as the piano, violin, guitar, percussion, singing, among others. This will give them the opportunity to approach the world of music.

Locally there is no place where children can learn music nor instruments, and we believe that our children should have  the opportunity to get close to music, learn a musical instrument; to make music with others; to learn to sing; and to have the opportunity to progress to the next level of excellence if they wish to, and become virtuous musicians. What would happen if one of these kids have a marvelous talent for music, but never have the opportunity to get close to  it? You can make these happen and help the next generation of musicians develop. With one action, you could change someones future.

With your valuable help, we could make this dream possible. And give our kids their dreamed space for making music, much of them would otherwise never have the opportunity to learn a musical instrument. We need to build a music room, and purchase musical instruments.

Why music?

Theres are lots of researches that prove all the benefits of music. Whether a child is meant to be the next Bach or more likely to sing  solos in the shower, they all  benefit from some form of music education. Research shows that learning the do-re-mis can help children excel in ways beyond the basic ABCs. Making music involves more than the voice or fingers playing an instrument; a child learning about music has to tap into multiple skill sets, often simultaneously. 

Music making can be a dynamic social learning experience. Making music together, children learn to work as a team, while they  contribute to the song in their own way. At the same time, music helps children learn that together they can make something larger than the sum of its parts.

For children, music provides many, many benefits. Experts agree, there are lots of good things about letting your child learn to play an instrument.

-It will boost their brain power

-It helps them socially

-It's a confidence builder

-It teaches patience

-        It teaches discipline

-          It's a great form of expression

-          Creatively music is good for the body, soul and spirit.

What We Need & What You Get

We'd like to give every  children in pichilemu a  chance to learn music at no cost to them.

We need  15.000 usd, for building and bying equipment for a complete music room (building a classroom for rehearsal and performance space, and buy all types of instruments, air, strings, percussion, piano). If we do not obtain the full fund, we will be happy to be able to buy some musical instruments, and start teaching music.

Whatever you are able to give: $10, $50, or $200, we promise it will make an impact.

Our nonprofit community has  social network accounts ( Facebook, instagram) and we will post the music classes so you will be able to see the progress of the kids in music class. 

If you support our campaign, the children will send you different gifts, mostly handmade by them. Since we are located in Chile in the far end of south america, depending on how much you donate on our cause, which gift or perk we will send you. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing this campaign with your friends can really make a difference. Please help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Like us on Facebook,  forward our campaign on to all of your friends.If you can't help us donating funds, you could help us telling your contacts our story, sharing, reposting or emailing the link to these Indiegogo proyect, or any other idea that you have will be really helpful and appreciate. Everything helps!!! 

 

 Thank you for your time and help!

 

                                   Quiénes somos y qué hacemos

Somos un grupo comunitario sin fines de lucro llamado "Agrupación Educacional waldorf pichilemu" que ha estado en actividad desde 2012.

Estamos ubicados en Pichilemu, una pequeña ciudad de la sexta región de Chile. Pichilemu es un pueblo mágico que mezcla el campo y el mar, es rico en sus tradiciones, oficios antiguos, la pesca, la agricultura y las artes.

Nuestra misión es dar a los niños y jóvenes de la comunidad la oportunidad de descubrir y desarrollar sus diferentes capacidades y habilidades, conocer y aprender diferentes oficios y fortalecer sus talentos que les serán útiles durante su vida.

Nuestra iniciativa tiene como objetivo ofrecer a todos los demás aprendizajes enriquecedores, como artes, deportes y artesanías, al ritmo adecuado que no altera el ritmo del niño y su desarrollo equilibrado.

En nuestro espacio los niños trabajan la tierra, la carpintería, la cerámica, las artes plásticas, los textiles, la pastelería y la cocina, el surf y la natación, abriendo gran parte de estas clases, sin costo, a toda la comunidad del pueblo.


El impacto

Chile atraviesa un momento difícil con la educación. Las escuelas convencionales hacen hincapié en los niños que sólo tienen conocimientos intelectuales, aprenden la memoria y cada año dan menos importancia al aprendizaje del arte, la música y los deportes. Más a menudo podemos ver a niños estresados, infelices, deprimidos, con falta de creatividad, llenos de tareas y sin tiempo para practicar lo que quieran hacer hobbie.

Las prácticas que ofrecen la mayoría de las escuelas convencionales no se corresponden con una educación de calidad que respete la infancia de los niños, y que enfoca el aprendizaje desde la libertad de elección, el aprendizaje existencial, el respeto, el amor por la naturaleza y el Trabajo de las emociones y de los vínculos afectivos.

Es por eso que un grupo de padres y maestros se reunieron hace 4 años y forman esta organización comunitaria sin fines de lucro, para ofrecer a los niños de todos los pichilemu, la posibilidad de aprender y practicar todo lo que la educación convencional ya no está interesada en enseñar a los niños. Artes y trabajo manual tradicional a estas localidades (arcilla, carpintería, tejidos de lana), deportes. Debido a sus altos costos, no hemos podido enseñar a nuestros niños instrumentos musicales, solo practican la flauta. Vemos en ellos el interés y la necesidad de conocer otros instrumentos, tener más tiempo de clases de música y enriquecerse con su magia.

 

 

Lo que queremos hacer

Desde hace un año, nuestro sueño ha sido construir una sala de música, para que los niños puedan aprender diferentes tipos de instrumentos como el piano, el violín, la guitarra, la percusión, el canto, entre otros. Esto les dará la oportunidad de acercarse al mundo de la música.

Localmente no hay lugar donde los niños puedan aprender música ni instrumentos, y creemos que nuestros hijos deben tener la oportunidad de acercarse a la música, aprender un instrumento musical; Hacer música con otros; Aprender a cantar; Y tener la oportunidad de progresar al siguiente nivel de excelencia si lo desean, y convertirse en músicos virtuosos. ¿Qué pasaría si uno de estos niños tiene un talento maravilloso para la música, pero nunca tiene la oportunidad de acercarse a ella? Usted puede hacer que estos sucedan y ayudar a la próxima generación de músicos se desarrollan. Con una acción, usted podría cambiar su futuro.

Con su valiosa ayuda, podríamos hacer posible este sueño. Y dar a nuestros hijos su espacio soñado para hacer música, muchos de ellos de otro modo nunca tendrían la oportunidad de aprender un instrumento musical. Necesitamos construir una sala de música y comprar instrumentos musicales.


¿Por qué la música?

Hay muchas investigaciones que demuestran todos los beneficios de la música. Si un niño está destinado a ser el próximo Bach o más propensos a cantar solos en la ducha, todos se benefician de alguna forma de educación musical. La investigación demuestra que aprender el do-re-mis puede ayudar a los niños a sobresalir en formas más allá del ABC básico. Hacer música implica algo más que la voz o los dedos tocando un instrumento; Un niño que aprende acerca de la música tiene que aprovechar múltiples conjuntos de habilidades, a menudo simultáneamente.

La fabricación de música puede ser una experiencia de aprendizaje social dinámica. Haciendo música juntos, los niños aprenden a trabajar en equipo, mientras que contribuyen a la canción a su manera. Al mismo tiempo, la música ayuda a los niños a aprender que juntos pueden hacer algo más grande que la suma de sus partes.

Para los niños, la música ofrece muchos, muchos beneficios. Los expertos están de acuerdo, hay muchas cosas buenas acerca de dejar que su hijo aprenda a tocar un instrumento.

- Aumentará su poder cerebral

-Los ayuda socialmente

-Es un constructor de confianza

-Enseña paciencia

- Enseña disciplina

- Es una gran forma de expresión

- Creativamente la música es buena para el cuerpo, alma y espíritu.

 


Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Nos gustaría dar a todos los niños en pichilemu la oportunidad de aprender música sin costo para ellos.

Necesitamos 15.000 usd, para la construcción y equipo de acompañamiento para una sala de música completa (construcción de un aula para el ensayo y el espacio de rendimiento, y comprar todo tipo de instrumentos, aire, cuerdas, percusión, piano). Si no obtenemos el fondo completo, estaremos encantados de poder comprar algunos instrumentos musicales, y comenzar a enseñar música.

Lo que usted pueda dar: $ 10, $ 50, o $ 200, prometemos que hará un impacto.

Nuestra comunidad sin fines de lucro tiene cuentas de redes sociales (Facebook, instagram) y publicaremos las clases de música para que pueda ver el progreso de los niños en la clase de música.

Si apoya nuestra campaña, los niños le enviarán diferentes regalos, en su mayoría hechos a mano por ellos. Dado que estamos ubicados en Chile en el extremo más distante de Sudamérica, dependiendo de lo mucho que es donar sobre nuestra causa, qué regalo o por que le enviaremos.


Puedes ayudar de otras formas

Compartir esta campaña con tus amigos puede realmente hacer una diferencia. Por favor, ayúdenos a sacar la voz y hacer ruido sobre nuestra campaña. Si no puedes ayudarnos a donar fondos, puedes ayudarnos a contar a tus contactos nuestra historia, compartir, compartir o enviar por correo electrónico el enlace a este proyecto de Indiegogo, o cualquier otro Idea que usted tiene será realmente útil y apreciar. ¡Todo ayuda !!!  

 ¡Gracias por su tiempo y ayuda!

Localmente no hay lugar donde los niños puedan aprender música ni instrumentos, y creemos que nuestros hijos deben tener la oportunidad de acercarse a la música, aprender un instrumento musical; Hacer música con otros; Aprender a cantar; Y tener la oportunidad de progresar al siguiente nivel de excelencia si lo desean, y convertirse en músicos virtuosos. ¿Qué pasaría si uno de estos niños tiene un talento maravilloso para la música, pero nunca tiene la oportunidad de acercarse a ella? Usted puede hacer que estos sucedan y ayudar a la próxima generación de músicos se desarrollan. Con una acción, usted podría cambiar su futuro.
Con su valiosa ayuda, podríamos hacer posible este sueño. Y dar a nuestros hijos su espacio soñado para hacer música, muchos de ellos de otro modo nunca tendrían la oportunidad de aprender un instrumento musical. Necesitamos construir una sala de música y comprar instrumentos musicales.
¿Por qué la música?
Hay muchas investigaciones que demuestran todos los beneficios de la música. Si un niño está destinado a ser el próximo Bach o más propensos a cantar solos en la ducha, todos se benefician de alguna forma de educación musical. La investigación demuestra que aprender el do-re-mis puede ayudar a los niños a sobresalir en formas más allá del ABC básico. Hacer música implica algo más que la voz o los dedos tocando un instrumento; Un niño que aprende acerca de la música tiene que aprovechar múltiples conjuntos de habilidades, a menudo simultáneamente.
La fabricación de música puede ser una experiencia de aprendizaje social dinámica. Haciendo música juntos, los niños aprenden a trabajar en equipo, mientras que contribuyen a la canción a su manera. Al mismo tiempo, la música ayuda a los niños a aprender que juntos pueden hacer algo más grande que la suma de sus partes.
Para los niños, la música ofrece muchos, muchos beneficios. Los expertos están de acuerdo, hay muchas cosas buenas acerca de dejar que su hijo aprenda a tocar un instrumento.
- Aumentará su poder cerebral
-Los ayuda socialmente
-Es un constructor de confianza
-Enseña paciencia
- Enseña disciplina
- Es una gran forma de expresión
- Creativamente la música es buena para el cuerpo, alma y espíritu.
 
Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes
Nos gustaría dar a todos los niños en pichilemu la oportunidad de aprender música sin costo para ellos.
Necesitamos 15.000 usd, para la construcción y equipo de acompañamiento para una sala de música completa (construcción de un aula para el ensayo y el espacio de rendimiento, y comprar todo tipo de instrumentos, aire, cuerdas, percusión, piano). Si no obtenemos el fondo completo, estaremos encantados de poder comprar algunos instrumentos musicales, y comenzar a enseñar música.
Lo que usted pueda dar: $ 10, $ 50, o $ 200, prometemos que hará un impacto.
Nuestra comunidad sin fines de lucro tiene cuentas de redes sociales (Facebook, instagram) y publicaremos las clases de música para que pueda ver el progreso de los niños en la clase de música.
Si apoya nuestra campaña, los niños le enviarán diferentes regalos, en su mayoría hechos a mano por ellos. Dado que estamos ubicados en Chile en el extremo más distante de Sudamérica, dependiendo de lo mucho que es donar sobre nuestra causa, qué regalo o por que le enviaremos.
Puedes ayudar de otras formas 
Compartir esta campaña con tus amigos puede realmente hacer una diferencia. Por favor, ayúdenos a sacar la voz y hacer ruido sobre nuestra campaña. Si no puedes ayudarnos a donar fondos, puedes ayudarnos a contar a tus contactos nuestra historia, compartir, compartir o enviar por correo electrónico el enlace a este proyecto de Indiegogo, o cualquier otro Idea que usted tiene será realmente útil y apreciar. ¡Todo ayuda !!!  
 ¡Gracias por su tiempo y ayuda!

story:
The Follow Your Dreams EP  

After 7 years on YouTube covering the alternative rock scene, I have finally decide to take the plunge and make my very first album.

I have written 6 songs with one of my best friends Tyler Hagen and will be flying to Atlanta in January with Johnnie Guilbert and Tyler Hagen to record my first EP.

What We Need & What You Get  

  • This EP will cost $7500 to produce, record and mix
  • Plane tickets, hotel, food and other travel costs will also be expensive
  • I will also be making music videos, album artwork and other crazy stuff to try and make this album special for you all of you!
  • I don't expect you any of you to cover these costs. This Indiegogo is for anyone that wants to support this EP and get something special in return. I appreciate it immensely.

The Impact

  • Like most of my audience, I have always loved music and have always dreamed of making an album.
  • This EP will change my life and I hope it will change yours too :)
  • I will be performing these songs LIVE for all of you on the My Digital Escape Tour in 2016

Risks & Challenges

I am really scared to step away from interviewing bands to pursue new things.  But life is short and you have to follow your dreams right?

With Tyler's help I believe I have written an amazing album that will make all of you guys proud.  I am nervous but excited for the future.  I hope all of you join me on this adventure!

I love you guys!

Please tell your friends about this project and let's make the Follow Your Dreams EP come to life!

Add me on Snapchat (username - BryanStarzzzz) as I head back to ZK Studios with Johnnie and Tyler in January to record this EP for all of you.  Thank you for everything and...follow your dreams

story:
*Shirt size will be taken by survey at the end of the campaign.

Take Ownership Over Your Music Community.

Just because it's DIY doesn't mean bands have to give up playing professional, well attended shows. And we don't think we have to give up making the scene look as beautiful as we can. The local music community is arguably the most important part of a bands career. I mean everyone starts there right? Having a strong community of bands and fans will help accelerate bands to reach their goals.


"The Integrity"

"The Michigan"

Why are We Printing T Shirts?

We need startup capital, and you need a t shirt since that coffeeshop across from your apartment won't let you stay unless you're wearing one.

We want to continue to keep what we do at the lowest possible cost as we can. And we don't want to rely on ticket sales exclusively. Here's our heart in some easily skim-able bullet points: 

  • If we find alternative revenue streams (T shirts) We won't have to rely only on ticket sales to do what we do. We believe that will allow us to take more risks on shows and not get sucked into the corporate way of booking shows.
  • We are driven to stay open and honest (sometimes it's sacrificed in this business) and having alternative ways of funding our dreams (Which is creating awesome music events) is key to keeping our integrity.
  • We want to continue to give money away to charities. We budget to give, and want to continue to increase that amount as we grow.
  • From the beginning we've always wanted to produce a line of fashion forward shirts that stand out from other shirts in the scene.


"The Urban Geographer"

"The Love Local"

"The Local Music"

Why $14?

We know there are cheaper shirts out there. And we would give them away for free if we could. But we want to print a shirt that you'll actually want to wear, and get it printed locally and by hand. 

  • No machines. Screen Printed by Zach Micklea's own two hands for the highest quality print possible.
  • Printed on a shirt you will actually wear. Soft Style Ring Spun 65/35 poly-cotton blend. No box shirts or nipple chafers here.
  • We need at least 12 preorders of each to be able to print the minimum. We thought doing it this way would avoid us printing a shirt people didn't like. We are asking for $500 because we think it's easily obtainable and the minimum we need to get these to print!


"The Listen Local"

"The Flint Matters"

Profits from the "Flint Matters" t shirt goes to benefit the Flint Child Health Development Fund that are helping children effected by the flint water crisis.

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can't contribute financially that's okay! consider becoming a part of our street team! It's super fun and free. Check us out online at UrbanGeographer.com or on all social media platforms.

story:
Short Summary

I'm going to be working with Emmy-winning producer Eren Cannatta. He co-owns/works in Cove City Studios. I've been singing for over twenty years. I've been seeking the Lord and what He wants to do with me and this album. It's brutally honest about  how I feel, about my struggles, about how I've seen myself and how He's loved, restored, and made me whole. I have a heart for Christ, music and to see people fall in love with God because He loved us first. This album will show my hearts desire, it's a passion I want to share with everyone that's willing to listen.  


The album will be about twelve songs long. The title just for YOU, every letter in the title lower case "You" referencing God and keeping all the focus on Him.

Music has been my heart since I can remember and your contribution is an extension to bring me not only closer to my dreams but also to reach people that feel lost, forgotten, and worthless. This project is bigger than me and your help not only me but those who hear what Hod has put on my heart and what He has done to and through me.

story:
A Message from Ashley and Luperci

Greetings to music lovers from around the globe. We would like to ask for your help in the realization of our first CD as a soprano/tenor duo! Our duo was formed in 2015, and since then we’ve been performing on Silversea Cruises and in Europe.  Our unique shows feature songs made famous by Mario Lanza and his leading ladies, and other unique musical gems from the great repertoire of American musicals and operettas.

Our duo was founded out of a common love for classical music, and we’ve been offering exciting new shows weekly for cruise passengers. We would like to take the next step for our duo and create a CD of beautiful songs and duets which will include selections such as “By My Love,” “Granada,” “Someday I’ll Find You,” and “Deep in my Heart.”  We love this style of music and feel that it deserves to be shared more broadly!

WHO WE ARE

Luperci grew up in Rio de Janeiro and has since lived in several countries including Uruguay, Argentina and Scotland where he completed his Master’s Degree in Opera at the prestigious Royal Conservatoire of Scotland.  Ashley hails from the picturesque countryside of central New York State and has completed her musical studies in Italy, the birthplace of opera, where she has been living for the past few years. 

THE PROJECT AND YOU

This project will be impossible without your contribution to help us cover the costs associated with producing a CD, which are inevitably quite high for this genre of classical music. We have set our funding goal at $16,000 (the album quotation from our source) in order to help us cover these aspects of the project: 

- Production of tracks, many of which will be new and original arrangements made especially for us by the very talented Ben Christenson

- Recording of live musicians to offer the best quality of sound possible

- Vocal recording studio sessions and final mixing and editing by professional sound engineers

- Album art and design and production

OUR PRODUCER

We are very happy to be working with Ben Christenson of Fortress Media in Canada who has worked with many well known artists, and we believe his experience and attention to detail are well worth his involvement in our project and are a guarantee of the high standard of quality we would like to achieve. Ben’s addition to the project makes it truly an international endeavor. 

Ben has already started working on our first track and we hope to conclude the recordings and have our final product by July 2017! 

CONTRIBUTIONS AND THEIR BENEFITS

All of our lives would be so different without music. We hope that if you have ever enjoyed one of our performances, you will consider donating to help us express that which cannot remain silent - our dream to fill the world with beautiful music.

story:
As you may know, our first recording, Fairest Isle, was very well-received and was the #1 seller on the Magnatunes recording label for some time. 

We are now preparing to make our next recording and we need your support!

“The Magnifick Consort of Four Parts”

Fantasies, Suites and Sonatas for viol quartet by Purcell, Locke and Legrenzi

100 years before the string quartet became the gold standard for chamber music, the four-part string ensemble was recognized by many composers as a fertile playground for compositional exploration, experimentation with new ideas and development of old ones.  Decades after the final flowering of the viol consort, even as violin-oriented chamber and orchestral genres were on the rise, the classic grouping of four viols still held a special place in the hearts of certain composers for whom nothing could compare to the intimately passionate and expressive sound-world of the viol consort. This recording will feature works by three of these composers: the “Magnifick consort of 4 parts” of Matthew Locke, the sublime “Fantazias of four parts” of Henry Purcell, and Giovanni Legrenzi’s lively and intense “Sonate à quatro viole da gamba”. The kaleidoscopic variety of colors and moods inherent in this music is guaranteed to delight and enrapture listeners.

With this program Wildcat Viols celebrates its rebirth as a quartet and welcomes its newest member, Annalisa Pappano, whose multi-instrumental virtuosity and deeply engaging musicality is recognized worldwide. 

Your tax-deductible gift of any amount will be much appreciated and will be directly applied to our recording and production costs.  

We look forward to hearing back from you in the coming days and weeks and we thank you in advance for your support.

You can hear the Wildcat Viols perform Purcell's Fantazia 8 a 4 in d minor in the GALLERY section of this campaign:
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/wildcat-viol...

story:
Welcome to the Girl Gang

Hey there, I'm Sydne: avid concertgoer, music nerd, and founder of Gigg On, Girl Festival. Gigg Fest is an all-women music festival that's bringing exposure to women musicians in an industry that often ignores and excludes them. 

Where are Women in the Festival Industry?

  • Exhibit A: Coachella 2015 booked more than 160 bands, and only 6% of them were women-lead. 
  • Exhibit B: Glastonbury Festival 2015 featured its first woman headliner of the century just this year when Florence + The Machine stepped in as a last-second replacement for The Foo Fighters.

 

Photo: Ken Grand-Pierre

Based on these *sorry* statistics and my own disappointing experiences in the industry, I decided to create a platform where women can be seen and heard: Gigg On, Girl Festival. 

We Need Your Help 

Gigg Fest is a non-profit event: 100% of the proceeds go to the artists or the mechanics of making this happen (rental equipment, lights, etc.). We don't expect these artists to perform for free, and neither should you. 

Come to Gigg Fest!

---> The first thing you can do is come to Gigg Fest! Our inaugural festival is taking place at Barnard College on December 5, 2015. Lineup and ticket announcements are upcoming on our socials @giggongirl. 

 

Where Does Your $$$ Go?

  • When you buy a ticket, your money goes to the artist's fee for playing the show, but there are many other supports that musicians need surrounding a show, like transportation and hospitality. 
  • When you buy an IndieGoGo perk: 'Girl Gang' patch, an official 'Gigg On, Girl' sticker, a tee shirt, tickets, a magazine, a book, you're helping us fund flights, hotels, cab rides, and food for our artists. 
PLUS, the more you give, the cooler we can make this festival ;)

Sample of Perks:

* * ** *

Sock it to the festival industry.

Show the music industry that women are here, and we want to see them. 
Join the Girl Gang with swag from this Indie Go Go campaign, and buy a ticket to the festival on December 5!
  • Sydne xo

story:
Short Summary

After these past two years of working on Paper Poetry the album is finally finished.

At the beginning of the project, Bonnie and I decided to not do any outsource funding for the album. The idea behind that was we didn't want to owe anyone money when we finished and would have the freedom to do what we wanted with it.

Working a minimum wage job and working every weekend playing shows, I was able to raise about $8,000.00 for the album over the past two years. Along with having to raise the money and the bad luck of health issues Bonnie faced, it was a hard uphill battle keeping our heads down and finishing the album. Not only did we end up making a great product we can be proud of but we developed a long lasting friendship as well.

My goal is to sell at least 1,000 albums over the year and land a recording contract. 

With the funds raised from this album, I will create single to multiple music videos depending on how well it sells for the songs "Irish Lullabies" and "Mama Warned Me". After the videos are completed, Bonnie and I will send the album and videos to labels and try to land a recording contract. On top of the videos, we will be promoting the album across the US with radio submissions and approach popular blogs and magazines (which will all cost quite a bit). Finally, if we don't manage to land a label contract, I've started booking an October tour for the album and will use the rest of the funds for travel and promotion.

Finally, if we don't manage to land a label contract, I've started booking an October tour for the album and will use the rest of the funds for travel and promotion.

story:
Viva Lion California Tour 2016

Viva Lion is my name on stage, born Daniele Cardinale. I am italian musician grown in the local rock  scene. I moved to Toronto, Canada in 2009 and stepped into the folk scene. I wrote my first acoustic songs in Canada. Back to Italy I signed to Cosecomuni, an independent label focused on indie rock and quality recordings. Debut album “The Green Dot Ep” was released in January 25th 2013 followed by an Italian tour and shows in Spain and California.

Viva Lion signed to the italian label INRI in 2015 and the new album Mi Casa Es Tu Casa was released on October 23rd 2015.

According to the press, the sound recalls what made the american signature sound, a blend of gospel, folk, country, and rock. The first record on INRI has an impressively mature songwriting, to the point where it’s hard to locate where it comes from or when it was written and recorded. A wide variety of genres that makes it unique and coherent all the same, through lyrics and sounds that go from the traditional gospel to early folk, yet the listener is able to capture the influence of contemporary music that gave life to recent new folk.

I chose the title “Mi Casa Es Tu Casa” for two reasons. First off, the mexicans in California. I spent a significant time of my life in Southern California and i learned a lot from their welcoming and warming attitude. Second reason, the number of shows i’ve been playing since The Green Dot Ep was released: almost 200 shows throughout Italy, Spain e the States, either in live clubs, bars, stores and houses, and feeling at home is what i like the most when i am on stage. Mi Casa Es Tu Casa is a welcoming message that goes both ways: it is from us to the audience and from the audience (and the venue and the managers and the promoters) to us.

 I opened as Viva Lion for Stereophonics, Moving Mountains, Turin Brakes, Xavier Rudd. I played at The Viper Room in Hollywood, Cafè Berlin in Madrid and Auditorium Parco della Musica in Rome.

I get the chance to come back to California to play a week of shows in support of the new album "Mi Casa Es tu Casa" in September. It is going to be solo shows, me and my acoustic guitar.

09.11 - Bar Lubitsch, Los Angeles

09.12 tba

09.13 The Convent, San Francisco tbc

09.14 San Francisco tba

09.15 off

09.16 Blush Ice Bar, San Diego

09.17 House gig, San Diego

09.18 The Viper Room, Hollywood

 I live in Rome, Italy, and i have a long way to the West Coast. This campaign has the purpose to raise funds for a flight ticket and a vehicle rental that will be my company all along the Coast. Los Angeles, San Francisco and San Diego will be my destinations. There won't be an income, being a foreign independent artist. Your support can literally make a difference. We reach the goal, i will go. We don't reach the goal, i will have to cancel the shows. Your contribution will decide.

What We Need & What You Get

I estimate the cost in 1,500$. Flight ticket Rome to Los Angeles is about 800$, car rental 300$ and the rest in gas. Not to mention accommodation, but i have faith in "mi casa es tu casa - my house is your house" and friends i have in California. As you can see, it is barely sufficient to make it to the US. I am asking a lot but i don't want to be spoiled, it's rock and roll!

There is free music and free tickets waiting for you! On top of that, italian cousin. Yes, food made Italians famous around the world, so there will be a home cooked dinner. And if you are american, and you live nearby my shows, i will cook at your place. 

Either you are able to fund the campaign or not, promotion to that would be much appreciated! Get the word out and make some noise about Viva Lion California Tour 2016.

Love,

Viva Lion

story:
Joy to the World!

I’ve had many Christmas songs whirling through my head for several years.  Now it’s time to make them audible! 

I’m working on a CD of Christmas songs along with some of my friends to include piano and other instruments.  But it’s expensive to make a recording, especially if only a few friends buy one.   It will take at least $5000 to record, pay three or four musicians, studio time, art work and manufacturing.  So I’m asking for your help to get this project off the ground. 

What You Get

It’s not just a donation I’m asking for.  Each CD will cost $15.  So, if you can help with just $15 . . . or more, you will receive one CD for every $15 you give.  .  I just need to know how many CDs to make.   Special deals are also listed for larger purchases.  

Also, please take a look at the EXTRA PERKS that are available on the sidebar.

Share the Joy - a great Christmas gift!

Joy! - the Ted Groat and Friends Christmas CD will make a great Christmas gift for your friends.  You will receive one CD for every $15 you give.  

About Ted . . .

I've had the privilege of playing piano, coaching international music teams, arranging and recording in several countries around the world.  I started tinkering on the piano when my nose was only as high as the keyboard, took years of piano lessons, studied music at the University of Toronto and the University of Minnesota, and led choirs, orchestras and worship teams in several churches.

Expressing the love of God through music - and especially on the piano - has been the joy of my life.   

I just love the sounds of Christmas!  Some of the songs are fun, some restful, some are joyful Carols, and all of them will help stoke the fires of the 'Christmas Spirit'. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There’s another thing you can do whether you give or not – help get the word out!  Like my Facebook page, ‘Joy – Ted Groat and Friends’ and click on the Share item below.

           THANK YOU!                 . . . and Merry Christmas in advance!!

story:
My mission: uplifting, fun, inspiring and enlightening music.  

The video is of my song Isle of View.  It will not be on this new CD but one or two songs will be similar.    

This campaign is to help me create a CD of 7 or 8, or possibly 10 original songs, depending on how this fundraising goes. The biggest expense is professional mixing of the songs, which is typically $300 per song. I'm setting the goal at $1600 but $3000 or more would be better; I could put more songs on the CD.  I've written over 200 songs; mostly pop rock, but I've written in almost every genre. 

Some of this CD's song titles are: Unbreakable Heart, Now I Know, Yes We Can, Dance with You, Love or Illusion, Cruise with Me, and others. Feel So Good is a swing tune. I was amazed to have some people tell me it was "their favorite song" since I knew they were Beatles fans!    

I started piano lessons at age 10. I learned quickly, evidently a born musician. By age 12 I could play the Bumble Boogie version of Flight of the Bumblebee. I joined my first band in high school, and was in many bands over the next 40 years. 

 My early fame was being in the Cooder Browne Band with champion fiddler Larry Franklin (now top session fiddler in Nashville). He told me "You're the only keyboard player that can keep up with me." We released one album on Willie Nelson's Lone Star label, distributed by Mercury-Phonogram.  We opened several shows for Willie, which was great, audiences of 20,000 or 30,000 ! There are posts of some Cooder Browne Band songs on Youtube, where you can hear me on piano. (note the 'e' on Browne and 'd' in Cooder. We spelled it as fans of Ry Cooder and Jackson Browne)   

I'm calling my act Muzajik, which is 'music' and 'magic' combined (spelled with z, j and k). I'll eventually get other players and create the Muzajik band. (I have a dream team of superb players I've worked with.) You can search 'Muzajik' on Youtube. I've posted 2 songs, and will post more soon.   

My inspirations are Beatles, BB King, Stevie Wonder, Steve Miller, Stevie Ray Vaughn, Bonnie Raitt, Beethoven, Taj Mahal, Ry Cooder, and many others.   

Please relay this campaign to others who might be interested. Thanks!

story:
What This Is About


Hello! My name is Alex and I'm a recording artist. I've never produced a record on vinyl before, but I think I've finally got a good reason to try!

I recently met someone who I really connected with. After speaking with her for several days, I realized that I'd developed a fondness for her. I've never met anyone like her before... she works as a social justice activist, she's highly brilliant and has been a catalyst for several positive changes in my life. She's basically a model of everything I aspire to be and I have a lot of admiration for her. I wrote some music, an electronic dance kind of thing, putting all of my feelings into it, the entire swirl of happiness I experience when I think about her. What I'd like to do is release it on vinyl with a printed dedication to her so that I can send it to her along with a message about how awesome I think she is. It's a way for me to do something exceptional for someone who I believe is exceptional. :)

I have no expectations. I just want to create something fun and meaningful for someone who's made me think and feel a lot of things in the brief time I've known them, to increase their happiness in the world.

What I'll Need & What You Get

I've decided to go through the United Record Pressing service. One of the perks they offer, if you're willing/able to contribute $50 or more to my project, is that they'll send you a free test pressing of the record! This is up to a maximum of 50 contributors, It's a quality single I'm putting out, so I'm sure you'll want a copy anyway! :D

My goal amount is $2,500... that will be enough to cover the expense of having the record produced as well as shipping. If I'm unable to reach the goal amount by the end, I'm looking at other options: one, covering the rest myself (I don't have much I can put toward this, unfortunately), or going cheaper on certain options... or possibly going for CDs instead, as a last resort.

I hope you will consider helping make my dream a reality. I'd love nothing more than to do as many exceptional things as possible for this person, and share my feelings as musical art with everyone who helped me succeed in that.

story:
The Salem Youth Chorus was founded in 2007 in order to provide teens and collegiate young adults in the greater Salem and Youngstown, OH area with the opportunity to sing great choral music as crafted by the compositional masters. Our music program proudly attracts young persons from communities throughout the tri-county area. The SYC has 501 (c) (3) non for profit status as a charitable, Arts organization. Membership in the Salem Youth Chorus is open to all interested and qualified teens and collegiate age young adults, regardless of race, creed, color, gender, disability or sexual orientation.

In its pursuit of excellence, The Salem Youth Chorus seeks to accomplish the following:

A. Develop and promote the appreciation, preparation and performance of great choral music.

B. Develop and promote classical music, singing and choral education for the membership through an “honors class” approach to general decorum, rehearsals and performances.

C. Develop the ensemble by developing the leadership skills of the individual. Personal responsibility and individual excellence is the driving force behind the success of the ensemble (society). This tenet is likewise a success tool regardless of the school, workplace, family, social, etc. environments.

D. Enhance all communities (be they local, national or international) culturally and socially through the implementation of our objectives.

Visit The Salem Youth Chorus on Facebook for more information, pictures and news of upcoming concerts and events!

As you can imagine, keeping a multi-faceted arts and educational program thriving is always a financial challenge! Our music director/founder has felt so positively about the musical, educational and social benefits of the Salem Youth Chorus, that he has donated his musical services to the SYC since the ensemble’s inception.  Contributors to the SYC likewise know that they are greatly enhancing the lives of young people through the glory of music and the tremendous social benefits that a challenging yet supportive ensemble as the SYC provides.

Our 2014 tour anticipated costs over 5 days (plane fare, lodging and ground travel for 20 ensemble members) will be approximately $16,000. We will continue to raise funds through our concertizing, CD sales and other fundraising efforts. We graciously seek to raise $8,000, half of the 2014 tour costs, through an Indiegogo campaign.  As a perk, contributors of $500 or more receive the option of a concert by the SYC. This option could be a home performance (i.e. Christmas party); community performance (church or civic event), etc. The performance perk must be implemented within a 2 hour radius of Youngstown, OH. Contact us with any questions concerning the performance perk.

Here’s some exciting history of the SYC! In addition to our local concerts, the ensemble tours every summer.  As part of our 2008 summer tour, the Salem Youth Chorus sang a concert at Bruton Parish Church in Colonial Williamsburg, VA as part of their Candlelight Concert Series and then sang Choral Evensong at The Washington National Cathedral in DC. In July of 2009, we traveled to NYC and sang at The Cathedral of St. John the Divine. The SYC was the guest choir in 2010-2014 for the annual Boar’s Head and Yule Log Festival at St. John’s Episcopal Church in Youngstown and will return for the 2015 Festival. The ensemble was a prizewinner in the 2010 national music competition, The American Prize. In August of 2010, the SYC traveled to Cathedrals in England, Ireland and Wales for concerts and Choral Evensong. In the summer of 2011, the ensemble performed at Cathedrals in PA, NY and Toronto, Canada. In 2012, the SYC sang at St. Louis Cathedral in New Orleans and Trinity Episcopal in Baton Rouge. 2013 took the SYC to Cathedrals in NC, WV and a return performance to Williamsburg. The SYC has sung in Opera Western Reserve’s productions of Tosca and The Barber of Seville. The SYC has released four CD’s, Morning Has Broken: Hymns of the British Isles, Evening Reflections: Choral Evensong for Advent, A Festival of Lessons and Carols, and Sing a New Song!

story:
Short Summary

  • I am a jazz singer and videomaker who loves to experiment art, sound and poetry. Above all the works I have done by heart with my love for jazz music in years there are: Bix Factor (Parco della musica Records 2012,  ITA) with Mauro Ottolini Sousaphonix and Racine Connection (Rivermont Records 2013, USA) with Dalton Ridenhour and Andy Schumm with his gang. To me it is extremely important to dig into the tradition and discover the roots that leads you beyond, then to create something that did not exist before!

  • CONTRADANZA is the name of my new upcoming project. I collected some musical masterpieces from the 18th Century's Cuban music repertoire to obtain a suite dedicated to the longing for the sea. I dedicate this work to Bas Jan Ader and his "In search of the miraculous" performance.


  • This is not just a collection of musical pieces, this is a proud expedition to the borders of the ocean. We will bring you there, opening our heart to the unknown sailing away taking with us just piano, trombone, drums and voice.


What We Need & What You Get

  • I would have needed much more money than this. I will produce this record all by myself. Money will be used for: paying the recording studio, the hotelrooms and meals for the musicians, the travel expenses and the mixing for the record. 1500 euro is the amount I am missing, it is not the complete cost of this record.


  • I am choosing Flexible founding: it means if I wouldn't reach the entire goal I am going to use the received money in the way I explained previously.

The Impact

  • This project deserves your support because it celebrates beauty and poetry against shallowness and violence. It glorifies people that stand on their feet and open up heart to the universe. It is an anthem to freedom.


  • With me you'll hear the voices sound of some of the best musicians we have in Italy, with an impressive international guest and a nine years old girl who sings just like an angel. I am not willing to use their names to raise money, If you know me just a bit, you are going to trust me.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, please mention this page to a friend!

  • Indiegogo share tools are easy to use
  • send a personal message to him/her and we will be grateful!

We will bring you there, opening our heart to the unknown sailing away taking with us just piano, trombone, drums and voice.What We Need & What You GetI would have needed much more money than this. I will produce this record all by myself. Money will be used for: paying the recording studio, the hotelrooms and meals for the musicians, the travel expenses and the mixing for the record. 1500 euro is the amount I am missing, it is not the complete cost of this record.I am choosing Flexible founding: it means if I wouldn't reach the entire goal I am going to use the received money in the way I explained previously.The ImpactThis project deserves your support because it celebrates beauty and poetry against shallowness and violence. It glorifies people that stand on their feet and open up heart to the universe. It is an anthem to freedom.With me you'll hear the voices sound of some of the best musicians we have in Italy, with an impressive international guest and a nine years old girl who sings just like an angel. I am not willing to use their names to raise money, If you know me just a bit, you are going to trust me.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you cannot contribute, please mention this page to a friend!
Indiegogo share tools are easy to use

send a personal message to him/her and we will be grateful!

story:
It's time for some fun!

This CD is literally packed full of fun!  It's been a joyful experience creating it.  
This campaign is short!  We know the process will be perfect.  It has been so far! Join us on December 4th, or order a CD through the campaign perks or on line.  We are so excited to share all 15 of these songs with you. As our song says - "It's Time!" 
We deeply appreciate any level of contribution you can make.  And you can make any level of contribution from $1 on up.  Your donation does not have to match a perk level. You can contribute whatever you would like!    Thank you for being here reading this. Thank you for you support.  And thank you so much, in advance, for enjoying the music!
Hugs all around!

The Album

The first song on the Album is "Let Go".  The last song is "It's Time".   
That pretty well sums up what this album is about.

We love playing music with a deep and powerful inspirational message AND we love a myriad of styles and genres of popular playing music like: blues, jazz, country, rock, and alternative - and consequently this album has it all! 

As artists we believe in creating a transformative experience for the audience.  Thats what this is all about.  Transforming the moment. There is really something for everyone in this CD.  We definitely have a variety of styles here.  Meditative songs like "In The Now", "Om",  "Namaste" or "In the Magic Of The Moment" are the kind of pieces that open the heart.  Even in the studio we found ourselves swaying with the meditative feel of the music.  The soulful ballads like "You Lift Me Up" or "Heaven Knows"  are really love song to the divine.  And then there are the great bluesy numbers like "Let Go" where Sandra gets to 'go Janice' on the vocals or The super fast paced rockin number - "It's Time"  - that lets us all see just how fast Rex can play that piano!   "Happy For No Reason" - "A Peace Of Our Own" - these songs are all fun and playful.  And Magic Happens sounds like it needs a full on Broadway musical written to go with it.  

The world is hungry right now for inspiration and awareness.  This is the perfect time for this music and it's healing, transforming and inspirational qualities.  And, as we know... if we are doing it now, then it must be the perfect time... because to quote the song - 

"Heaven Knows" 

by Rex Miller and Sandra Cavanaugh

(c) 2013 All Rights Reserved  

It's perfect. Whatever it may be.  The struggles we face, the choices we make, can be bitter sweet.  It doesen't have to be good to be perfect, we just have to be willing to see that it's all part of a grand synchronicity


Our Story

We have been playing and writing together for about 15 years. And as musicians, we kind of lead a double life.  On the one hand we've played all kinds of gigs from smoky bars, to concert halls playing covers as a Jazz Duo and with our Blues band. But on the other hand, we've played in a lot of New Thought churches, spiritual festivals and events. We were also the Spiritual Music Leadership team at the Center for Spiritual Living for many years, where Rex is still the musical director to this day. We've have also been playing uplifting original inspirational music for 4 or 5 years with the brilliant and prolific Pat McDonald as members of his band "The Tropical Cowboys".  

We love playing other people's music, but we also have a great many songs of our own and lately we've been inspired to not only write a lot of new songs, but get them out to the world!  This kind of music - music for the soul, or what Rex affectionately calls our "woo woo music" is a very important part of our spiritual journey and our creative process as musicians.  This music literally poured out through us.   Our dear friend, singer/songwriter Pat McDonald often says that he didn't write any of his huge catalogue of inspirational songs.. that he just wrote them down.  That's really what this process has been like for us.  "Let Go" was the first song - and it just poured out, words and music... and that started it.  Then almost immediately we began writing what we knew would become an entire album, very quickly.   And it has... 15 songs and 5 months later - here we are at the end of this creative process - ready to set the music free!  It has been a blast creating it and now we can't wait for you to hear it!    


What We Need & What You Get

We are setting out to raise $1,777 in this campaign to help us with the making of the CD.  This is only a 16 day campaign.  This whole process have been very fast, so why should the campaign be any different?  The actual expense of the CD with studio time, studio musicians, reproduction, mastering, graphic design, etc is about $2,600.  The actual expense is more than what we are trying to raise, but we decided to only ask for what we really need to get the process finished.  We can handle the rest, and besides, we really like the spiritual number - repeating 1's and 7's.  

We deeply appreciate any level of contribution you can make.  And you can make any level of contribution from $1 on up.  Your donation does not have to match a perk level. You can contribute whatever you would like!     

Everyone who donates at $25 or higher gets CD's and attendance to the CD release event. We want to see and hang out with each and every one of you!  Hugs all around! 

We also realize that not everyone who contributes will be local and admittedly, the perks for the larger donations are very cool, but require you to at least be in the general area in order to collect on the private performance or event performance (That's right! Check it out! If you donate at the $250 to $750 level you get a private performance by Rex and Sandra!.  But if you are not local, we won't be able to make that happen. So, in that case we have tried to find alternative perks that give you great value and let us do something really special for you.  So if you decide to donate at the level of $250 to $750 and you are from outside the Treasure Valley ) You will receive a customized meditation CD, Sandra will interview you on the phone, design a guided meditation just for you and then Rex will score it with his beautiful original inspirational music.   Imagine! Your own personal customized meditation CD!  

If you would like to contribute at the $250 - $750 level and would like to make arrangements for your perks - feel free to call Mandy DeCastro at 208 - 724 - 1148 or e-mail her directly at decastrobooking@gmail.com.

 

REX MILLER AND SANDRA CAVANAUGH CD RELEASE OF “LET GO”

DECEMBER 4TH 7-10 PM At the Sapphire Room, The Riverside Hotel, Boise, Idaho.

You are invited to attend Rex Miller and Sandra Cavanaugh’s CD release event for their new album ‘Let Go’ . Don’t miss this incredible event!

https://www.facebook.com/events/1414378268794993/


Other Ways You Can Help

Of course we hope everyone can contribute, but whether you can contribute money or not, you can help get the word out.  Spread the news by sharing the campaign info with others or send them to our website or our facebook fan page.

and visit our website at www.rexandsandra.com

story:
You may be asking yourself who we are and what we stand for. If you can, imagine a group of high school and college students that are raising their voices to fight against social injustice. That is who we are. Our team is very passionate about spreading awareness about this issue to educate people in our community, so that they may act. 

Most of our group wasn't aware that slavery still existed until the Passion Conference of 2012. After doing some research, members of the BTS committee discovered that a form of modern-day slavery, human trafficking, was happening in our hometown of Metro Atlanta. Breaking the Shackles was born when our founder, Cameron Harris, reached out to the high school pastors at Johnson Ferry Baptist Church and alerted them that he wanted to do something to raise awareness about this issue. After a lot of thought, the consensus was that a benefit concert would be one of the best ways to provide a fun environment, while also providing awareness through different types of media, Cameron recruited fellow students who shared the same passion as him to help fundraise and organize the annual event. Since then, the BTS benefit concert has seen Brett Younker, Capital Kings, The Museum, and Unhindered perform. 

The BTS committee is planning a benefit concert to occur at Johnson Ferry Baptist Church on August 1, 2014 with Chelsea Maiocco doing a pre-show, John McCullough leading worship, and Grammy-nominated bands After Edmund and Fireflight headlining.Our partner charities for the event will be the International Justice Mission and Out of Darkness. This concert will mark the third annual BTS. This annual concert is not just something that our group takes lightly, and there are plans to apply to become a 501(c)3 non-profit organization in the near future.

Our team raises the budget for the benefit concert before the event, so that the funds raised from ticket sales go towards our partner charities. This is where you come in! Our target budget is between $3750-$4000, and currently, we have around $1200 of that. Most of our budget comes from private donations. In the past, there has been a lot of time wasted on trying to secure monetary sponsorships. In addition to private donations, we have organized muffin and bacon sales, car washes, and percentage nights  to help raise our budget. We need to raise $2750 to help take care of the honorariums of artists and the event technician fees (i.e. sound, in-ear monitor, stagehands). If you can't help monetarily, we strongly encourage you to help us market the event, so that it may be as successful as possible. We have a bunch of exciting perks also, so please donate if you feel led to.

Last year, we were able to raise $4500 in profit for our partner charities through ticket and merchandise sales. We use our budget to cover the discounted honorariums of artists, hotel rooms, food, and staff to work the event. About 85%-90% of  the funds that we raise from ticket sales will go to our partner charities. The other 10%-15% will be invested into the budget for next year's benefit concert. Visit us on Facebook or at breakingtheshackles.org to stay updated.

​Our group feels as though it is our duty to raise awareness about modern-day slavery. We believe that with a group effort, it is very possible to end this social injustice. That's why, we have partnered with charities such as, youthSpark's A Future. Not a Past. campaign, Wellspring Living, and the International Justice Mission. We would like you to join us and our partners in the fight to end human trafficking!!

“Learn to do right; seek justice. Defend the oppressed. Take up the cause of the fatherless; plead the case of the widow.”- Isaiah 1:17

Thanks,

BTS Crew

story:
Every day we read about hostile acts of oppression that seem to be surging against Jews and other ethnic / religious / racial groups. Through the arts we are making a difference, and now you can too.  We have witnessed the power that music has in shaping opinions and removing hate.  We did it once, and with you and our partner Los Angeles Museum of The Holocaust (LAMOTH) we will do it again.

THIS JUST IN!

Read about our event in the Hollywood Reporter!


We need your help to stage a Cello Concerto by composer Sharon Farber, inspired by the amazing story of a remarkable man, Curt Lowens - a survivor of the Holocaust who saved over a hundred lives.

On the evening of June 13 at Temple of the Arts at the SABAN theater, the Consul Generals of Germany, Holland and Israel, along with SAG/AFTRA (the Screen Actor’s Guild)  will pay homage to this real life hero.

However, our work will not be completed on June 13th. We will continue to thrive to make a change through music, and this is why we open the campaign to those who are able and would like to donate beyond our immediate goal and support our future goals.  

The inspiration:  On the night of Kristallnacht, Curt Lowens and his family fled Germany to Holland.

Barely 14 years old, Curt joined the Dutch Resistance. One day, Curt followed the trajectory of two U.S. Pilots who had bailed out of their wounded aircraft. Before they could be apprehended by the Nazis, Curt got to them first and hid them in a haystack. He saved their lives. By this act of courage, Curt inspired us, and showed us that we all as individuals have the power to fight oppression. 

Over 70 years later, we watched as the children and grandchildren of one of the pilots were united with Curt during Yom Kippur services at Temple of the Arts in Beverly Hills.    Coincidentally, Just around that time, Sharon was commissioned by acclaimed Cellist Ruslan Biryukov (who's also known as The Jimi Hendrix of the Cello!!!) and the Glendale Philharmonic Orchestra to compose a new cello concerto.  Inspired, she contacted Curt Lowens , who  gave her his blessing to create a new musical piece.

And so she did.  BESTEMMING (which means ‘Destination’ in Dutch, taken from Curt’s book, Destination: Question Mark) is written for Cello, Orchestra and Narrator, and  is the first concerto of its kind to be written for this combination.

The narration, although in Curt’s ‘voice’, is generic to the power of the individual to change their world and  is weaved into the music as it has a dialogue with the cello and orchestra. 

The Concerto was world premiered on January 5th, 2014 to a sold out audience and received a standing ovation. The event was covered by broadcast news and print media. It was a moving experience for those who attended. A father, who was comforted by his 5 years old twin boys, sobbed openly.  

There was a connection made with those who heard it that was inspirational.

Our mission is to convey Inspiration, Remembrance, Tolerance, Understanding and Education for this and future generations, all over the world. We recognize that the concerto and Curt’s story speaks not only to Jews, but to other cultural factions and individuals who are facing ethnic cleansing, suppression and oppression.

Your contribution will go towards staging a reprise performance of the concerto at the historic Saban Theatre in Beverly Hills, on the night of June 13, 2014.   Curt Lowens himself will assume the role of the narrator, and at 89 years of age,  will give the performance of his career.

This a free event open to all. We would love to see you, meet you and introduce you to the power of music!

What We Need & What You Get

In order to subsidize this historic performance, we need your donations rather quickly.  The total cost to put on the Concerto will be around $60,000.  The funds will be used to pay the following participants:

  • The Glendale Philharmonic Orchestra
  • Services of a pro sound engineer
  • Professional Audio and Video recording
  • The making of a mini documentary 
  • Rental/delivery of a second piano (the concerto has two piano parts)
  • Stage crew/manager
  • Musicians catering (they all need to eat between rehearsals and performance so they have energy to play!)
  • Production and printing of the Bestemming Commemorative Program Book that will include your name and/or advertisement (see perks below)
  • Security

We are delighted to offer exciting perks for your generosity.  Everything from credits in our Bestemming Commemorative Program Book, limited edition DVD’s, full page ads in the Program Book, invitations to a special VIP Mini recital on June 8 at the Los Angeles Museum of the Holocaust, invitations to rehearsals, sound checks, and an invitation to our VIP Reception following the Concerto.

Extra funds (wouldn't that be nice?:) not used for theJune 13th event will go to support our global outreach and future performances.  BESTEMMING will be inspiring people to fight oppression in the United States,  Amsterdam, Tel Aviv, Berlin, London, and hopefully many more places all over the world.  

Your donation will fuel a musical outreach that will inspire musicians and artists to bring to life the voices of Holocaust survivors, so that they will be heard for generations to come, and serve as an example to those who fight against oppression.

If you can’t donate, please help us by telling our story and share the link to this campaign.  Join our Facebook page at: www.facebook.com/bestemmingconcerto  and invite your friends who are able to donate to do so here.  

All donations are made to a 501c3 and are TAX DEDUCTIBLE.


About the composer, Sharon Farber


Emmy Award Nominated (2014), Winner of the 2013 Society of Composers and Lyricists Award for her “Outstanding work in the Art of Film Music” and the 2012 Visionary Award In Music by The Women’s International Film & Television Showcase, Composer Sharon Farber has received critical acclaim as a composer in the Concert world as well as that of Film and Television. 

A graduate of the prestigious Berklee College Of Music in both Classical Composition and Film Scoring, she won first prize with her first string quartet. She moved to Los Angeles in 1997 where she was the recipient of the prestigious Academy of Television Arts and Sciences Internship in Film Scoring, as well as the Mentorship program of the Society of Composers and Lyricists, on which she served as a board member for ten years.

Sharon has many national and international premiers and performances to her credit. To name a few: The Third Mother/ Mothers’ Lament, in memory of slain reporter Daniel Pearl, world premiered by the Los Angeles Master Chorale under maestro Grant Gershon, ASHKINA, for mixed choir, chamber ensemble and Ethnic Instruments which has been performed many times, Translucent Rocks- Fantasy for Orchestra, commissioned and premiered by the Israeli Chamber Orchestra and later by The Culver City Symphony Orchestra, To Always Remember, for soprano and chamber Ensemble which was premiered in Berlin, Germany, Chorale works, song cycles, and many more.  Commissions include the Laguna Beach Music Festival, Pacific Serenade Ensemble, Orange County Women’s Chorale, Culver City Symphony Orchestra, The Jewish Symphony Orchestra, The International String Quartet of Yucatan and iPalpiti Artists International.

In the Film/Television world, Sharon has been working with networks and cable broadcasters like NBC, CBS, Showtime and the WB as well as writing music for feature films. She won the Telly Award for best score for California 2000 and her orchestral score for the film “When Nietzsche Wept” is now a commercial release. She has recently completed the score for the feature The Dove Flyer and the powerful documentary “Honor Diaries” and she is gearing up to score Buddha Eyes for producer Aaron Millar as well as many other feature films, including a seven film series for Ancient Entertainment. She has recently completed a new orchestral CD, Oceans, commissioned by WEST ONE Music Library in the UK.
