Over 70 years later, we watched as the children and grandchildren of one of the pilots were united with Curt during Yom Kippur services at Temple of the Arts in Beverly Hills.    Coincidentally, Just around that time, Sharon was commissioned by acclaimed Cellist Ruslan Biryukov (who's also known as The Jimi Hendrix of the Cello!!!) and the Glendale Philharmonic Orchestra to compose a new cello concerto.  Inspired, she contacted Curt Lowens , who  gave her his blessing to create a new musical piece.
And so she did.  BESTEMMING (which means ‘Destination’ in Dutch, taken from Curt’s book, Destination: Question Mark) is written for Cello, Orchestra and Narrator, and  is the first concerto of its kind to be written for this combination.
The narration, although in Curt’s ‘voice’, is generic to the power of the individual to change their world and  is weaved into the music as it has a dialogue with the cello and orchestra. 

The Concerto was world premiered on January 5th, 2014 to a sold out audience and received a standing ovation. The event was covered by broadcast news and print media. It was a moving experience for those who attended. A father, who was comforted by his 5 years old twin boys, sobbed openly.  
There was a connection made with those who heard it that was inspirational.

Our mission is to convey Inspiration, Remembrance, Tolerance, Understanding and Education for this and future generations, all over the world. We recognize that the concerto and Curt’s story speaks not only to Jews, but to other cultural factions and individuals who are facing ethnic cleansing, suppression and oppression.
Your contribution will go towards staging a reprise performance of the concerto at the historic Saban Theatre in Beverly Hills, on the night of June 13, 2014.   Curt Lowens himself will assume the role of the narrator, and at 89 years of age,  will give the performance of his career.
This a free event open to all. We would love to see you, meet you and introduce you to the power of music!




What We Need & What You Get
In order to subsidize this historic performance, we need your donations rather quickly.  The total cost to put on the Concerto will be around $60,000.  The funds will be used to pay the following participants:


The Glendale Philharmonic Orchestra
Services of a pro sound engineer
Professional Audio and Video recording
The making of a mini documentary 
Rental/delivery of a second piano (the concerto has two piano parts)
Stage crew/manager
Musicians catering (they all need to eat between rehearsals and performance so they have energy to play!)
Production and printing of the Bestemming Commemorative Program Book that will include your name and/or advertisement (see perks below)

Security



We are delighted to offer exciting perks for your generosity.  Everything from credits in our Bestemming Commemorative Program Book, limited edition DVD’s, full page ads in the Program Book, invitations to a special VIP Mini recital on June 8 at the Los Angeles Museum of the Holocaust, invitations to rehearsals, sound checks, and an invitation to our VIP Reception following the Concerto.
Extra funds (wouldn't that be nice?:) not used for theJune 13th event will go to support our global outreach and future performances.  BESTEMMING will be inspiring people to fight oppression in the United States,  Amsterdam, Tel Aviv, Berlin, London, and hopefully many more places all over the world.  
Your donation will fuel a musical outreach that will inspire musicians and artists to bring to life the voices of Holocaust survivors, so that they will be heard for generations to come, and serve as an example to those who fight against oppression.
If you can’t donate, please help us by telling our story and share the link to this campaign.  Join our Facebook page at: www.facebook.com/bestemmingconcerto  and invite your friends who are able to donate to do so here.  
All donations are made to a 501c3 and are TAX DEDUCTIBLE.







About the composer, Sharon Farber




Emmy Award Nominated (2014), Winner of the 2013 Society of Composers and Lyricists Award
for her “Outstanding work in the Art of Film Music” and the 2012 Visionary Award In Music by The Women’s
International Film & Television Showcase, Composer Sharon Farber has received critical acclaim as a
composer in the Concert world as well as that of Film and Television. 
A graduate of the prestigious Berklee College Of Music in both Classical Composition and Film Scoring, she won first prize with her first string
quartet. She moved to Los Angeles in 1997 where she was the recipient of the
prestigious Academy of Television Arts and Sciences Internship in Film Scoring,
as well as the Mentorship program of the Society
of Composers and Lyricists, on which she served as a board member for ten
years.
Sharon
has many national and international premiers and performances to her credit. To
name a few: The Third Mother/ Mothers’ Lament, in memory of slain reporter Daniel Pearl,
world premiered by the Los Angeles Master Chorale under maestro
Grant Gershon, ASHKINA,
for mixed choir, chamber ensemble and Ethnic Instruments which has been
performed many times, Translucent Rocks- Fantasy for Orchestra,
commissioned and premiered by the Israeli Chamber Orchestra and later
by The
Culver City Symphony Orchestra, To Always Remember, for soprano and chamber
Ensemble which was premiered in Berlin, Germany, Chorale works, song
cycles, and many more. 
Commissions include the Laguna Beach Music Festival, Pacific
Serenade Ensemble, Orange County Women’s Chorale, Culver City Symphony
Orchestra, The Jewish Symphony Orchestra, The International String Quartet of
Yucatan and iPalpiti Artists International. 
In the Film/Television world, Sharon
has been working with networks and cable broadcasters like NBC, CBS, Showtime and the WB as well as writing music for feature films. She won the Telly
Award for best score for California 2000 and her orchestral score for
the film “When Nietzsche Wept” is now a commercial release. She has
recently completed the score for the feature The Dove Flyer and the
powerful documentary “Honor Diaries” and she is gearing up
to score Buddha Eyes for producer Aaron Millar as well as many other
feature films, including a seven film series for Ancient Entertainment. She has
recently completed a new orchestral CD, Oceans, commissioned by WEST ONE Music Library in the UK.

story:
The compilation album

For his end of studies project, Pierre de Schaetzen decided to join hands with Laid Back (LDBK) to release a 15 tracks compilation album which will gather some 20 artists who collaborated with LDBK since 2002.


January 2012 update: Six months after its release and given that all 500 CD's are sold, you can now downlaod the LDBK compilation for free on www.ldbk.eu/compilation.


Line Up

MonkeyRobot feat. Pierre Anckaert aka 74 Miles Away  (BE)

ClassicBeatz (US) & Lisa Preston (NZ)

Melissa Czarnik feat. Eric Mire (US)

Bongholio Iglesias (DE)

72 Soul (BE) & Flow State (UK)

JoBee (BE - PL) & Dr. Kwest (BE - RDC)

Strand (BE - ES)

40 Winks (BE)

Amede Soundsmith (UK)

K'bonus (BE)

The Compositive Two (BE)

Lefto (BE)

Turtle Master (BE) feat. David Martin (FR)

Incksalonious (US)

Cris Prolific (BE - FR) feat. Soul T (RW)

 

Stream their tracks on our soundcloud or mixcloud accounts. 

 

The T-shirt

As last year, we will collaborate with Limited Addiction to manufacture the 2010 LDBK tees. Expect hangtags, sleevetags, buttons and the unbeatable Limited Addiction quality. Here is a rough sketch of Oli-B's design. Make sure to pre-order yours (we'll contact you to ask for your size/model on the 16th of May) because we know from experience that we will not be able to meet all demands and will print only 150 tees.

 

 



The network

LDBK's priority is to connect communities around the world and activate them to engage in different projects. Most of our content is generated through this unique and ever-growing international network of creative minds (designers, photographers, writers, artists, musicians, DJ's, software developers, filmmakers and so forth).

 

Once again, we want to have the whole team on board for this project: while musicians and producers are locked in their studio, one of our favorite painters - Oli-B - is working on the album/t-shirt artwork, others will be documenting the whole process, we'll have DJ's collaborating on several facets of the release etc.

 

But YOU - listener, supporter, follower or collaborator - are also part of this LDBK network. The success of this IndieGoGo campaign will determine the reach of the project. In other words, the more funds we can gather, the more CD's we can press, the more promotion we can make, etc.

 

Invest in this project and make it yours

The total cost of this project - $7500 - will be entirely financed through this crowd-funding campaign. With this sum, we will press 1000 CD's, promote all the artists/partners involved and organize the release party.

 

In order to make this happen, we need your help! We made different packages you can choose from, including downloads, CD's, T-Shirts, Stickers, ....

 

Follow every step we make

Jump on board, we will take you on a journey! Our various online profiles will serve as relay to document every stages of the project so that you can follow us and interact through the whole process. We'll give you real time updates and behind the scene teasers on Laid Back's Facebook, Twitter and website. Make sure you check these on a regular basis AND spread the word around!

 

Some of our previous projects

 


 

+ Infinitskills present NINE (LP, digital)

+ Louie Gee Ensemble - Scrabble (7inch, digital with Jazzy Sport)

+ Nicholas Kopernicus - Audiocentric (CD, digital)

+ Strand - DUB! (7inch, digital)

+ ClassicBeatz - Ntale's Groove (digital)

+ 74 Miles Away (CD, LP, digital with Melting Pot Music)

 


 

Laid Back t-shirts: 2008 - 2009 - 2010

 

What is Laid Back ?

The Laid Back project (aka LDBK) first came together in 2002 as a weekly radio show broadcasted on a local radio station in Brussels. However, music is nothing without context, stories, images and therefore, we always try to integrate and share as much content as possible about the music we are playing, presenting it in new ways with pertinent background stories, captivating visuals (especially street art) and the best layout.

 

We focus on everything urban related be it music, art, lifestyle or whatever topic they feel like to discuss. While music wise, We play everything from Soul, Funk, Jazz, Psych Rock, Disco and Latin music to Hip Hop and much more.

 

Laid Back website - LDBK online radio

 

Who is behind this project?

Pierre de Schaetzen is a student at Belgium's first college for music management, PHL Music. In order to graduate in June, he is required to complete a music related project on a professional level... This is when this LDBK compilation came into the picture.

 

Pierre first started working with Laid Back in January 2010 and successfully collaborated on several projects, which led Laid Back's founder Julien Mourlon to ask him to take the lead on this project.

story:
WHO AM I AND WHAT IS THE EP ABOUT?

My name is Charles G. D. Harding and I am a 20 year-old musician from Fredericton, NB, Canada. I have finished the recording of my first ever EP and have set a release date. The EP is titled "We Don't Know The World That We Left Behind". The EP will be sold digitally, but my biggest dream is to produce hard copies of this CD. I have the means to do it, but I don't have the money to produce as many as I would need. 

The EP was inspired by a series daydreams of alien lights appearing above Fredericton, NB. The album is based upon the concept of having appreciation for the things that we have.

I have ideas and feelings that I want to spread to the world through my music. Any support would be extremely appreciated! 

WHAT THE MONEY WILL BE USED FOR:

The money that is raised for this project will go towards the following:

-Production of CD's and hard copies (album covers, cd labels, ink cartridges for printer)

-Various forms of merchandise (posters, t-shirts, stickers, etc.)

-Promotion of the CD-Shipping of the CD.

-Equipment for live preformances 

THE PURPOSE:

I find that with creating a piece of art or music it doesn't feel right if there is not a purpose attached to it. My purpose with this EP is to transmit the idea that we, as humans, should look at what we have in this world and appreciate it. But, as well as appreciating what we have, we should use those things (even the little things) to their fullest potential. It is important to give justice to the gifts that we have recieved in our lives. I think that in doing this we will find true happiness.

Spreading my hopes and ideas for the world is one of my biggest dreams and any support from anyone would be the greatest help to me in fulfilling those dreams. Thank you so much to anyone who is willing to support me in this project!

story:
Since you've found this page, you've probably heard of Tepetricy. Maybe one of us told you to check out our new music video or our Indie GoGo campaign. Either way, you are here, thank you! Please continue reading.

Many entrepreneurs struggle because they are constantly investing their time and money in to their project or business. There are so many expenditures that add up to a costly overhead where staying afloat is a constant challenge. Our band is no exception. 

Beginning in 2003, Tepetricy has put 10 years and tens of thousands of dollars in to the many areas of running the business of the band. At this time, we've been diligent and fortunate enough to: record three EP's and one full length record, play regionally in front of thousands of people, share stages with many of our nations top selling acts, and work with some of the most incredibly talented and creative people in this business. Over the years, we have grown as a band and as individuals by enduring many set backs and tragedies that greatly affected our spirit and forward momentum. But, we stuck together and picked up the pieces and discovered that the best way to honor those who are no longer with us was to succeed where they wanted us to most. As we find ourselves on the edge of 2014, we have accepted the loss of those closest to us. We have created a new family within our organization and are preparing to reach new heights with our uncanny inspiration to persevere. We've got the best team of creative minds to date and are on the brink of something incredibly special. We're so excited to be working with producer Colt Leeb (Soul Asylum, New Medicine, Quietdrive) and we feel he is somebody that really understands where we want to go with our music.

"This new music is the quintessential 'Tepetricy.' It will be our biggest statement." –AP

We really appreciate you reading this far but please continue reading for a very important message. We have everything in line to record an excellent record, but unfortunately, we lack a portion of the funding. For most of you, you've been to numerous shows, told your friends about us and maybe invested something personal into this Tepetricy journey. We do know who you are and appreciate you very much. And since we know you, you're probably asking, "we get it dude, what are ya selling?" Okay...we need to raise $5,000 to continue recording our album. $5,000 bucks and we'll take care of the rest. To show you what this campaign is all about, we've released our new single and music video for "Hole Digger" and have listed many other notable perks for your donations. So please take your time and choose the package that best fits you AND please spread the word by telling people to check out our new music video that we’re so excited about! Your support is and always will be paramount to our success. We thank you!


Any questions about Tepetricy's New Album 2014? Discuss on our thread at: Tepetricy New Album 2014 on CrowdFundingForum.com

www.tepetricy.com | www.facebook.com/tepetricy | www.twitter.com/tepetricy

story:
My name is Thomas and I work at Planet Mu.

On the 28th of May on returning from the U.K Traxman was involved in a street robbery whilst on the way to the local store in Chicago. He had $250 dollars of cash stolen as well as his passport. He was shot in the leg.

Traxman is in good spirits and on the mend but we feel bad about what has happened to him so we want to do a fund raiser to get him back the $250 that was stolen and a further $250 to replace his passport.

Please feel free to donate as much or as little as you like.
 
SO WE SMASHED IT ALREADY. ANY EXTRA CASH WILL GO STRAIGHT TO TRAXMAN.

story:
Help Swank Sinatra Record and Tour!

We're a band from Atlanta, GA that has always followed the "Do it Yourself" ethic. We book our own tours, record our own albums, create our own artwork and videos, and fix and maintain all of our own equipment and vehicles.

This year, we've decided to embark on the most ambitious string of projects in our history... A new record, a US tour, and a whole bunch of new music videos... but, this time we need YOUR help to bring it all to fruition!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $2500 to repair our touring gear, finish our album and get our "war wagon" ready for the road for this summer touring season.

Here's the breakdown:

  • $750 -- Equipment repair / replacement
  • $1000 -- Recording and CD Duplication
  • $250 -- Promotional expenses
  • $500 -- Touring expenses

In return, you will receive great perks! Everything from unreleased music and special content to private performances and pizza parties! Just have a look at the amazing PERKS!

The Impact

Your contribution is important because it solidifies the BEST working model for the music industry, which is that the FANS are the engine that drives the success of an artist.

With your help, we remain free to create the best possible art that we can, and in return, you receive the credit and rewards you deserve for your contributions! 

FOR REAL, CHECK OUT THE CRAZY PERKS -- WHICH EVEN INCLUDE A PIZZA PARTY!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help us promote! Share this campaign on your social networks!
  • Come see our shows!
  • Say "Swank Sinatra" out loud 1000 times!

story:
INFINITE LOVE AND GRATITUDE to all those who contributed and shared my vision! IF you missed the boat and would still like to contribute, fret not...you can PAYPAL me at:

 jazzminn8@yahoo.com

 Send me a private message on facebook or to jazzminn8@yahoo.com, and I'll still throw in a free download of the album!! THANK YOU SO MUCH! KEEP AN EYE AND EAR OUT FOR "FULL SPECTRUM MEDICINE" Coming soon!!....

xoxox ~PRRISMA~ xoxox

https://facebook.com/prrisma

https://soundcloud.com/prrisma

http://www.youtube.com/user/prrismamusic

https://prrisma.bandcamp.com

http://desertdwellersmusic.bandcamp.com/album/dive-into-forever-ep



Some Comedy For your viewing pleasurrrrreee!

My Story...

I am Prrisma, a singer/songwriter, or as I prefer to say, A Shamanic Songstress…This name Prrisma embodies the playful purring energy of the cat within me, combined with the prismatic rainbow of sounds and feelings I bring through my voice. My music is a full spectrum blend of styles, which weaves uplifting poetry into a combination of electronic soundscapes, including influences of multicultural medicine music, R&B soul flavors, and soaring etheric sound healing.  

I have been singing for as long as I can remember, and it has always been my dream to share my voice with the world on a large scale. My early years were filled with involvement in musical theatre, choral groups, and stage vocal performance, in combination with intensive dance and stage training. As I have stepped into adulthood, my passion for music and dance has continued, and has been brought to a deeper level through my spiritual awakening. I have gained an understanding of the power of sound frequency and how it can be used as a healing and awakening force for personal transformation. 

I have also gained inspiration and direction of my music through the influence of electronic music culture.For years, I have been performing at West Coast and International music festivals, as well as using my gifts through my involvement in sound healing ceremonies, local performance, and collaborations. My most recent and current collaborations are with Shaman's Dream, and Desert Dwellers, a talented team of ethnic downtempo bass music producers. I have had the honor to create an EP with Desert Dwellers (Dive Into Forever), serving as the main vocalist and combining my vocals and lyrics with their original music.

http://desertdwellersmusic.bandcamp.com/album/dive-into-forever-ep


 Now I am ready to create a project that is my own! 

Many of my friends and people who have heard me sing have been encouraging me to make an album and adamantly requesting recorded music they can take with them, and I am now ready to make that happen and get my music out there! 

My dream and vision is to produce a full length electronic/acoustic album containing all original music and content. It will be a fresh fusion of electronic world bass, multicultural medicine music, original vocals, and soaring ethereal soundscapes. Something you can get down to on the dance floor or play during a long drive or relaxing at home. Complex rhythms, driving bass, and  strong beats will enhance and support my feminine vocals. Im picturing the perfect blend of electronic and organic sounds, bringing together the best of both worlds.

 To enhance healing power, the entire album will be produced in the earth frequency: 432hz, and will be laced with binaural beats and theta waves (see below for details). This album will be a clear reflection of all aspects of the human experience, of this complex and beautiful life. It will serve as tool for an uplifting, transformational and healing journey. 

I hope to make this music available to the masses, through audio avenues as well as multimedia live performance, including dance, art, and acting. My performances (or prayerformaces) will be vivid, full sensory journeys, intended to facilitate transformation through deep trance-state dance and sound healing. I see this album as gift to the world, and a way to bring potent medicine, inspiration, and light to the masses! I recognize it as my calling to share my gift as a channel of sound with the planet, but I know I cannot do this alone. I need your support to make this mission of service and this personal dream a reality! 


This is where YOU come in...

Before I decided to make one of my own, I never realized just how much goes into making an album. It requires a complex combination of people, skills, resources, time, energy, and, of course, MONEY! A lot more money than one would guess. To get quality, many components must be taken into account, such as skilled producers and musicians, quality studio gear, studio time, proper mixing, and physical cd production. 

I feel that you all deserve the highest quality album I can possibly make, and want to offer nothing less than my best. Sure, I could just record these songs on GarageBand and throw some beats under it, but I understand the importance of a finely crafted and intricate piece of music, and what it can do for one's soul. I want to offer you music that will move you, inspire you, and touch you deeply. I want to invest the time, energy, and love into an offering that can make an impact, and serve as a light in the darkness, a fine jewel in among thousands of grains of sand.

 MY TEAM:

To really encompass the Full Spectrum Medicine of this album, I will be bringing together a team of some of the top producers in the industry, to co-create a rich and diverse pallet of sound design and music. 

My Team Includes:

Temple Step Project http://templestepproject.com

Desert Dwellers  http://desertdwellers.org

Birds of Paradise  http://birdsofparadisemusic.bandcamp.com

Joshua Pennman of Akara http://www.akaraproject.com

JediRising Soundcloud.com/JediRising

SIXIS   soundcloud.com/sixis-3

Living Light http://soundcloud.com/livinglight

Mystral soundcloud.com/mystralmusic

U.F.AUM 


HANNAH http://soundcloud.com/hannahthiem


JemInEye Incantations https://soundcloud.com/jemineyeincantations


Over the years, my music has been so inspired by intentional electronic music and the community that surrounds it. It feels really powerful to now birth a creation from that inspiration, bringing together the best qualities of the tribe's intentional producers and musicians to serve an album that reflects the full spectrum colors of this culture. 

And so I humbly ask for your support in helping me bring this deep and magical offering to you and the world! If my art, vision and intention inspires or interests you in any way, I encourage you to get involved, and become an active part of this creation! 

Your donations make a HUGE impact on the success and quality of this project. And every little bit helps. 


What I Need and Where it is Going:

My intention is to produce a Full Length 14 track album. I also will be launching my music career with the creation of a website, album art and production, and live performance set up. Here is how the budget breaks down:

Electronic Music Production: $500 per track: $7,000

Instrumental Musicians: $100 per track: $1,400

Studio Fees, Vocal Recording and Editing: $4,000

Mastering: $1,000

Mixing: $4,000

Physical CD Production: $1,000

Website and associated graphic design: $1,000

Album and Promotional Artwork: $750

Photo shoots: $750

Live Performance Gear: $1,000

Travel Costs to Record: $1,600

IndieGoGo Percentage: $1,000 (@ 4%)

TOTAL: $25,000

**If I do not raise enough to make my goal, I will use the money I have raised and make as much music as I possibly can! AND, If I raise over my goal, I will use the extra to start making beautiful music videos, and invest in visual elements for my live performances.


Logan Norton Photography Www.logannortonphotography.org

Here's How You Can Help:

Make a donation!

Every dollar makes all the difference! Ive got a wonderful array of perks lined up to show my appreciation, including downloads of the album and singles,  prints of my original art, sound healing, private concerts, your very own unicorn...!… ok maybe not the unicorn, but seriously, check out all these amazing perks! 

*** To Clarify...ANY Dollar amount can be typed in to donate, you are not just limited to the amount brackets listed in the perks (i.e: you can donate $60, $150, etc)

Spread the Word!

You can also really help by Spreading the word! Tell all your friends! Share this campaign link on Facebook, twitter, youtube, email, and all those nifty social media networks. The more people know, the faster it grows!"

Follow Me!

Stay tuned in, connected, and attentive…because I have a whole list of fun projects, including music videos, Sound ceremonies, and comedy coming soon!!!

Follow me on sound cloud, Facebook, you tube, etc

https://facebook.com/prrisma

https://soundcloud.com/prrisma

http://www.youtube.com/user/prrismamusic


https://prrisma.bandcamp.com

http://desertdwellersmusic.bandcamp.com/album/dive-into-forever-ep




INFINITE GRATITUDE FOR YOUR SUPPORT. I AM SO EXCITED TO SHARE MY GIFTS AND DREAMS WITH YOU AND THE WORLD!!!

XOXOXO

~PRRISMA~

prrismamusic@gmail.com

Logan Norton Photography Www.logannortonphotography.org

When our atoms and DNA start to resonate in harmony with the spiraling pattern of nature, our sense of connection to nature is said to be magnified. The number 432 is also reflected in ratios of the Sun, Earth, and the moon as well as the precession of the equinoxes, the Great Pyramid of Egypt, Stonehenge, the Sri Yantra among many other sacred sites.

story:
Introductions

The Flint Hill Fellowship is an ever expanding group of musician friends that share a passion for the gospel and expressing it through musical worship and praise. The two founding members, Ricky Kendall and John Dunne, have been playing music together for the better part of the last decade. 

Songs of Praise and Thanks Volume 1  is a collaborative worship project between two small church communities and the Flint Hill Fellowship. All of the songs are original, including adaptations of scripture and were written within those church communities. 

Why Make a Worship Album?

It is good to praise God. (Psalm 92: 1-3, Psalm 33:3). That is the beautiful simplicity of it.  No grandiose ambition lurks behind this recording; it is a simple act of praise. Some may not think this possible in the medium of music recording. In fact it may typically seem the opposite when a person toils to make some object that glorifies an artistic statement rather than God almighty.

But the Scriptures say that in all things, in word or deed, do in the name of Christ (Col 3:17). From our perspective, we sought to prolong our praise to God through the meticulous crafting of these seven songs. We sought to bring a community of musicians together, both believer and non-believer—showing love to one another as we honor the living God.  We sought to make good music as an offering, not a statement.  By His grace, He has guided us through these last 12 months in such a way that I feel confident in saying this recording belongs to Him and to those who seek Him.

Why do you need money? 

We were the first to ask this question. Ultimatly, we felt it was important to share the experiences we have had with other people. Scriptures say that our worship should be an expresion of love to God and to one another (John 21: 15-17). These songs were written for the express purpose of worship in the gathered church, and they have blessed the people in our local church communites for the last 5 years. It is our hope that others will find joy in these songs as well. 

The reality of doing this involves realworld costs. Throughout this project, God provided money through many generous hearts. As of now, we need the last bit to produce 1000 physical copies. These will go to people like you, to leaders in local churches, and to those that may know nothing of Christ's redeeming love.   

Specifics

  • The release date is June 5th.  
  • The money will go towards packaging, printing, replication, and distribution
  • These songs will be published to some degree, regardless of whether funding is met. The manner in which they are published, however, completely rests on this funding.
  • Take careful note of some of the incentives. I am a graphic designer and printmaker–and I would love to give those who back this project limited edition album packages, posters, and even a full-service branding strategy/design for a business or blog etc. I will periodically post photos of artwork during the course of this campaign.

 

God has already greatly shown His grace to us throughout this recording process, and we are excited to share these songs with you. If you are so inclined, please pray for this project, that His will is done, whether great or small. Thanks for your consideration in giving to this project and God bless you.

story:
Ascendism is just one of the 2 members of the duo sensation known as PhotoniX.  Focusing on melodic composition and sound design in all styles of electronic music, he has risen to earn respect from a ton of current electronic artists, mix engineers, as well as promoters and event organizers all over the world.

http://soundcloud.com/photonix_official

PhotoniX is an ongoing collaborative effort, and will not be affected by the solo projects of either Woogie or Ascendism.  We may end up having a Woogie remix on the debut EP however ;-)

A preview of the EP!  (that's right! I've already started it!)
https://soundcloud.com/ascendism/the-absence-of-moonlight-a

Ascendism:

Starting out as a basement producer at the age of 25, he spent 2 full years dedicated to learning sound design, mix engineering, and electronic music production techniques.  This time was allotted to do NOTHING BUT Music!  Why?  Because music is our escape, our magic. Without it we are not whole.  As a creative individual having spent years as a flash programmer, switching to audio wasn't that far off of the learning curve.   The science of sound and mix engineering is where It all started to get really deep.  Now a full time mix engineer and experienced production artist, he is ready to take on the responsibility of releasing some of the most unique Electro, Glitch Hop, Dubstep, Drumstep, DnB, Neurofunk, Midtempo Funk, and Midtempo Chillstep possible.


A message from the man himself:  

"My goal is more than just putting out an album.  I want to help change the current music industry through example.  We have a lot of artists flooding the charts with sample based music (purchased waveform sections used to build tracks cookie-cutter style) with little to no sound design experience.  I want to be another one of the guys showing upcomers how to accomplish their goals with hard work and proper motivation."


Why I need your help:

Funding a project of this magnitude is difficult for any 'starving artist'.  We often encounter financial roadblocks at every turn. A few experienced artists have told me "spending as much time as possible in the studio is the key to banging out a killer record". While we all know time isn't free (or cheap even)..  It's safe to say that things like a proper advertising campaign, graphics for the album art, logos and custom graphics for clothing/stickers/flyers are usually overlooked at a glance.

I would love to have your support in any fashion you can provide it!  I love every single one of you simply for taking the time to read this, that alone shows a huge point of character for all of you.  <3  and THANK YOU for your contribution and page shares!! Pass on the love to your friends who may be interested! 

I'll do my best to get the perk rewards shipped out to people sooner than the expected dates as well!  

Each perk will come with the EP distributed to you directly prior to official release & a special mention in certain release formats, so long as you choose not to remain anonymous.

I'll do my best to get the perk rewards shipped out to people sooner than the expected dates as well!  
Each perk will come with the EP distributed to you directly prior to official release & a special mention in certain release formats, so long as you choose not to remain anonymous.

story:
Introducing the Music Ministry of Mary Chea

For well over three decades, power-vocalist, Mary Chea has dedicated her life to serving one purpose.  Her mission is to bring Hope to hopeless situations and to lift the spirit of brokenness in the lives of individuals.  This Ohio native discovered the power of praise and worship at Greater Emmanuel Apostolic Temple in Cincinnati, Ohio, as a young single mother in the mid-Eighties and early Nineties.   

During a live concert recording with her church at the Cincinnati Convention Center in 1992, Mary recalls a point where she looked out into what seemed to be a sea of faces and realized that she and her four year old son were a part of a moment that continues to impact both of their lives today.  Another living witness to that life-changing event is Mary's mother who continues to pray for her five children to have deeper purposes beyond just talents and skills.


The prayers of her mother along with Mary's nearly forty years of singing and making music has prepared her for this next musical endeavor. "Ready" is a project that will encourage each listener to rise up to the call to make a difference in the world around them.  You can be a part of making a difference in changing hearts and lives through this music project. Would you please consider investing in this vision? This is how you can be a part of making this dream a reality:

1.  Praying

2.  Giving financially

3.  Sharing this link with family and friends

story:
Short Summary

My name is Lysette Titi.  I am of Hassanamisco Nipmuc Native American, Black and Ivorian decent. I have written songs for many R&B greats like 702, Monica, and Faith Evans. MY songs have been placed in major movies like Blue Streak, starring Martin Lawrence and Owen Wilson. Four months ago, I released a single called Leap on Itunes. The single gained local and national radio. I've gone from performing in small clubs to grand stages in a very short period of time on my own without management. I've spent past 10 years singing background for artist such as Macy Gray, Kelis, Raheem Devaughn and Nicki Minaj. Every artist I've worked for has insisted that I pursue a solo career and not give up on the idea. 

What We Need & What You Get

I need 7k to complete my album. The funds will go to purchasing music, work for hire musicians, mix engineers, 2 photo shoots, In ear monitors, 2 videos and a social media campaign. I currently have material on local and national radio but I need to increase my online presence.

    The Impact

    Your contribution will enable me to deliver a great R&B 90's reminiscent album and a brand of determination. Like Oprah! People who hear the story and my songs will be inspired to live, create and push through their obstacles. This is a story of struggle, hope and perseverance. 

      Risks & Challenges

      While I can't foresee any unfixable challenges, there is always the risk that it's simply not in the cards for me. However, this is highly unlikely, the life signs have lead me to MAKE IT HAPPEN:-)

        Other Ways You Can Help

        If your'e unable to donate please share my story.

story:
(video by Malixe Photo)

HONK! Fest West is a free, community-supported music festival taking place June 19-22 in various locations around Seattle. HONK! is devoted to marching bands, drum corps, samba lines, and anything acoustic and mobile that makes a ruckus. We revel in celebration of street band culture by taking joy and music to the streets and parks of Seattle. Family-friendly and fun for all ages.

What We Need

HONK! Fest West brings nearly 30 bands to Seattle from all over the country for this one spectacular weekend — & we do it all on a budget of only about $20,000! How is that even possible? All festival organizers are volunteers. All bands donate their time as well, requiring only compensation for (partial) travel expenses. And local host team provides all food & housing.

We pride ourselves in doing a lot with very little. Still, our festival has a variety of expenses: travel stipends, food for nearly 400 musicians & volunteers, permits, insurance, rentals, promotion, etc.

We need to raise at least 10% of our modest budget from this community-supported online fundraising campaign. This will supplement all the money we raise from grants, community sponsors, on-site donations, and other funding sources.

Please contribute to this one-of-a-kind event by donating whatever you can.

What You Get

Anyone who donates $25 or more will be acknowledged on our website, plus you'll get festival memorabilia (a poster, a t-shirt). Larger donors get VIP passes, giving you access to all events & behind the scenes. For one very special donor, we offer the original painting by Ryan Henry Ward created specially for this year's festival! (The image is at the top of this page.)

Other Ways You Can Help

Donating money is not the only way people can support HONK! Fest West. Our festival is 100% volunteer-powered & requires several dozen volunteers to make things run smoothly. You can volunteer here on our website: http://honkfestwest.com/volunteer/

Also, please help spread the word about this fundraising campaign to your friends, your social media networks, etc. Together we can make HONK! Fest West 2014 a stunning success!

story:
Hey Friends,

This Spring of 2014 I will be touring into the Southern States with a few of my band mates to play an acoustic tour. This campaign is all about kick starting funding for the tour. I would love it if we could partner with you and make this happen!

Blessings.

Check Out Andrew's Bio:

Andrew Abbott is a Christian Recording Artist, based in London, Ontario, Canada. His artistic tone and accurate pitch draws in all those who hear his music. His songs are lyric driven, reaching to the core emotions that each one of us have experienced in life.

“I know there are people in this world that are hurting; I want my music to reach into their hearts and give them something that is greater than their hurt."

Andrew Abbott recently debuted his career with an acoustic album titled: This Is Grace. This album has enlisted some very talented musicians. With the likes of Christopher StahIke, Keith Comer, and Seth Kimberly Hunter, this album blends acoustic guitar, piano, violin, and cajon to give an upbeat acoustic sound directing the listener’s heart to the message of the lyrics. Andrew's goal is to highlight the realization of hope by focusing the heart of his audience to encounter God and the love He has for them. 

Why not come out to one of Andrew Abbott’s shows and see for yourself? You will not be disappointed as you step into the presence of the greatest Love you will ever experience! His name is Jesus.

Here is Andrew's music:

Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/andrewcharlesabbott/sets...
Youtube: http://youtu.be/0zHVudXabco
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Andrew-Abbott/210726842288856

story:
Short Summary

In the past 15 years, music programs have been in the process of being cut all over the United States due to budgetary constraints. But, by cutting music programs out from the curriculum, schools and communities are actually hurting their children.

It has been proven on more then one occassion that music helps increase test scores, verbal skills, language skills (both speech and comprehension), math skills and temporal spacial understanding. But, because of the cost involved in providing instruments, sheet music, and instructors-schools are just throwing this valuable asset away. 

As a result myself, Monika Ratzenboeck and my two sons, Marcus and Derek and daughter Karissa have created this foundation to help provide music back to schools and children all over the United States.  As part of our foundation we take damaged musical instruments and fix them then provide them to the students of participating schools. All schools are eligible to participate, all they need to do is fill out an application, have space for a music class and have students who are or want to be enrolled in a music program at their schools. We then fix these instruments and ship them to the participating schools and students. In addition, we provide a scholarship program for students who want to persue a career in music. There is an application process and all scholarship monies are presented at the end of the school term for the winning student(s).

The reason that All Children's Music Foundation is looking for funding is that we have over 300 instruments that we need to get fixed and shipped to aspiring musicians and blossoming music programs all over the nation. To fix these instruments, it takes money and time. We have been running this program for over 14 years without outside funding, but now we need your help to continue this great program for students. 

A Little About The Founders of All Children's Music Foundation

Hello my name is Monika Ratzenboeck

Music has been a very important part of my families lives. I have two sons who are both recording artists in very different genres of music. Both of my sons are classically trained and both are highly educated as musicians. Marcus was even a professor of music in Louisville when he was performing with the Louisville Orchestra. Now Marcus, is a famous hard rock recording artist with the Warner Group Artists platinum selling band Tantric and still performing with the Sarasota and Florida Orchestras and along with his brother started a recording studio called H&M Productions, with offices in Sarasota Florida, and New York City.

While my other son Derek, also a recording artist, stuck with his classical upbringing and is performing with the New York Ballet in Lincoln Center. 

 

And my daughter Karissa has also taken a shine to music traveling internationally and performing live along side Derek and solo.

 

Music helped to shape the lives of my children and my family. Now please help us to help shape the lives of aspiring musicians and just the budding intellect of children across the United States. 

Let us give the same opportunity that was provided to my children, to other children around the United States. Help by providing funds to our Foundation, All Children's Music Foundation, a Sarasota Florida based 501 (c) 3.  Bring better opportunities, increased educational experience and possible help develop a passion for music and the arts within your community today.

What We Need & What You Get

To help support our current Foundation we are looking for $30,000.  

  • $20,000 of this money will be utilized for the rehabilitation of instruments for our school instrument grant program. This includes the replacement of bridges, new strings, bass necks, etc. 
  • Approximately, $1,500 will be used for shipping costs of the fixed instruments,
  • $15,000 will be spilt up into 5 scholarships of $5,000 to winning students
  • The remaining $3,000 will be used for marketing, printing, advertising, and procurement of new donations.

First and foremost, when donating to this program you will get the satisfaction of knowning you are bringing music back to children.

In addition, we have a number of perks for our contributors at different donation levels.

For a donation of $25 to $50, All Children's Music Foundation will send you a signed poster of Bale, the up and coming national recording artists.

For a donation of $51 to $150, All Children's Music Foundation will send you a signed poster from the platinum selling artists Tantric and a signed photo of the student you helped bring music back to.

For a donation of $151 to $300, All Childrens Music Foundation will include you in our press release announcing your support of this program and we will send you a photo and a letter from the child that you just gave an instrument to, in addition to a signed poster from Tantric.

For a donation of $301 to $500, All Childrens Music Foundation will include you in one press release and on the online marketing materials as a donor to the program. In addition, we will send you a signed CD of your choice from etiher Bale, Tantric, or classical CD from Derek Ratzenboeck.

For a donation of $501-$1000, All Childrens Music Foundation will include you on two press releases, all online marketing materials, and will send you a photo of the class that you helped. In addition, you get to choose a signed CD of your choice from Bale, Tantric or classical CD from Derek Ratzenboeck. 

For a donation of $1001-$2000, All Childrens Music Foundation will include you in two press releases, all online marketing materials and one offline marketing material as a Silver level Donor, invite you to meet Marcus and Monika Ratzenboeck at H&M Productions in Sarasota Florida to present the musical instruments to a local school. Marcus will then provide the donor a signed CD and poster of their choice and even let them sit in on a session at H&M Productions if they would like.

For a donation of $2001-$5000, All Childrens Music Foundation will include the donor in three press releases, all online marketing materials and offline marketing materials as a Gold Level Donor, send you two tickets to the upcoming Foundation fundraising show in Dallas Texas, which will include a number of top stars in rock, rap, and country all coming together in the support of this great cause. In addition, you will have the opportunity to come with either Derek or Marcus to a local school and present the instruments to the students. Also, either H&M Productions New York or H&M Productions Sarasota will invite you to have your own three hour production session with them. 

For a donation of $5001-$10,000, All Childrens Music Foundation will include the donor in three press releases, all online and offline marketing materials, announced as a donor at the upcoming show in Dallas, send two backstage passes to the show. You will be recognized on all materials as a Platinum donor. In addition, to an opportunity to present instruments to a class with either Derek or Marcus Ratzenboeck. Also two tickets to a show featuring the up and coming artists Bale, along with a signed CD of your choice and a poster of your choice.

For a donation of $10,001-$20,000 All Childrens Music Foundation will include the donor in three press releases, all online and offline marketing materials, announced as a donor at the upcoming Fundraising show in Dallas, allow a representative of the donor or the donor themselves present a foundation wrapped instrument to the winner of the auction, receive their company logo or family name prominently displayed at the venue in Dallas. The donor will be given the opportunity to present their musical instruments to a qualifying school of their choice, meet with Marcus Ratzenboeck and Derek Ratzenboeck. Have an opportunity to watch the band Bale, and receive 4 backstage passes to the foundation concert. Be recognized as a Platinum donor on all advertising and marketing for the Foundation. And lastly you will have the opportunity to be on the scholarship committee. Providing a future in music to an aspiring musician.

The Impact

In 2007 a study by Christopher Johnson, professor of music education and music therapy at the University of Kansas, revealed that students in elementary schools with superior music education programs scored around 22 percent higher in English and 20 percent higher in math scores on standardized tests, compared to schools with low-quality music programs, regardless of socioeconomic disparities among the schools or school districts. Johnson compares the concentration that music training requires to the focus needed to perform well on a standardized test.

Aside from test score results, Johnson’s study highlights the positive effects that a quality music education can have on a young child’s success. Luehrisen explains this psychological phenomenon in two sentences: “Schools that have rigorous programs and high-quality music and arts teachers probably have high-quality teachers in other areas. If you have an environment where there are a lot of people doing creative, smart, great things, joyful things, even people who aren’t doing that have a tendency to go up and do better.”

We at All Children's Music Foundation have been successfully running this program for over 14 years. We made a decision this year that over the next 5 years we would like to increase our number of scholarships to 20 children and our number of schools to 50. Help us give music back to our children. The impact it will have on our future is irreplaceable.

Other Ways You Can Help

For those that just can’t contribute, you can still help:

1) If you have an old instrument that is just collecting dust or you know someone who does, we would appreciate any donations. We are a 501 (c) 3 so we will provide the write-off paperwork

2) If you know of any schools who would like to increase their music program and/or have cut their music program because of funding let them know about us and we will get them started on the application process.

3) Send out our cause across your Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Google, Pinterest, and other social networks. The more people that know about our great cause the more donations we can get and the more children we can provide musical instruments and programs for.

4) Just tell your friends about us. Even $1 helps. Every $1 we receive goes back to the our future generations. So lets not deprive them of music and culture and language. Let's enhance their education and help them make their dreams become reality.

 

SO DONATE TODAY AND GET THE WORD OUT ABOUT ALL CHILDREN'S MUSIC FOUNDATION.

story:
Short Summary

Like most singers, I've been doing it since I was a kid. I was always the tiny girl with the raspy low voice, and it wasn't till my adult life I realized it was a good thing! My husband Charlie is my drummer, and making music together is our dream. I've come to place in my songwriting that is new for me, and this EP truly shows my heart to see heaven come to earth!

Making this album has been a long time coming, and this campaign plays a huge role! Your support changes everything for me! When you give to my project, you aren't just helping me record an album. You are joining me on my mission, for people to experience what heaven feels like on this earth.

When you give, it covers a few things on my end. I will be able to get in the studio, pay for the album to be mastered, and release it online! Seems simple, but it's a lot of hard work! So please consider giving, and helping me record my first solo EP, 'Heaven to Earth'.

 

What We Need & What You Get

To make this album, I need $1800! This covers the basics of recording, mastering, and releasing online.

When you contribute, you get a few rewards! Depending on your gift amount, you may get my album before its released or a behind the scenes documentary on the making of the album. Scroll down and check out all the perks!

If I don't reach my goal, I still receive the funds I raised. Every penny will go into the studio should this be the case. My plan is to use whatever I raise to get these songs recorded!

 

The Impact

We live in a hurting world. Sadly the world we live in is full of people, who have been shown a bad example of who Jesus is. We all play a part in changing that perspective, and I plan to take it on through music. It's vital that people begin experiencing what the bible says, "on earth, as it is in heaven...", when someone can experience that it's life changing! That is where my heart is while songwriting. I want people to experience the TRUE freedom that comes with knowing Christ!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute, YOU CAN STILL HELP! Please share this page to everyone on the planet! The more people that know, the greater my chances are for reaching my goal!

story:
Whew (wiping my forehead)!  It’s tough out here…but I know nothing good comes easy.

Let me begin by introducing myself, my name is Kimberly Roberts, President and CEO of Connection Records, LLC, an independent record label.  I started my indie label in 2008 right at the beginning of the economic recession.  For me that meant a loss of income from my 9-5 job because my employer was bought out and relocated to another state, a loss of investors for my new business, and no access to bank loans or grants.  They say when it rains it pours right?

 I went ahead and released an album for my R&B & Soul artist Kashief (www.kashief.com) on September 7, 2010 hoping that miraculously it would sell without marketing and promoting the CD.  Boy was I kidding myself (SMH).

Thing is I’ve watched the CD sell some every month (avg. 127 singles annually) since the release without a marketing and promotions campaign, which made me realize even more that I have to market and promote the next project.  I am sure we’d sell 1000 times more if we can increase the fan base and get the music heard. I have a goal of selling 100K units in a year and selling 5K units the first week so we can enter the Billboard charts.

Kashief and I are currently working on a sophomore album, and this time I know I have to have a marketing and promotions campaign, so I have set my eyes on the SE region of the US as a starter. 

I am looking to raise a minimum of $25,000.00 upwards to $50,000.00 to make this campaign possible.  Although that’s the goal….any funds raised will go towards the marketing and promotions campaign for Kashief, even if we fall short.  This is where you can help by making donations.  I’m on bended knees now :).

I will make sure you really understand how much your donation is appreciated by giving perks to participants in this drive.  Perks will include Lifetime VIP treatment by the label for donations, complimentary passes to shows/events, CD’s and T-Shirts, and mentions as sponsors on press releases, banners, and etc.  I have listed the resources we will use to market and promote in the SE region:  Music Video & Promo Campaign, Playlist on Delta Airlines, Radio Advertising, Comcast, College Campus Tour, and Internet Media (ex. Straightfromthea).

One might ask the questions…why should I contribute or will my contribution make a difference?  My answers would be besides because you having a giving and charitable heart, you will be making a difference in the success story of a dreamer.  Also, yes it will make a difference because it will help me to properly market and promote as I live my dream. 

You would be helping me build a fan base for an awesome artist www.kashief.com as well as build a brand.  There is nothing like the American dream. 

As I said in the opening statement, it is tough out here!  And I will accept any donation you can make because plain and simple I need help.  But if you can’t make a monetary donation, I’d like to ask if you could do me a favor?  You are in the “Music” section so I can only assume you are a music lover, so spread the word about this campaign, Kashief, and Connection Records.  Use the Indiegogo share tools courtesy of Indiegogo. (Still on bended knees)J

Thanks in advance,

 

Kimberly Roberts

President/CEO, Connection Records

story:
SUFFOCATION, KITTIE, THE AGONIST, SKULL FIST, AUGURY, and BEHEADING OF A KING in Toronto!!!

Dates: September 7th and 8th, 2013

Venue: The Opera House

Event: https://www.facebook.com/events/142645535907013/

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Short Summary

Anyone who was at last year's festival in Halifax knows about Spread the Metal Records' committment to heaviness. But I believe businesses can be doing even more to assist the less fortunate. That's where the STM Festival comes in.

The idea behind it is to use whatever medium available to me, in this case heavy metal, to positively impact the most lives. Fans get a spectacular metal festival, and Kiva.org receives some much needed support!

They can explain it better here:

www.kiva.org

Spread the Metal Records fights for those who cannot fight for themselves. We are transparent in all our business dealings and everyone gets straight answers from us. We have nothing to hide.

What We Need & What You Get

Putting on a metal festival is crazy expensive. Even more so if you want to bring in quality headliners, which we will obviously be doing!

Headliners:

SUFFOCATION

KITTIE

THE AGONIST

AUGURY

BEHEADING OF A KING

SKULL FIST

With Special Guests: THE CATALYST, SANKTUARY, DEATHPOINT, CRIMSON SHADOWS, ANSWER WITH METAL, HALLOWS DIE, NOTHING LEFT FOR TOMORROW, EVERTRAPPED, NEPHELIUM, DERELICT, and WRETCHED PAIN!!!

That's a pretty sick lineup, and all these bands need/deserve to be paid. But there's not only the band guarantees, there are also promotional costs, venue rentals, backline set-up, hospitality riders, and more.

We could cover all these costs with good ticket sales, but then hardly anything would be left over to donate to the cause. And after all, that's kind of the point here, eh?

We believe so strongly in what Kiva.org is doing, that we want to hand over more money than we EVER could by only relying on profits from ticket sales. Crowd funding has given us the opportunity to reach out to the internet community and make a real difference in people's lives.  

We're giving away SIGNED ALBUMS and SET LISTS from all the headliners, GUITAR PICKS, SIGNED TEE SHIRTS from the bands, FREE DIGITAL ALBUM DOWNLOADS, INVITATIONS TO THE SOUND CHECK, and so much more! You even get the chance to PUNCH A RECORD LABEL EXECUTIVE as hard as you'd like!!!

I'm going to be the one volunteering his body for that one! You get up on stage, and wale on me with boxing gloves in payback for what record labels have done!

NOTE ON SHIPPING: If you're planning on coming to the festival, we'll arrange to have your signed albums and such waiting for you. That saves us some shipping costs that would have otherwise come out of The Heart and Stroke Foundation's pockets. The less money we spend like that, the more goes towards the cause.

There is a full budget outlined below to show you exactly where your money is going!

The Budget

Spread the Metal Records believes in total transparency, in an industry where that is virtually non-existent. Fans deserve to know where their money is going and how it actually helps the people that we are claiming to help.

We are set up for flex funding, so even if we don't reach our goal, the money raised will still go towards costs. Any and all remaining profits from the festival will go to the non-profit organizations.

Total Estimated Costs:

Venue Rental Fees = $6,500

Publicity and Promotion = $1000

Hospitality Riders = $750

Event Insurance: $2,000

Extra Pit Security = $750

Band Guarantees = $19,950

Backline and Production = $2,500

GRAND TOTAL = $33,450

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make it to the festival, or can't contribute to the campaign, no worries! Thank you for even reading down this far! That being said, there is so much you can do to help us get the message out and save lives. Tell others!!! With all the social networking and ways we can now connect with one another, by sharing this page, you are reaching places we would never be able to reach.

The Impact

This is what I, Matt Day, have dedicated my life to doing. Helping people to rise from the conditions in which they find themselves and create a better life for themselves and their families.

There are certain things that upset me. For example, just 1% of what the governments of the world spend on their militaries, is enough to put every child ON EARTH, into school.

There are something like 18 million empty houses in America, and only 5 million homeless people. Education and Health Care should be free but they're ridiculously expensive.

A staggering number of people are persecuted based on things like skin color, who they choose to marry, and other inconsequential shit.

Allow me to clear something up right now. It is the official position of myself and STM Records, that everyone has the right to be happy. If people spent more time looking for love, instead of judging the people who have already found it, I think we'd be a lot better off.

Another one of my favorite organizations is Doctors Without Borders. You can find out more about them here:

http://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/

NOTES:

FOR INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING, PLEASE ADD $3 FOR CANADA, $5 FOR THE UNITED STATES, AND $8 FOR THE REST OF THE WORLD

GOT ANY QUESTIONS? EMAIL US AT info@spreadthemetal.com AND WE WILL GET BACK TO YOU AS SOON AS HUMANLY POSSIBLE.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

                                 NOW GO FORTH AND SPREAD THE METAL!!! \m/

GOT ANY QUESTIONS? EMAIL US AT info@spreadthemetal.com AND WE WILL GET BACK TO YOU AS SOON AS HUMANLY POSSIBLE.

                                 NOW GO FORTH AND SPREAD THE METAL!!! \m/

story:
Monmouth University Music Industry Students are at it again

West Long Branch, New Jersey, October 2013: Have you heard about Blue Hawk Records? It began as part the Applied Music Industry II course of spring semester 2013.  An idea was born for a student-run record label under the instruction and supervision of Professor Joe Rapolla, Monmouth University Alum and music industry veteran.

Forming Blue Hawk Records gives students the experience of the real world within the classrooms at Monmouth University. It gives the opportunity to see what each position of a record label entails and the members were able to find their true talents.  A lot was accomplished in the total of twelve hours spent in class. Four artists submitted music and were chosen to be featured in the Spring 2013 Compilation CD. There are two bands, 99 Regrets and Seasons, and two singer-songwriters, Sarah Gublin and Natalie Zeller. They were able to record, master, and package the compilation CD, create merchandise, and form a partnership with Lakehouse Music through the school. There was a release party held on May 2nd 2013 with performances from all four artists and gifts from sponsors.

Through these many accomplishments, Blue Hawk Records is continuing their hard work in the Applied Music Industry III class. One of the new projects of the class is an IndieGoGo campaign to raise money to record more music. The label is also having an event on December 4th to release the next compilation CD. It will include performances from the four artists on the previous compilation as well as two new artists, Kristi Hunt and James Porricelli. The group is excited to continue to thrive and make a mark on Monmouth University’s campus as well as their own careers.

story:
About Steve

Hi, I'm Steve. I’m a self-taught musician of over 20 years, and I’ve been recording my own music for over 7 years. I’m better known as being the vocalist/guitarist of punk band “Shower With Goats”, and more recently for “Steve and the Neurotics” and my support of  “Anonymous”. 

My Goal

To start a recording studio for in-need musicians/artists where I can record them free of charge. To achieve this goal, I require a minimum of $5,500 to purchase the proper studio equipment that will ensure a quality recording. I already have a large, empty space available for this project,

How I got this idea

As a long time musician, I know all too well the hardship involved with scraping together enough money to get a decent recording of the music I worked so hard to write. For about 7 years I’ve been recording my own music at home with old, donated equipment. I’ve managed to get fairly decent, demo quality results with what I have to work with.

While browsing through indiegogo and campaign sites of this nature, I’ve come across many artists campaigning for $5,000 to $10,000 to record just one album. I thought to myself… “Wow, I can build a pretty nice recording studio for that amount of money that can record infinite albums!”

Why this is a good idea

Like myself, there are many artists/musicians out there who don’t necessarily want to become rock stars. They just want an opportunity to have a nice recording of the piece they worked so hard to write. Something they can be proud of. Something they can share with others to invoke thought or emotion via the piece they’ve recorded. Because in my eyes, that’s what being a musician is all about.

At $25 to $50 per hour being the average rate of time in a professional recording studio, this can be difficult to achieve. This is where I want to come in. This is the difference that I want to make.

story:
I had a previous campaign on this site, which thanks to the wonderfully generous people who donated, successfully helped me replace my broken computer so that the retouching side of my photography can be done! This is now a campaign to help raise the money for the rest of the studio equipment needed.

My Story
I'm Catherine; I've had a passionate love affair with photography since the age of 6 and am now a freelance fashion and beauty photographer and retoucher. Creating images is my passion, my love, my expression and my freedom. It's my life, and it keeps me breathing.
I've recently lost regular studio access, and desperately need to be able to shoot from home so I can continue this passion.


The Impact
If this campaign is successful, I'll be able to shoot from home. I'll also be able to shoot more often, and for longer periods of time, which in turn will bring a steady stream of images to your screens. Models, designers, hair stylists, makeup artists and aspiring models will all fully welcome to come to shoot.

I will be opening my books to people of all experiences, whether they would like a starting portfolio, fun test shoots, look books, editorials and everything in-between. 


What We Need & What You Get
I need to raise around $1000 (Just over ï¿½600 at the current exchange rate) to buy various basic equipment required to make a home studio a reality.
There are various 'perks' to donating (listed over there -->) If you're interested claiming any of these and have any questions, simply mail me at info@catherine-day.com


Equipment Needed

Lighting kit (two lights + softboxes + stands) - ï¿½550 (would allow for fashion)

or

One light (plus softbox + stand) - ï¿½370 (would allow for beauty)


Background support system - ï¿½60

Background roll - ï¿½25


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate but would like to help, you could share this page, and send it to people you think may be interested in helping, I would be incredibly grateful. x

Lighting kit (two lights + softboxes + stands) - ï¿½550 (would allow for fashion)
or
One light (plus softbox + stand) - ï¿½370 (would allow for beauty)

Background support system - ï¿½60
Background roll - ï¿½25


Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't donate but would like to help, you could share this page, and send it to people you think may be interested in helping, I would be incredibly grateful. x

story:
My Story

Hey everyone! My name is Brett Hystad and I lead worship at Second Baptist Church West Campus in Houston, Texas. I am finishing up my first record - "Holding My Heart". I am very excited to see this project be finished. I started recording last fall and I am beyond ready to have this finished! I am humbled that you would give me the time to explain this project to you! I beyond appreciate any help rather financially or just getting the word out! 

The Impact

Hopefully when people hear this record, I pray that they would see Christ more than any musician or songwriter.  I know that without Him, this whole process would have been impossible. I am hoping to share a small piece of what Christ has taught me through this music. I desire to see people come to know the love of Jesus Christ and what He has done for us!

What I Need & What You Get

I am hoping to raise $2,500 for this project for two reasons. First, I need right around $2,000 to have the EP duplicated and the CDs made professionally. Second, I am using the remaining donations for promotional purposes and t-shirts. If I don't reach my goal, every penny of the donations will go to the duplication. For all those who donate, I will get you a copy of the CD asap and hopefully a t-shirt in the future!


Other Ways You Can Help

This whole campaign relies on you! I need your help on spreading the word to anyone and everyone you think would want to help finish this project. Facebook, Twitter, and all other social networking sites are great tools to get the information out to people. Even if you cannot donate financially, I beyond appreciate if you would tell people about it! Again, I cannot thank you enough for helping this project finish and I am looking forward to what God does through this CD! Thanks!

story:
As you can see in the picture above, when I was very small, my Mom made me take piano lessons.  I hated to practice and always showed disapproval!  Now that I have grown, I'm so glad she did!  You can read all about me in an interview with Shardul Pandey from his webpage entitled Shardul Pandey Talks on Sangkrit.net. Here's the link:  

http://sangkrit.net/2013/09/20/shardul-pandey-talks-to-don-duvall/

I have written songs that I'm proud of. I believe my tunes represent a solid foundation that results in a saleable commodity. I have got to say that I have very high hopes for the tunes I am trying to put out there. They are the kind of tunes that appeal to many different listeners’ tastes. 

Over the last 4 decades, I've put a lot of my time (even when I should have been doing other things!) into writing songs that were commercially viable and I'm looking forward to getting them out there for everyone to listen to. I have a record executive who is very excited about working with me and he has a full blown studio with studio musicians that are really top notch. They’re the ones who will turn my tunes into a complete work of art. Although I feel as if I am very gifted musician, studio musicians have a way of making you hear things that you never heard before and present your great ideas into something even more rewarding to the ear! With help from you it’s all possible.

All my ducks are in a row and I’m ready to commit to a complete success at fulfilling my dreams. Most all of my money from you will go toward the preparation of my tunes at the recording studio and studio musicians.If I were to get more money than I ask for it will mean I can do even more songs in the studio depending on the amount. 

I am 60 years old and although I am still going strong, I want to try and make sure I have something left behind for my family to listen to when I'm gone and say "That was my Dad, Grandpa, Husband or even Friend" when I'm gone. I have many pictures over the years and although they are worth a thousand words, sounds can be worth a thousand pictures when combined together. I wish I had a good quality song of my Mom when she was still alive singing. She was a tremendous pianist/vocalist, but never took it to the next level that I did. 

I have been a musician since high school and actually made my living playing, raised a family, we've always had a roof over our heads and a decent car to drive, As you know however as we get older things change. I now resort to playing very part time and get the most rewards in my little studio, writing songs and singing for that "invisible" audience. I hope to someday share my efforts with a large group of listeners who hopefully will appreciate the time and work I have put into this over the years. All of my perks will be awarded if the project fully funds only. Thank you for your help.

story:
Summary

Hey! We're Variants!  A melodic rock outfit from New Orleans, LA and we are here to ask for your assistance.  We have been active as a band for a little over a year now and this first year has been one of firsts for us.  From first show, to first merchandise order, to first tour, to first van purchase and now our FIRST FULL-LENGTH CD!  We have taken it as our responsibility to finance all of this ourselves as we feel that it is our duty to spread the word of our band and our music the way it should be -- by whole-hearted messages and music that we hope is relative.  

However, we have hit a point in our career that we finally have to swallow our pride and turn to you, the fans, for assistance.  Upon finalizing the record and all the background necessities, we are left with the cost of distribution.  This cost is EXTREMELY vast, as we are un-signed and have to distribute this ourselves. 

This has led us here, to indiegogo.com, where we can professionally ask the supporters of Variants for help in spreading our music and message to the world.  Just know that in donating, you are doing more than just handing over money.  You are becoming a PART of Variants; a part that will never be forgotten and a debt that we, as a band, will never be able to repay.  Of course, incentives will be presented to hopefully increase donation demand, but our main incentive that we pitch is that you help us reach the goals that we have all dreamt about since being small children; to release a full-length record to the world to show what we have to offer!

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal amount that we are asking for is a total of $4000.00.  So that you know, here is a list of all the places that this money will be portioned off to:

- CD layout expense
- Graphic Design for the album
- Copyright publications
- Printing hard-copy CD's
- Printing new merchandise for pre-orders of the record.
- and anything in between

To support this vast list of items that need to be completed for the record, we have laid out a hand-full of incentives for donations in increasing intervals.  These perks may be viewed below in detail but will include:

- A certified "thank you" in our credit section of the album booklet
- An entrance into a raffle for the FIRST EVER hard copy press of our album
- An invite to an exclusive acoustic show
- Even a personal show at your designated location!

The Impact

The impact of your donation goes way deeper than a simple click of a button.  This donation will help us reach our lifetime goal of giving the world music that we hope is relative.  We are in dire need of spreading a message and have it at the cusp.  Your donation will push us over the edge and allow us to show the world what we have to offer!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

- Just by spreading the word of our band and of the video/campaign at hand is more than enough.
- Spreading this link on your facebook, twitter, instagram, youtube, whatever it may be is a start to showing the world who Variants is and what we have to offer
