story:
(Article en français disponible plus bas)


Us, our dream, etc...

We are a small band for Strasbourg that only started a year ago, and for one year we put all our energy into this project. All members of the band have different influences but the one trait we all share is that we all want the music to be our life.

I, for one, would never have dared imagine that I would stand at this point, so close to releasing an album that would be mine! It kind of happens that it is not only mine. Well, changes nothing to how I feel right now. This is literally a dream coming true.

Let's talk money! Without mentioning the amount of work and time that it took (which I just did), so far we have payed for the recording of all instruments, the mixing of all tracks and the mastering of the entire set (53 min 22 sec).

Money and figures and stuff...

Basically, we still have to pay for the SDRM declaration (800 euros) which we need in order to certify that the music belongs to us (French procedures, don't ask). Then, we need 1200 euros in order to replicate 1,000 copies of our CD, which we need for trying to promote our music to labels, venues and radio stations, as well as having something to distribute at concerts.

Speaking plainly, we can use all the funds we can get. If we receive more than the 2,000 euros limit we have set, there is still the artwork of the album to get into account (300 euros) as well as the printing of posters, and acquiring T-shirts and sweatshirts with the hope of covering what fans expect us to provide when we "tour".
In case we wouldn't reach the 2,000 euros limit, well, same logic. We can use all we can get.

Outro (we love you)

Of course, you understood what we needed and why we needed it. There is only one point that I would like to make clear: we would be eternally grateful if you helped us realize this dream! If for some reason some of us are already being eternally grateful to you, please don't take that as a setback. Also, there are thresholds with "gifts".

Also, money is not the only way to help us and we are deeply aware of that. So if you happen to know a friend, or the friend of a friend that is likely to enjoy our music and that you talk to them, well, you would get our gratitude just as well. Also works for Facebook publication and tweeting about us.

Thank you for reading all of it and indulging my English and the puns I couldn't repress. Thank you also for your support and your interest! This means a lot to us.

Jean-Loup for PYRAH

____________________________________________________________________

Nous, notre rêve, etc...

Nous sommes un petit groupe de Strasbourg qui a commencé l'année dernière et en un an, nous avons mis toute notre énergie dans ce projet. Chaque membre du groupe a des influences différentes, mais la caractéristique que nous partageons tous est que nous voulons que la musique soit notre vie.

Pour ma part, je n'aurais jamais osé imaginer me tenir un jour à ce point précis, si proche de sortir un album qui serait le mien ! Bon, il se trouve que ce n'est pas complètement le mien, ça ne change rien à ce que je ressens en ce moment. C'est un rêve en passe de devenir réalité.

Parlons d'argent ! Sans parler de la quantité de travail et de temps que ça a demandé (ce que je viens de faire), pour l'instant nous avons payé l'enregistrement de tous les instruments, le mixage des pistes et le mastering de l'ensemble (53 min 22 sec).

De l'argent, des nombres et tout ça

En gros, il nous reste à payer la déclaration SDRM (800 euros) dont nous avons vesoin pour certifier que c'est bien notre musique qu'on fait presser. Ensuite, il nous restera 1200 euros de frais pour le pressage de 1.000 CD dont nous avons besoin pour démarcher des labels, des salles de concert et des radios et aussi pour avoir quelque chose à distribuer aux concerts.

Pour parler franchement, nous aurons l'usage de tout l'argent qu'on peut récolter. Si nous recevons plus que les 2.000 euros que nous avons fixé comme limite, il reste le graphisme de l'album à payer (300 euros), ainsi que l'impression de posters, la fabrication de T-shirts et sweats (personne ne sait tricoter chez nous) dans l'espoir de répondre à ce que nos fans attendent que nous fournissions après un spectacle.
Si nous ne devions pas atteindre la limite, nous restons dans la même logique. Toute aide est bonne à prendre.

Outro (on vous aime)

Bien sûr, vous avez comrpis ce dont nous avons besoin et pourquoi. Il y a juste une chose que je voudrais clarifier : nous serions éternellement reconnaissants si vous nous aidez à réaliser notre rêve ! Si pour une raison ou une autre, certains d'entre nous sommes déjà éternellement reconnaissants envers vous, j'espère que ça ne vous gênera pas. Aussi, il y a des paliers avec les lots.

De plus, l'argent n'est pas la seule manière dont vous pouvez nous aider et nous le savons très bien. Donc s'il se trouve que vous avez un ami qui a un ami qui est susceptible d'apprécier ce qu'on fait et que vous leur parlez de nous, nous serions tout aussi éternellement reconnaissants. Cela marche aussi pour les publications sur Facebook ou Twitter.
Merci d'avoir lu tout ça et de me pardonner les blagues que je n'ai pas pu réprimer. Merci de votre soutien et de votre intérêt ! Cela nous touche beaucoup.

Jean-Loup pour PYRAH

story:
BIOGRAPHY:

 

Nubian born "Brittany Chatmon-Lester",started singing at about the age of seven in the children’s gospel choir at her grandmother’s church. She grew up in Buffalo, New York and is the eldest of four children. At the age of twelve Nubian traveled to various places within the United States with her mother and three siblings; it was around this time when Nubian discovered her enthusiasm for performing, using her family and friends as an audience. By the age of fifteen her hidden talent began to shine through "Hip-Hop". In 2003 Nubian returned to her hometown of Buffalo where she started "Lyrical Disciplez Entertainment”. Nubian’s music covers a plethora of topics from: struggle and pain, to life and love. Her soulful voice and deep lyrics are very relatable, and will touch every individual no matter their background. Using her music as a platform to tell her story, she describes her life growing up as rough. Through adolescence and into early adulthood Nubian was affected by the rough streets of Buffalo, having been stabbed on one occasion, beat with a bat on another, and pistol whipped and robbed at gunpoint. In addition to the violence that plagued this young’s rapstress life, she battled poverty and homelessness, as well as the loss of her musical mentor: her grandmother. After working many collection jobs Nubian decided she had had enough. Stepping out on faith, Nubian quit her job to pursue her musical career full time. Nubian struggled to hold down a stable place of residence, while juggling performing at out of town shows. Throwing all of her finances into funding her dream, Nubian continues to open up for many rap Artists including: Cory Gunz, Maino, Roscoe Dash, Cassidy, Papoose and Red Cafe. With her love of God and strong belief in her dreams she will keep striving until she grabs hold to that shining star. 

 

This Campaign I am starting called "New Year for Nubian" is basically to take my career to the next level.  I have had my failures as well as accomplishments. I am a very driven person. When one or two doors close, I will bust through the next door. I come from the rough streets of Buffalo,New York(which is the 10th dangerous place in the USA). I don't want to become another statistic. I want to show people that dreams can come true. I want to also give back once I am in a better financial position by making music programs for the youth as an outlet. I believe there is so much violence in my city because the youth don't feel like anyone cares for them and they need positive people around to show them the way. My great grandmother was my musical mentor. She was big on peace and she is the reason I am musically inclined. She passed from cancer. I also want to start a "Cure for Cancer" foundation. My ideas are endless. I need funding to execute these ideas into action. 

    

I  am  working with a major Industry artist on a feature/video.I need funding to make this possible. I have to pay for online promotion,video promotion, & radio promotion.I have to pay a graphic artist to design my own personal website,flyers,cd cover, etc. i also will be touring this summer. i know how to budget and I also have an accountant working with me to assure that all funds from this campaign are spent wisely to further my career. 

Photography by. Joed Viera

http://www.joedviera.com

 

I RISK MY LIFE EVERYDAY BY BEING BRAVE ENOUGH TO GET IN THE STREETS AND INTRODUCE MYSELF TO EVERYONE THAT PASSES, I TAKE A RISK BY NOT HAVING A 9 TO 5 & BELIEVING IN MYSELF TO KNOW THAT I AM DESTINED FOR GREATNESS. THE CHALLENGING THING HERE IS CONVINCING SOMEONE TO BELIEVE IN ME LIKE I DO IN MYSELF!! I AM A SURVIVOR AND I CAN GET THROUGH ANYTHING. I REALLY NEED SUPPORT, BUT IF I HAPPEN TO NOT RAISE WHAT I NEED HERE, I WILL CONTINUE TO GRIND HARD.

PLEASE  HELP BY SPREADING THE WORD ABOUT NUBIAN.PLEASE SHARE NEW SINGLE/VIDEO "FACEBOOK HOE" ON YOUR SOCIAL NETWORKS TO ALL YOUR FRIENDS. IT IS VERY HARD FOR ARTISTS ESPECIALLY, FEMALES.NUBIAN IS THE NEW EPIDEMIC.

Her soulful voice and deep lyrics are very relatable, and will touch every individual no matter their background. Using her music as a platform to tell her story, she describes her life growing up as rough. Through adolescence and into early adulthood Nubian was affected by the rough streets of Buffalo, having been stabbed on one occasion, beat with a bat on another, and pistol whipped and robbed at gunpoint. In addition to the violence that plagued this young’s rapstress life, she battled poverty and homelessness, as well as the loss of her musical mentor: her grandmother. After working many collection jobs Nubian decided she had had enough. Stepping out on faith, Nubian quit her job to pursue her musical career full time. Nubian struggled to hold down a stable place of residence, while juggling performing at out of town shows. Throwing all of her finances into funding her dream, Nubian continues to open up for many rap Artists including: Cory Gunz, Maino, Roscoe Dash, Cassidy, Papoose and Red Cafe. With her love of God and strong belief in her dreams she will keep striving until she grabs hold to that shining star. 
 
This Campaign I am starting called "New Year for Nubian" is basically to take my career to the next level.  I have had my failures as well as accomplishments. I am a very driven person. When one or two doors close, I will bust through the next door. I come from the rough streets of Buffalo,New York(which is the 10th dangerous place in the USA). I don't want to become another statistic. I want to show people that dreams can come true. I want to also give back once I am in a better financial position by making music programs for the youth as an outlet. I believe there is so much violence in my city because the youth don't feel like anyone cares for them and they need positive people around to show them the way. My great grandmother was my musical mentor. She was big on peace and she is the reason I am musically inclined. She passed from cancer. I also want to start a "Cure for Cancer" foundation. My ideas are endless. I need funding to execute these ideas into action. 
    
I  am  working with a major Industry artist on a feature/video.I need funding to make this possible. I have to pay for online promotion,video promotion, & radio promotion.I have to pay a graphic artist to design my own personal website,flyers,cd cover, etc. i also will be touring this summer. i know how to budget and I also have an accountant working with me to assure that all funds from this campaign are spent wisely to further my career. 


Photography by. Joed Viera
http://www.joedviera.com


 
I RISK MY LIFE EVERYDAY BY BEING BRAVE ENOUGH TO GET IN THE STREETS AND INTRODUCE MYSELF TO EVERYONE THAT PASSES, I TAKE A RISK BY NOT HAVING A 9 TO 5 & BELIEVING IN MYSELF TO KNOW THAT I AM DESTINED FOR GREATNESS. THE CHALLENGING THING HERE IS CONVINCING SOMEONE TO BELIEVE IN ME LIKE I DO IN MYSELF!! I AM A SURVIVOR AND I CAN GET THROUGH ANYTHING. I REALLY NEED SUPPORT, BUT IF I HAPPEN TO NOT RAISE WHAT I NEED HERE, I WILL CONTINUE TO GRIND HARD.


PLEASE  HELP BY SPREADING THE WORD ABOUT NUBIAN.PLEASE SHARE NEW SINGLE/VIDEO "FACEBOOK HOE" ON YOUR SOCIAL NETWORKS TO ALL YOUR FRIENDS. IT IS VERY HARD FOR ARTISTS ESPECIALLY, FEMALES.NUBIAN IS THE NEW EPIDEMIC.

story:
My 'funsized' Story

Hey Everyone,

 

My name is Brenna Rhea. I am an actress and a model with a vivid imagination and a knack for dipping my hands into all things creative. I recently recorded and released my first single, '13 Knots', on January 16, 2012 along with its music video debut at the Mint. After its premerie and the release of my single I found myself with a great amount of people who couldn't wait to hear and see what was next... Well folks, this is it!

 

As a reader, writer, blogger, and now songwriter I have officially come up with a song, storyboard, and concept for my next music video.

 

My last song and video was a story about a young girl in the 1800s who witnesses a muder and because of it gets hung on false accusations. The song itself is a haunting peice with lyrics, that if listened to closely, will tell a story all by itself. The video, directed by, JFRobinson, is a sad tale spun with great cinematography that competely encompases the viewer into the life of this young girl. Through my vision, JFRobinson, completed a music video that only added to the eerie yet sad story of '13 Knots'.

 

So to follow in the footsteps of my last video, I decided to do another period peice. This time the music video will be set back in the days of the 1940s when Mobsters ran the town and love was just as romantic as the guns that wielded it. With a storyline that mirrors that of 'Public Enemies' with the romantic gestures of 'True Romance' you will be taken on a completely black and white adventure with a girl in love with a Mobster Boss and her entanglement in the life of his choices.

 

The Song is labeled 'Bullets'.


The Impact of The Bullet

My goal is to bring back music videos that actually tell stories and have meaning. No more booty bouncing, booby jiggiling, sexual inunendo nonsense. Although interesting and entertaining in its own way, my goal is to bring people not only music that opens up lives of various individuals but allows the viewer of the video to feel as though they were a part of something, much like a short film. Within the realm of 3 to 4 minutes I want to accomplish a story that takes your breath away, gives you chills, and makes you think. Much like my last video, the comments and reviews seemed to deem my vision worthy of such emotion. I want to bring my voice, compared to Marilyn mixed with Nancy Sinatra, to the table of a new era of music only the 'post apocalyptic' world of 2012 could handle.

 

My goal, according to the budget plan, is to raise around 9,000.00. The last video I did was around 3,000.00 which was all raised through fans, family, friends and out of pocket expenses. And for that amount of money, I think it looks pretty good. But now I'm ready to take the bull by the horns, get some real equipment and shoot out a great video that will truly be an inspiration for music artists to come.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The money donated will be distrubted to all aspects of the making of the film listed below:

 

Equipment: Lighting, Cameras, Lens, etc.

Props: Guns, period peices, interior desgins, etc.

Costumes: 1940s Outfits, Zoot Suits, Female Mobster Wear etc.

Crew: I want to pay the crew this time around

Cast: I want to pay the cast this around.

 

The goal is 9,000.00

If the goal is not met I will still go on with the filming but that means not getting to pay the amazing people that I work with. And everyone knows what its like to work for free, although a great experience, its good to get rewarded for hard work and time spent.

 

So What do you get for donating?

Well heres the dreakdown:

 

10.00 - Copy Of Both Songs, '13 Knots' & 'Bullets'

50.00 - Copy of Both Songs, '13 Knots' & 'Bullets', a signed picture, and a 'Special Thanks To' Credit

100.00 - Copy of Both Songs, '13 Knots' & 'Bullets', a signed picture, and a 'Co-Producer' Credit

500.00 - Copy of Both Songs, '13 Knots' & 'Bullets', a signed picture, and a 'Co-Producer' Credit and free entry to the premiere of the video screening.

1,000.00 - Copy of Both Songs, '13 Knots' & 'Bullets', a signed picture, a PRODUCER Credit,  free entry to the premiere of the video screening and if available, on set seat/viewing to the filming of 'Bullets' 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Its a recession, so I know money is hard to come by during this time, so if you don't have the funds to donate at this time you can simply halp spread the word about the funding! Post it, Share it, Tweet it, Talk about it!

 

It always helps to have people click these links as well!

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mBqO8pk_go4 <-- My Last Music Video

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4317779/ <--- My IMDb

https://www.facebook.com/#!/pages/Brenna-Rhea/121908804583112 <-- My Facebook Page

 

Thanks for taking time to read this and your support! I really do admire all the people that get together to create great works of art and hopefully one day I can be thrown into that prestigious pile!

 

Much Love My Friends,

Carpe Diem!

 

~ Brenna Rhea

story:
The $1 Campaign

A startling, yet simple idea to enable independent recording artist Homemadesoul to create and release music for years to come.

Homemadesoul, a Philadelphia native was born into a musical family.  His musical rawness was developed while singing in church with his brother and sister, alongside his father.  After finishing grade school and a failed attempt at studying architecture in college, he enlisted in the Air Force.  It is there where he discovered his true passion for creating music.

All an artist wants is for his or her music to be heard.  Homemadesoul is no different.  Which is why Homemadesoul is willing to offer a lifetime digital supply of his music to those who donate just $1.

This may sound crazy.  You may think, this guy is degrading music.  But when you think of the very importance that music has in our daily lives, you will find that music is actually priceless!  Homemadesoul does not NEED to get rich from his music sales.  He doesn't even NEED to break even on his work of putting out great music.  Homemadesoul just NEEDS your ears.

What We Need & What You Get

You give $1

You get a lifetime digital supply of Homemadesoul music, which includes future singles, albums, EP's, and freebies.

Once you donate, you will be included on that special list, that will recieve ALL future releases from Homemadesoul.  No gimmicks, hidden deals, no small print.  REAL SIMPLE!

The goal is to raise $10,000 from 10,000 supporters.  This amount will be enough to pay for the mixing and mastering of the actual singles, or albums that will be released.  It will also pay for minimal promotion, cd manufacturing when needed, and to pay session musicians when needed.

If we have 10,000 supporters, that will be 10,000 people who will recieve new music the instant it is released.  You would be recieving an email with a download link from the Homemadesoul servers.


If we don't raise the $10,000, we will take the funds that are raised, and continue on with the dream of simply creating and sharing music to all who will listen.  The $10,000 is just a goal to cover only expenses.  If only $500 is raised, then only 500 people will be on that special lifetime list.

The Impact

This campaign draws attention to the real value of music.  The only reason why music today is valued so high is because there is a whole industry who depends on the profits made from music.  It is almost impossible for any industry artist, producer, executive, to offer great music for virtually free personal use, because their lives depend on the money made.  Homemadesoul does not have this need.  He is in the unique position to share his musical gift with the world without fear of going broke, or not being able to take care of his family.  So with this gift of musical and economic freedom, Homemadesoul offers his gift, for a lifetime, for a small donation.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute, it's okay!  Remember, it's not all about the money anyway.  Maybe you would like to share your talents as well.


If your a songwriter, let's collab! 

If your a producer, let's work!

If your a musician, let's create!

Homemadesoul also pays out mechanical royalties for collaborators who agree. And there is also the PRO royalties (ASCAP, BMI, SESAC) that come if any release is played on internet or radio.  All releases are released to all major online retailers and all sales are tracked and recorded.

WHAT'S NEEDED

Public Relations specialist, biography writers, bloggers, journalists, DJ'S


If your just a supporter of great music, and still can't pay, but you have no musical gift to share, just spread the word!

There is room for any and everybody in this campaign!

story:
EPIC FUEL CAMPAIGN TO SUPPORT THE SECOND ALBUM RELEASE

Epic Fuel is a metal band from Amsterdam. We're four friends that have been making music together for over ten years.

Two years ago we released our first full length album for free on bandcamp. It cost us about $1500 in total. We spent two years writing and recording it, and we wanted to get it out to as many people as possible. We also released it as a torrent, and the album has now been downloaded for free over 50,000 times.

Now, after another two years of writing and recording, we have finished our second album consisting of 12 tracks. We would obviously like to release this album as soon as possible, with at least the same high quality of sound as the first album.

This is where the campaign comes in:

We made a conscious decision to release our first album for free, after investing a lot of our own savings into it, so we could get it out to as many people as possible at the highest possible sound quality.

We would like to do the same thing again, however, we cannot afford the final stage of the production process: Mastering, which has to be done by a studio with very expensive equipment, so it costs quite a bit of money if you want it to be done right.

Although we're still very proud of the first album, we promise that the new album is going to blow the first one away! It's definitely heavier, faster, more technical, and more melodic. We put a lot of blood, sweat and tears into the making of it and we cannot wait to share it with the world!

Help us release our new album! Any amount helps!

 

As we are operating totally independently as a band, we don't have any record label or such helping us out financially when it comes to the costs of recording and all that goes with it. 
With that said, if you enjoy our music and would like to hear more from us in the future, we would be very grateful if you would like to make a donation!

story:
About the Campaign

My name is Tori Hoffman and Stephanie Knopp is my little sister. It is on my heart to share the struggles that Stephanie and her family face in hopes of surrounding her and her family with all of the love and support that they can get during this difficult time. Their story follows but first let me say that Stephanie and Todd did not ask for this help. In fact, when the idea to start a small campaign first surfaced they were opposed. As days have past and the future weeks look uncertain, they have agreed that they will need help. The greatest need at this time is prayer. That is followed by encouragement and finally financial and resource support.

Thank you for helping me love on my sister and her family.

-Tori

Baby Layla's Story

Hi! 

Our names our Todd and Stephanie Knopp and we are the proud parents of two amazing little girls. Our eldest daughter is named McKenna and she is almost 2, who, up until now has been our biggest priority and biggest joy in our lives! I say up until now, because she just recently (on January 7, 2014) had a little sister enter the world, and due to the complications of her sisters health has had to quickly learn that mommy and daddies attention would be split between the two of them.

Layla Rose Knopp is already a miracle in our eyes - born 4 weeks before her due date, she proved many people wrong by making it far past the 25 weeks we were told we would have to deliver her by.

At 18 weeks pregnant, Stephanie went in for her routine ultrasound (in our eyes really just to find out our babies gender), and were told we would have to return in a couple of weeks because they weren't able to see everything that they needed. We took it as a fluke and simply another opportunity to see our baby! When we returned at 20 weeks pregnant, much to our surprise they were still unable to see what they needed to and later were told that the amniotic fluid around our baby was low and that we would need to see Maternal Fetal Medicine (MFM) for a more detailed ultrasound to determine cause/treatment.

At 22 weeks pregnant, we went in for our first (soon to be MANY, MANY, MANY) appointments with MFM. It was confirmed at this point that yes, the amniotic fluid was low and we met with a perinatologist who explained to us the complications that could occur because of this. He also informed us that between the babies 18 week ultrasound and 22nd that they hadn't seen any growth and he was concerned that the two things could mean several complications (growth restriction, organ abnormalities (heart, kidney issues), and/or a genetic disorder such as Down's syndrome. We also were told that our baby was a little girl, but obviously at this point in the conversation, we realized that the gender was really the last thing for us to be concerned with.

At our next appointment her fluids had dropped into the danger zone, and her growth proved that she was not gaining anything, and she was diagnosed with Oligohydramnios (low fluids) and IUGR (intra-uterine growth restriction), and we were told to prepare that at week 25 we would be in the hospital and probably delivering her soon after. Thankfully at her 25 week appointment we saw a slight increase of growth and fluids so we were able to stay out of the hospital for another week.

Fast forward several weeks (mainly because as many appointments as we had this could be a novel) and we had been having weekly ultrasounds and bi-weekly NST's to measure fluid levels, growth, and her placenta's Doppler flow, as well as to check to make sure she was not going into stress. During this time, it was an ever going roller coaster with one week fluids up and one week fluids down, several times her diagnosis of low fluids had even been removed , however the growth restriction was still a problem. 

For the 3 weeks leading up to her induction, everything had been looking great! Fluids were relatively normal, and her size was in the 10th percentile (just at the tip of not being growth restricted), we really started to believe at this point that we could have a baby with NO ISSUES and us, as well as our family started to believe that maybe the doctors had been being over cautious about the circumstances.

At Stephanie's 36 week check up,  Layla's growth had shot through the roof! She was now in the 25th percentile, and no longer IUGR! Unfortunately, her fluid went from 12.8 to 2 and Stephanie was told she would be induced that day. Reluctantly, we took their advice, still thinking that this was all for nothing and she would be a perfectly healthy little girl!

Stephanie's induction started on Monday evening and Layla was born on Tuesday night at 10:41pm! She was 5 lb. and 6.5 oz and definitely NOT IUGR! She was placed immediately on Stephanie's chest however immediately removed because she was having issues breathing. They informed us she would be taken to NICU (Neo-natal intensive care unit) and Todd followed the nurses as they took her.

Well that leads us to today. Layla has been in the NICU now for 6 days. During this stay we have learned that being premature really has nothing to do with Layla's issues, but because of the low fluids she encountered during the pregnancy, her lungs were not able to develop, causing them to be functioning at the capacity of a MUCH younger baby. She has been keeping the nurses on their toes daily and as they jokingly say "taking advantage of all their equipment". She has been slowly but surely doing better and we are thanking God daily for this! We still have no clue as to how long she will be in the NICU, but the doctors tell us their estimate is anywhere from a few more weeks to a couple of months (obviously rare for a 36 week old baby).

With all the amazing blessings we have been receiving in the form of love, encouragement and financial support, it is really no wonder we are making it through this very difficult time! 

When we were approached about this fundraising campaign, our first instinct was to say "NO!", it was a little pride, but also because we felt so blessed, it seemed selfish to ask for help, but after a lot of prayer, some humbling time looking over the financial obligations, a few more nudges from our family to do it, we decided to humbly accept whatever blessings people in our lives were willing to offer.

We want to take time to recognize the love and support from everyone we have received and thank you all for all that you do! It truly has been overwhelming the love we are getting and it, along with trusting God is our biggest factor in getting through this time! 

We love you all and are so thankful you are here in this journey with us because we could not do it alone!

Love,

-Todd, Stephanie, McKenna, and Baby Layla

So how can you help?

1)Prayer. We believe that prayer has the greatest ability to positively change the course of direction for Layla and can help to sustain us emotionally and spiritually through this time. It is our belief that God answers the prayers of those who earnestly seek Him.

2)Encouragement. We have set up a Facebook page for Layla and Stephanie and Todd love to read your comments of support and love. Please keep them coming!

3)Meals/Childcare. If you are local, they can always use a little help with some grocery/meal help when they return from long days of errands, especially after eating hospital food as much as they are. Also, they have leaned heavily on family and church family to help take care of McKenna while at the hospital visiting Layla. Any time you can offer care for her at this time would be appreciated.

4)Financial. As mentioned earlier, we are not certain how long Layla will be in the NICU nor do we know how long she will need extra help once she returns home. We are so thankful that medical bills are being covered through insurance plans! It is estimated that a week in the NICU can cost well over 100k a week!  However, there are other areas that have the potential to create severe financial stress on the Knopp family. These include:

Gas and travel expenses

Uncovered medical expenses

Loss of income expenses (Todd is required to take unpaid leave during this time)

Daycare expenses (if needed)

Meal expenses while traveling

Unknown expenses caring for a premature baby

Finally, the Knopp’s have family and friends that span the globe. Please share Layla’s story with them. The more people we have praying for Layla, the better.

Let’s bring Layla home - healthy, safely and soon!
story_txt:
About the Campaign
My name is Tori Hoffman and Stephanie Knopp is my little sister. It is on my heart to share the struggles that Stephanie and her family face in hopes of surrounding her and her family with all of the love and support that they can get during this difficult time. Their story follows but first let me say that Stephanie and Todd did not ask for this help. In fact, when the idea to start a small campaign first surfaced they were opposed. As days have past and the future weeks look uncertain, they have agreed that they will need help. The greatest need at this time is prayer. That is followed by encouragement and finally financial and resource support.

Thank you for helping me love on my sister and her family.

-Tori


Baby Layla's Story

Hi! 

Our names our Todd and Stephanie Knopp and we are the proud parents of two amazing little girls. Our eldest daughter is named McKenna and she is almost 2, who, up until now has been our biggest priority and biggest joy in our lives! I say up until now, because she just recently (on January 7, 2014) had a little sister enter the world, and due to the complications of her sisters health has had to quickly learn that mommy and daddies attention would be split between the two of them.

Layla Rose Knopp is already a miracle in our eyes - born 4 weeks before her due date, she proved many people wrong by making it far past the 25 weeks we were told we would have to deliver her by.

At 18 weeks pregnant, Stephanie went in for her routine ultrasound (in our eyes really just to find out our babies gender), and were told we would have to return in a couple of weeks because they weren't able to see everything that they needed. We took it as a fluke and simply another opportunity to see our baby! When we returned at 20 weeks pregnant, much to our surprise they were still unable to see what they needed to and later were told that the amniotic fluid around our baby was low and that we would need to see Maternal Fetal Medicine (MFM) for a more detailed ultrasound to determine cause/treatment.

At 22 weeks pregnant, we went in for our first (soon to be MANY, MANY, MANY) appointments with MFM. It was confirmed at this point that yes, the amniotic fluid was low and we met with a perinatologist who explained to us the complications that could occur because of this. He also informed us that between the babies 18 week ultrasound and 22nd that they hadn't seen any growth and he was concerned that the two things could mean several complications (growth restriction, organ abnormalities (heart, kidney issues), and/or a genetic disorder such as Down's syndrome. We also were told that our baby was a little girl, but obviously at this point in the conversation, we realized that the gender was really the last thing for us to be concerned with.

At our next appointment her fluids had dropped into the danger zone, and her growth proved that she was not gaining anything, and she was diagnosed with Oligohydramnios (low fluids) and IUGR (intra-uterine growth restriction), and we were told to prepare that at week 25 we would be in the hospital and probably delivering her soon after. Thankfully at her 25 week appointment we saw a slight increase of growth and fluids so we were able to stay out of the hospital for another week.

Fast forward several weeks (mainly because as many appointments as we had this could be a novel) and we had been having weekly ultrasounds and bi-weekly NST's to measure fluid levels, growth, and her placenta's Doppler flow, as well as to check to make sure she was not going into stress. During this time, it was an ever going roller coaster with one week fluids up and one week fluids down, several times her diagnosis of low fluids had even been removed , however the growth restriction was still a problem. 

For the 3 weeks leading up to her induction, everything had been looking great! Fluids were relatively normal, and her size was in the 10th percentile (just at the tip of not being growth restricted), we really started to believe at this point that we could have a baby with NO ISSUES and us, as well as our family started to believe that maybe the doctors had been being over cautious about the circumstances.

At Stephanie's 36 week check up,  Layla's growth had shot through the roof! She was now in the 25th percentile, and no longer IUGR! Unfortunately, her fluid went from 12.8 to 2 and Stephanie was told she would be induced that day. Reluctantly, we took their advice, still thinking that this was all for nothing and she would be a perfectly healthy little girl!

Stephanie's induction started on Monday evening and Layla was born on Tuesday night at 10:41pm! She was 5 lb. and 6.5 oz and definitely NOT IUGR! She was placed immediately on Stephanie's chest however immediately removed because she was having issues breathing. They informed us she would be taken to NICU (Neo-natal intensive care unit) and Todd followed the nurses as they took her.

Well that leads us to today. Layla has been in the NICU now for 6 days. During this stay we have learned that being premature really has nothing to do with Layla's issues, but because of the low fluids she encountered during the pregnancy, her lungs were not able to develop, causing them to be functioning at the capacity of a MUCH younger baby. She has been keeping the nurses on their toes daily and as they jokingly say "taking advantage of all their equipment". She has been slowly but surely doing better and we are thanking God daily for this! We still have no clue as to how long she will be in the NICU, but the doctors tell us their estimate is anywhere from a few more weeks to a couple of months (obviously rare for a 36 week old baby).

With all the amazing blessings we have been receiving in the form of love, encouragement and financial support, it is really no wonder we are making it through this very difficult time! 

When we were approached about this fundraising campaign, our first instinct was to say "NO!", it was a little pride, but also because we felt so blessed, it seemed selfish to ask for help, but after a lot of prayer, some humbling time looking over the financial obligations, a few more nudges from our family to do it, we decided to humbly accept whatever blessings people in our lives were willing to offer.

We want to take time to recognize the love and support from everyone we have received and thank you all for all that you do! It truly has been overwhelming the love we are getting and it, along with trusting God is our biggest factor in getting through this time! 

We love you all and are so thankful you are here in this journey with us because we could not do it alone!

Love,

-Todd, Stephanie, McKenna, and Baby Layla


















So how can you help?

1)Prayer. We believe that prayer has the greatest ability to positively change the course of direction for Layla and can help to sustain us emotionally and spiritually through this time. It is our belief that God answers the prayers of those who earnestly seek Him.

2)Encouragement. We have set up a Facebook page for Layla and Stephanie and Todd love to read your comments of support and love. Please keep them coming!

3)Meals/Childcare. If you are local, they can always use a little help with some grocery/meal help when they return from long days of errands, especially after eating hospital food as much as they are. Also, they have leaned heavily on family and church family to help take care of McKenna while at the hospital visiting Layla. Any time you can offer care for her at this time would be appreciated.

4)Financial. As mentioned earlier, we are not certain how long Layla will be in the NICU nor do we know how long she will need extra help once she returns home. We are so thankful that medical bills are being covered through insurance plans! It is estimated that a week in the NICU can cost well over 100k a week!  However, there are other areas that have the potential to create severe financial stress on the Knopp family. These include:

Gas and travel expenses
Uncovered medical expenses
Loss of income expenses (Todd is required to take unpaid leave during this time)
Daycare expenses (if needed)
Meal expenses while traveling
Unknown expenses caring for a premature baby




Finally, the Knopp’s have family and friends that span the globe. Please share Layla’s story with them. The more people we have praying for Layla, the better.

Let’s bring Layla home - healthy, safely and soon!

story:
Visit: http://www.mysticalvoicescd.com

for the latest information

Update . . . 
WE DID IT ! ! !  100% FUNDED ! ! ! 

There is still time to reserve you advance copy and join our community of supporters. 

"The beauty of the playing together is meeting in the one. 

The work comes from neither one artist nor the other, even though our own idiosyncrasies and styles, the symptoms of our original natures, still exert their natural pull. Nor does the work come from a compromise or halfway point (averages are always boring!), but from a third place that isn't necessarily like what either of us would do individually. What comes is a revelation to both of us . . . in collaborating with others we round up, as in relationship, an enlarged self, a more versatile creativity ."

I look forward to meeting you in the place of the one on this project and our continued work together. 

Best,

Michael 

Recording Sessions start this Monday. 

Auditions complete . . . Singers selected.

Soprano - 
Laurel Christensen, Karen Lee, Alicia Willson-Metzger, Annamarie Smith-Butz, Karla Robinson, Olivia I. Rominiyi
Alto - 
Amy Ross, Mary Letson, Martha Springstead,  Shannon Ponack, Linda Darden Boles, Debbie Garrick, Kamil Inmon
Tenor - 
Darrell Wood, Ajee Church, Kerry Jennings, Chris Burnette
Bass - 
Anthony C Marcano, Paul Springstead Patrick Garrison, Adam Piper, David Springstead Sr., Tyler Turner

Check out some of the music that will be included in this project . . . 

  • Christina Rossetti
  • William Shakespeare
  • John Donne
  • St. Francis (attr.)
  • The book of Psalms
  • The Song of Solomon
  • Rabindranath Tagore

         

  • My name is Michael John Trotta, I am a composer, condutor, and teacher living in Virginia Beach. Over the past 10 years, I have worked with hundreds of groups, and thousands of singers making passionate performances of choral music. 
  • However, it's the stories of the transformative experiences that performers and audiences themselves have experienced that move me most deeply and inspire me to take this next step as we make this a feature length, professional CD of my music available to people worldwide. 
  •  sensitive, emotive composition with roots firmly planted in history, yet presenting a new unique expression
  • your music has a way of transporting people to another time and place
  • thank you for making the world a better place with your creativity
  • beautifully crafted
  • a mezmorizing, fittingly peaceful opening theme that engenders peace and hope
  • an imaginative variety of vocal textures
  • a rare combination of honesty melodic content and crafted counterpoint, interesting yet approachable

Your participation in this project will directly support the careers of over 100 people who are assembling to make this project a reality. In addition, there are production costs of recording and duplication. The many facets of such a project can be divided into three broad categories:

  1. Performers: Singers, Instrumentalist
  2. Production: Recording Engineer, Location Rentals, Music Copying/Purchase
  3. Post-Production: Mechanical Rights, Licenses, Duplication, Design

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Post this to Facebook
  • Tweet about it
  • Email to family and friends
  • Consider auditioning for a spot in the choir

Thank You ! ! !

story:
ABOUT "THE CROSSING"

We are Cantrip. Known for our innovative arrangements, un-produced sound and live energy, we have already been lucky enough to bring our music to many exciting places across the globe. For nearly a decade and a half we have been performing our own brand of traditional music across multiple continents. Inevitably, we have gone through a number of transitional periods. We are now an intercontinental band, spread across the ocean by family necessity. But the direction of our music has only brought us closer together as a unit, and for the first time in five years we are putting together an album of new material. This album will be titled "The Crossing", and we are giddy with excitement. It will be a collection of songs and tunes, original and traditional. We are including a large number of our own compositions, as well as nods to some of our favorite artists of today. Every piece of music we have included in this project we feel is our own. We're ready to share them with you.

WE NEED YOUR HELP

In order to make this project a reality, we need to raise funds. The unfortunate truth is that we are all professional musicians with families living an ocean apart. As of now, it takes all the resources we can muster just to get the three of us in the same room. We can't find the money to release an album without some sort of help. Luckily in today's world, there are avenues of fundraising that haven't existed before, and with your help we can make this album exist.

It costs a lot to make an album these days. Some of the projected expenses for this project include:

• Studio time for recording and mixing

• Mastering

• Artwork/Graphic Design

• Reproduction

• Promotion

• Artist royalties

We're asking for $5,000. We feel this amount will get us to the finish line. However, if your generosity exceeds this figure it will be that much easier for us to share our music with more people, as well as presenting the best possible product. We are not the type of band that would belabor our time in the studio. This will be a very live project, much like our performances. But we want to capture and present this in the best way we possibly can. This means enlisting the help of high level professionals. We are working with Mill Pond Music Studio in Portsmouth, NH for recording and mixing. Our mastering will be done in Scotland by the engineer for our past two studio albums. We are working with an artist and a graphic designer for the cover and booklet. Disc Makers is one of the leading CD reproduction companies, and we will be enlisting their services. And of course, we want to make sure the composers of the music we perform get the bread they are due. 

Most albums cost anywhere between $8,000 and $30,000 to make. We believe that with smart preparation and execution we can release a high quality project for less, but there is always more that can be done and there is always more money that can be spent. Whatever we receive will be put to good use, you can be assured. 

For your extremely gracious support, we would like to do what we can to give back to you. You may think of contributing to this campaign as a means of pre-ordering "The Crossing" or as something more. No matter what, our gratitude runs deep and we will personally thank you for it. By contributing here, you will receive "The Crossing" before it is released to the public. We want you to hear it first, so you may know where your money has gone. Your money will be going to support our creative endeavors, and the more you give, the more we can give to you. You could have tunes written for you or receive Skype lessons/interviews. You could even garner an invite to a secret release show in Massachusetts, where we will perform material new and old as well as enlisting the help of a number of musical friends. We expect this will be an evening full of spontaneity and warmth, and should kick off this project in style. We hope you will consider supporting us in this endeavor, and we look forward to sharing with you!

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

We know not everyone has money to give, but you can still be a part of this process! You can help us get the support we need by spreading the word, and by sharing this page on social media and anywhere else that is appropriate. This makes a difference, and we thank you for it.


** Two artists that deserve recognition already are Amanda Kowalski (http://www.amandakowalskiphoto.com) and Bruce Petschek (http://sevengenerationsvideo.com) for their photography and video work respectively. Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Hard at work horrifying the masses since 2005, Grave Robber have been anything but idle.  Combining bouncy, catchy percussion with riffs and guitar solos as sharp as Dracula’s fangs, Grave Robber’s rugged and raunchy releases – “Be Afraid”, “Inner Sanctum”, Exhumed”, and “You’re All Gonna Die” – have garnered these horror rockers well deserved press from acclaimed punk and metal outlets alike for a good reason.  Each song by these prolific punks creates an immersive and haunting atmosphere that has listeners so engaged that they are constantly glancing over their shoulders wondering if Grave Robber is coming for them next.

What's next is a 7" viny e.p. WITH a download card!  As always we desire to put our BEST foot forward and give our fans a high quality product!  We asked you, our fans what you wanted and overwhelmingly you responded :"VINYL!!!"  Well, that is exactly what we are going to give you!

THIS WILL ONLY HAPPEN IF YOU MAKE IT HAPPEN!

Funding will help record, press the vinyl (which is kind of expensive), print jackets or covers, cover the expense of plastic bags, and shipping to you!

If we don't reach the goal, you will be reimbursed, so no risk at all.  Think of it as a "pre-order on steroids", in which you lose nothing if this campaign doesn't get funded.

The last three projects Grave robber has done have been through crowd funding.  Our track record has been pretty darned good in accomplishing our goal in a timely fashion and getting product to our fans as quickly as humanly possibly.  This project will be no exception!  It is of GREAT importance that you not only help fund this project, but that you spread the word via Twitter, Facebook, etc.  Indiegogo makes this very simple to do via their share tools!  Plus, let's be honest, it's pretty fun to see something you are responsible for making happen come to fruition, right??

Ok, let's do this!!!

story:
My first full length album is almost complete. As a singer/ songwriter, It is a dream come true to be recording 12 of my original songs for you all to enjoy. But I need your help to get me over the finish line. By pre ordering and pre paying for your copy of the album, you will help me realise my dream and bring it all to completion.

 

 

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Dear friends, fans, and family

The time has come yet again to ask you the people for kind LOVE and support.  We have been hard at work touring our Debut album across Canada.  We rocked the East Coast last summer and had the pleasure of gracing stages at Bluesfest, E.L.E. Festival, Festival de L'Outaouais Émergent and Ottawa Fashion Week.  Along the way we had the opportunity to support Juno winners Digging Roots, ECMA winner Carmen Townsend, EastCoast bluesman Ross Neilsen, Ottawa's very own #1 JW-Jones and Montreal's We Are Wolves.

Our Debut charted across the country breaking the Earshots! Top 10 at 7 different stations & ''Shake Your Boots'' was chosen by the Ottawa Citizen as one of the 20 best songs of 2013!  We doubled the amount of shows played in 2012 and continue to tour regularly. We even released a beautiful DVD filmed at our album release party!

All of this has felt like such a whirlwind and now it is time to give you, the fans, a second offering.  The sophomore album will include various guest artists on saxophone, cello, trumpet, organ, backing vocals and, you guessed it, BASS.  It will feature brazilian jazz textures, afro-cuban rhythms, and a tremendous amount of fresh new sounds.

Having spent the last two years grinding it out on the road & in the clubs we now know that it takes more then just two dudes with a steadfast rock n' roll attitude to get it done.  It takes a TEAM.  A booking agent (Dan Wolovick), a grant writer (Samantha Everts), a publicist (Gregg Clark), a visual artist (Laura Jean), a cinematographer (Pascal Huot), a tour van (TheLoveMachine), a sound engineer (David Pratt).

We are reaching out to you for help in covering some of the costs associated with this recording project.  Namely the manufacturing costs which will allow us to get the record out to all you beautiful people!!

What We Need

We have 60 days to raise $3200 dollars to put towards the launch of our sophomore album! Donations of all shapes and sizes are appreciated...

Thank you for your kind love and support throughout this amazing process,
ROCK ON GOOD PEOPLE!!

The money will be spent on:

Recording Equipment Rentals
Session Musicians
Mixing/Mastering
Album Art
Manufacturing & Distribution
Marketing/Promotion/Video

For those who don't know:

StillNative is a "Rawbeat" Rock duo with a seriously greasy groove, classic songwriting, tight vocal hooks, and a straight ahead rock n' roll attitude. Propelled by a subtle mambo, and New Orleans back-beat this duo is sure to leave you craving more of that heavy beat.


Be sure to share this with your friends on Twitter, Facebook, or just tell someone !! Thank you.

- The Boys
story_txt: Dear friends, fans, and familyThe time has come yet again to ask you the people for kind LOVE and support.  We have been hard at work touring our Debut album across Canada.  We rocked the East Coast last summer and had the pleasure of gracing stages at Bluesfest, E.L.E. Festival, Festival de L'Outaouais Émergent and Ottawa Fashion Week.  Along the way we had the opportunity to support Juno winners Digging Roots, ECMA winner Carmen Townsend, EastCoast bluesman Ross Neilsen, Ottawa's very own #1 JW-Jones and Montreal's We Are Wolves.Our Debut charted across the country breaking the Earshots! Top 10 at 7 different stations & ''Shake Your Boots'' was chosen by the Ottawa Citizen as one of the 20 best songs of 2013!  We doubled the amount of shows played in 2012 and continue to tour regularly. story:
Nightosaur

Epic metal band Nightosaur of Minneapolis is releasing our third full length album, Set Fire To The Mountain, on September 26th.  This is our first album as a three piece band and our first album with a new drummer.  It was recorded last October with Neil Weir at Old Blackberry Way in Minneapolis, and is being pressed on 150 gram limited edition vinyl.  This is your opportunity to pre-order it and receive some other very special perks.

Set Fire To The Mountain

Many of you have known about Nightosaur for several years.  We've been playing around the Twin Cities and the Midwest since 2010.  This is a new Nightosaur, an evolved Nightosaur.  Original members Andy Webber (guitars/vocals) and John Henry (bass/vocals) are joined by the newest Nightosaur, Brad Schwab, on the drums.  Our music is better and weirder than ever before.  Set Fire To The Mountain is 44 minutes of epic tales of monsters and deities, science and magic, glory and war.  We love this record and we know you will too.

Click on the link below to hear a song!

Devourer

Album art by guitarist Andy Webber


How you can help

We need our record in your ears!  Please understand that this record is already in production.  Studio time, mastering, and vinyl pressing have all been paid for.   This is your opportunity to ensure that you won't miss out on this limited edition vinyl pressing.  This vinyl edition is limited to 250 copies on 150 gram vinyl with hand silk-screened covers.  Set Fire To The Mountain is coming.  Don't be left behind.  In addition to vinyl and digital versions of the record, we have a bunch of other Nightosaur merch and special offers.  

Playing rock'n'roll has never been a lucrative thing.  We do it because we love it.  We've been fortunate enough to be able to do lots of cool things over the years, and if we are going to continue to do them, we need your help.  We are putting this record out on vinyl because YOU asked for it.  Help us make your dreams come true! 

    Nightosaur P.A.L.Squad

    For the first time ever, you can become a member of our elite fan club, Nightosaur P.A.L.Squad!  (Paleolithic Anthropomorphized Lizard Squad)  This includes an exclusive P.A.L.Squad t-shirt designed by former Nightosaur second guitarist Max Clark and a numbered membership card which will qualify you for periodic drawings and prize giveaways including merch and guest list spots.  P.A.L.Squad enrollment will only be available at limited times and this is the only way to get this exclusive t-shirt design, which will be offered in both men's and women's sizes!

    Shirt colors yet to be finalized


    Release Show

    Set Fire To The Mountain is set to be released on Friday September 26th at the 331 Club in Northeast Minneapolis.  Joining us at this show will be Gay Witch Abortion and Bongonya.  Unless otherwise arranged, album pre-orders and other merch can be picked up at this show.

    Tell Your Friends

    Please tell your friends about our album and link them to this page.  You can find more Nightosaur at:

     https://www.facebook.com/Nightosaur and

    https://twitter.com/nightosaur

    our first two albums can be downloaded for free at:

    http://nightosaur.bandcamp.com/

    Thank you...we love you!

    Special thanks to UnderCurrentMPLS for live video footage!


    Here's the first of the new sticker designs...this is included in all pre-order packages at $10 or more!

    Sticker #2!
